report.summary: I keep receving coded texts , after uninstallation.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I installed text secure based off a recommendation by a friend. I realized most of my contacts don't use this service so I uninstalled it. I now have two contacts that use text secure , and whenever they attempt to text me I get a unreadable message. Like this : HHJABBAOOIWHAHS3123191362ASAIHASBSD814612401246+KABQIWRB7579127. It is not a HUGE deal but its quite a hassle , for them and for me, to constantly remind them that they cant use text secure when messaging me. I assume that since I used to use TextSecure , that somehow it is still thinking that I can receive secure messagaes ? Even after uninstallation? ( Clarification : I can message Textsecure users , and they receive " Hey , how are you" , however when they respond all I receive is " KAKSHHAO+89HABIFUBIWOH+AISHBASFIUASF" , when in reality they said " I'm good how are you") I have done alot of research and I was told that sometimes it takes the developers some time to * unregister* phone numbers ; however it has been over 2 months. Any ideas or suggestions would be immensely helpful!

report.summary: Irregular behavior in multitasking screen
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, I installed TextSecure yesterday and came across an irregular behavior on the multitasking screen on my Nexus 4, running Android 4.2.2. Steps to reproduce: Open TextSecure plus two other random apps Go to the mutitasking screen Swipe one of the two random apps to the right. This is what happens: the app is removed from the list, the list stays open (expected behavior) Now swipe TextSecure to the right (one other app still has to be in the list) Result: TextSecure is removed from the list and the multitasking screen is closed immediately. Expected behavior: Usually, the multitasking screen would remain open until the last app has been removed. Furthermore, if I want to re-access the multitasking screen directly after it has been closed( by removing TextSecure from the list), it does not react - I have to wait around three seconds before the multitasking button starts reacting again.

report.summary: Feature request for TextSecure: Statistics for SMS
report.label: None yet
report.description: As someone whith a limited amount of free sms per month it would be great to have a statistic of how many sms I send in the last month, or something similar. Normally I would use an additional app for this, but since TextSecure has it's own storage for sms (which is great, because it's encrypted) those apps won't work. I know that this isn't a high priority feature but it would still be great to have it. Kind regards David.

report.summary: no way to override old/wrong key by scanning
report.label: None yet
report.description: it should be possible to override a stored key by scanning a new one. but it just says "warning, the scanned key does not match!". if the user knows that the old key is outdated/gone, it should be possible to say "use the scanned key" at this place.

report.summary: no way to delete key of contact
report.label: None yet
report.description: manage identity keys - touch contact. it shows the contact key then, but no way to delete or update it.

report.summary: SMS database corrupted somehow
report.label: None yet
report.description: This might not be a very useful issue, since I'm recalling what happened from memory, but it was bad enough to be reported I think. I lost around 3 months of text messages. Yesterday I was trying to send a push text to another TS user. After hitting the send button a dialog appeared below the message bubble saying something like "click here for insecure fallback mode". I had never seen this before and was reluctant to send an insecure message so I ignored it and tried again, same dialog. I don't recall what I did next to try to remedy the situation, I might have force closed textsecure, I'm not sure. But when I returned to the list of messages, all the contact names where "anonymous", but the icon for each thread looked correct. I then tried to create a new text message to myself, this brought up a text thread for a completely different person. I realized something was very wrong, so I decided to export my text messages and reinstall textsecure. I did this, and was not able to import the encrypted database. Once it just said "bad password", once it allowed me to, but all of the texts read "bad encrypted message". I should also add that I have not been able to "register" with textsecure again through sms. I click register and the text never comes. However the calling method works. I hope this is helpful.

report.summary: Messages only arriving one-way
report.label: None yet
report.description: Me and a friend of mine got the client up to date. Myself on Android, she's on iOS. When she sends messages to me, they arrive promptly, however, when I send messages to her, they either don't arrvie at all or 3-5 days after being sent. Any ways to fix this? (did already browse some older issues, but none of them could solve the problem)

report.summary: Dual Sim support
report.label: None yet
report.description: Please add support for dual simcard so dual simcard phones can choose sending options.

report.summary: Warning when the "last resort" prekey is used (and forward secrecy is compromised)
report.label: None yet
report.description: As far as I understand the protocol, a "last resort" prekey (that doesn't provide forward secrecy) is used for offline session establishment if all regular prekeys on the server have been used. Are users warned if that situation occurs?

report.summary: Cannot send unencrypted message
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, I'm trying to send unencrypted message to my friend that uses Text Secure. We're currenty over secure session. I've long pressed send button and selected "Send unencrypted" but my message is still encrypted. How can I send unencrypted messages to my contacts in Text Secure?

report.summary: Lock Button in Notification DropDown
report.label: None yet
report.description: Several updates ago we lost the ability to quickly lock TextSecure by pressing the little lock button in the dropdown notification that says "TextSecure is Unlocked". Getting that little feature back would be awesome!!!

report.summary: Trying to split text at 60 chars instead of 160
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've been using TextSecure for a while and love it. Great work everyone. Recently my wife got a new phone. We re-exchanged keys and everything works okay. Except when I'm typing to her I see X/60 at the bottom. Rather than splitting up the text at 160 chars it tries to split it at 60 characters. She's the only contact I have that does this. the rest still do 160 characters. I'm running the latest version on the Play Store. If I need to supply any additional debug info I can.

report.summary: displayed timestamp is offset by an hour
report.label: None yet
report.description: Ver 2.0.8 on Android 4.4.2. Believe relatively new problem. Displayed TXTs show a timestamp of +1 hour in the message list. When I look at message details, received TXTs have a sent time around an hour in the future. The received time looks correct. Does not seem to correlate/change with senders timezone. Re-searched after posting and see some other that imply 'Sent time' is merely displaying what the carrier presents. Is my carrier merely using a +1 timezone from my local, so this expected? Is there a reason the received time isn't displayed in the message list? Definitely arguable, but displaying received seems like a reasonable default.

report.summary: Add Unknown Number To Contact List
report.label: None yet
report.description: Currently there is no way to easily add an unknown number to the contact list. There should be an option in the long-press menu of a thread and in the extra options menu in the in-thread view to add a number to your contacts. Currently you have to write the number down, then add it to your contacts manually.

report.summary: I can't send sms to a textsecure user
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have shutdown wifi and 3g. Now i can't have a data connection. But when i send a message to a textsecure user my application tries send this message with push, not with sms. When i turn on data connection, message can be sent (but with push) (I'm sorry for my english, i hope you can understand)

report.summary: [BUG] New contacts only displayed in TextSecure and not regular app
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have a problem. Since I installed TextSecure, when I use my phone's default "People" application to add new contacts, they are not displayed. The application saves them, but doesn't display them anywhere. When I open TextSecure though, there they are. So TS can see those new contacts, but the "People" app (which created them) can't. After changing some (may I say random?) settings I managed to fix it. However my friends have the same problem. Please fix it, it's frustrating and I can't get regular people to use it if they encounter problems like this :/ Thank you. p.s.: I'm sorry if it's a known bug, I tried to search for similar posts but couldn't find anything

report.summary: Incompatible with Google Nexus 7 LTE (2013)

report.description: Are there any plans on the horizon to make the TextSecure app compatible with Nexus 7?

report.summary: Message Selection with Link/Number
report.label: None yet
report.description: To select a normal message I can hold anywhere on or beside the message. But if the message contains a link or linked number, then nothing happens if I hold beside the text. If I hold a linked number the dialog shows up but then my phone will open the dial dialog and when I come back the "select menu" is closed again. So the only choice for me to select a message that contains a "linked" number is to hold on a non-linked part of the text (which is quite difficult for messages like "1000"). Can this be reproduced/fixed? Also is there a way to better detect whether a number should be "linked" at all?

report.summary: No notification sound
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, I have just upgraded to a Nexus 5 with CM11. I can receive text and MMS messages but there is no notification sound. The LED and vibrate works fine. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling text secure but that has not fixed the problem, when text secure was uninstalled I tried using the default messaging app and could not receive any test text messages. Does anyone know what the problem might be? Thanks, Ben

report.summary: I can't send sms while my data connection is on
report.label: None yet
report.description: What if I have a data connection but my (TextSecure user) friend haven't? How I reach him? Because I can't send encrypted sms while I have data connection. I think I should be able to send encrypted smses while my data connection is online. Is this so hard to do?

report.summary: Outgoing msgs to non-TS users not shown. New incoming msgs (if received) not brought to top of list.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have rebooted the phone a few times and uninstalled, rebooted, then reinstalled the app. I have searched through the default messaging as well. It's my wife's phone. I have the exact same phone on the exact same network w/no issues so far (knock on wood). Running: Android 4.4.2 Moto G on Boost Mobile systems passphrase encrypted Debug logs Broken phone: http://hastebin.com/uracimajiq Good phone: http://hastebin.com/dupdutacu I am happy to continue assisting debugging, if devs will keep in touch with me :) TIA edit: Usually incoming SMS shows up in notification bar when first received, but nowhere to be found in TS app. double edit: after clearing data and cache, then uninstalling. Messaging is completely broken even for the default app. Is there a way to fix this short of a factory reset? HELP!

report.summary: Unable to send PUSH messages (with possible fix)
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've installed TS, and until a few minutes ago I was unable to send any kind of PUSH message, it was defaulting to SMS, all the time. Admittedly there is only one contact in my list that I can use TS with. The app wasn't recognizing this contact as a TS user, it appeared in the list of TS users, but I could only send SMS (which failed right away because I disabled the SMS send function from the options). From what I can tell the problem is that when I exchanged my identity with this contact (over SMS) I didn't have the international prefix included in his number (he's from another country). This created an entry within my SMS database with that number. After installing TS and being unable to send PUSH messages I noticed this and added the international prefix. Nothing changed and I was still unable to send messages. Upon sending more messages I noticed that at the top of the window, next to the contact name there was still the old number without the prefix. At first I thought this was a display issue, but then I cleared the app's data, redid the initial setup but SKIPPED the SMS import procedure. This fixed the problem. Without any previous SMS to take the number from, the app took it from the contact list (or at least that's what I assume has happened) and of course took the right one. I can now send PUSH without any problem and at this point importing the SMS db worked fine and kept the correct number. I hope this help somebody and can be fixed. Cheers

report.summary: If secure session ends due to SMS fallback on one side when other side can't receive SMS, no way exists to restart session.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have a contact with Textsecure who at one point fell back to SMS during a conversation. My "phone" is a wifi only device and currently receives SMS via Google Voice, so this didn't work. I sent him a message saying I can't fall back to SMS and disabled it on my side, and then got one or two from him later saying that he couldn't restart a secure session. I also got a couple "secure session ended" messages and the "send" UI element turned to the green (should be red, IMO) unlocked one. Now, with network connectivity good, every message I send results in "Error sending message!" with absolutely no additional useful information as to WHY there was an error, WHAT the error was, and WHAT I may do to correct it. There is no UI element to restart a secure session. It doesn't exist, or at least, I can't find it in 5 minutes of searching, which means for all practical purposes it doesn't exist. Thinking to "reset" the state between my contact and myself, I selected "delete thread" and erased our prior messages. He then DISAPPEARED FROM MY CONTACT LIST (wtf?) and, despite having an identity key still in my contact keys, there's no way to re-add him. Once I stumbled upon the send message dialog (still with the green unlocked UI element) somehow - no idea how. Otherwise, it's impossible. I can't add him using his number, or directly from contacts. I rebooted the phone and still can't add him from contacts or by using his number in +1xxxxxxxxxx format. I'll file separate UI bugs, but this is the whole story.

report.summary: Tapping "secure session ended" should offer ability to restart a secure session, or at least an explanation.

"Secure session ended," or in OTR's case, something like "your contact has disabled encryption. you should disable encryption on your side." You're a computer. How about you do it and provide me with a big warning box? In Textsecure's case, tapping "secure session ended" does nothing. Okay, now what? report.summary: make messages visible for other apps
report.label: None yet
report.description: I am using TextSecure as my default app for text messages. However, there is a difference between TextSecure and other apps like my phones default or Hangouts: Using Hangouts or the default app of my phone, I can still access my messages via bluetooth. Third party apps like droidstats or airdroid are able to see the Messages and count them. Using TextSecure, droidstats does not "see" me sending messages and accessing my messages via Message Access Profile (Bluetooth) or Airdroid only yields messages of the time before I started using TextSecure. So I believe that TextSecure stores messages differently, though I don't know what the difference is and if it might be a design-decision (e.g. for security reasons). I see that those third-party apps would probably only work with unencrypted messages, but that would be fine for me. tl;dr: Is it possible to make messages sent and received by TextSecure available in the same way as "the default apps" do? I.e. that they are accessible via MAP or third-party apps, even though some of them might be encrypted. Disclaimer: I've not developed any app for android, so I have very little knowledge about how things work here and if there is a uniform way to store text messages.

report.summary: Unsubscribe users from push on uninstall
report.label: None yet
report.description: When users uninstall textsecure with an active subscription to push service, this subscription is left over. There is no way to tell this from the senders point of view. They just won't answer anymore. You have to talk back to them to get to know that they have uninstalled textsecure. My suggestion is to unsubscribe from push automatically on uninstall and/or add receive notification for sent messages.

report.label: None yet

My main problem is that for the moment, it seems like the TextSecure app can't recognise who among my contacts is a registered TS (push) user. I know at least one of my (international)friends is but when I tap on her number and want to send a message through data the only option that shows up is nonencrypted sms. Also, when I untick the box for sms to non-TS users non of the contacts are displayed when I tap the + icon. Is there something I have to do before I can send messages through data except registering for push or is there something I'm missing? Is there supposed the be some kind of notice if you send over data or via sms at all before you actually send the message and green/blue bubble shows up? I'm running the 2.1.1 version of the app on a G3, I went through the installation process without problems and have registered for push. I had to uninstall and then reinstall the app twice though because the app didn't recognise my password after I locked it. The timed lock feature seems to be broken too because after the set time no password is needed to unlock the app, not sure if that has anything to do with my problem but I thought I should mention it anyway. I'm pretty sure my friend is also running the 2.1.1 version.

report.summary: Sending TextSecure messages between users works only in one direction under certain circumstances
report.label: None yet
report.description: There is contact X and contact Y using TextSecure. X and Y used to send each other TextSecure messages but recently, things changed. X can still send TextSecure messages to Y. Y can receive them but is not given the possibility to send back TextSecure messages to X (the interface is offering secure SMS). The following is the story about how I fixed it and probably also contains the cause of the error: After searching for a while I noticed the following on Y's phone: When pressing "+" to start a new conversation, X was presented as TextSecure User with his phone number +49170854----. After clicking on the contact item of X, the conversation view opened and now on the top of the screen the was X name and below his phone number +490170854---- (note the additional 0 after the country code). Now I searched the phones local phone book for that number. It was quite a mess with the +49170-number being part of at least two contacts. And then I found the +490170-number, which was part of a Skype-contact and could not be edited. I asked X to delete the additional 0 from his Skype-account. Then I deleted the local Skype-contact entry in Y's phone book. After I cleared data and cache of TextSecure on X's device and on Y's device and re-registered both to the TextSecure push-service, everything worked again. Debug logs (a bit messy): X's phone: http://hastebin.com/iwipawemob Y's phone: http://hastebin.com/xakubapiro

report.summary: Push messages late and UI and Media Requests
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, It's the second time i post something here so i don't really how the thing goes but i got several thing i would like to adress regarding the app. If i need to open several thread i will :) Usually i don't experience problem with push message but at the moment one of my contact is in China ( i'm in europe) and it appear quite often that messages are delayed (in comparison to whatsapp). The second problem is that when the message is finally delivered - 5-15 minute later- the order is mixed up (eg: a message sent at 12:00 will be after one sent at 12:01). I believe it is more server sided and a connectivity problem but i wanted to address it even though i have no proposition to fix that. There is a total non-sense in the UI with a sliding panel on the left and the option menu. In my sense they should be only one; lets say the sliding menu as it's trendy at the moment hence the option button could trigger the slide. I could be nice to have the media button directly in the conversation ( e.g: next to the lock) and not in the menu. Regarding media again i have only access to the gallery not the camera ( but might be my cellphone the problem ). Hence it could be more comfortable to share "stuff" if there was a camera option next to the gallery one. 5)Still regarding the media; I saw it has been already noticed but as it hasn't changed since.... : pictures compressions are too heavy. I understand that bandwidth is expensive but the picture are not "readable" like that. I think that's all and hope i wasn't too negative as i really enjoy the app :) regards,

report.summary: Handling of new devices has security implications
report.label: None yet
report.description: Currently, when a new device is set up this disables any old ones, presumably to increase security. However, due to how this is handled in details this IMHO has pretty serious security implications: It makes it much easier to take over an account for prolonged periods. If someone gets access to the SIM for even just a second they can connect to that phone number. They then will receive messages directed to that number. The legitimate user will however not be warned of this in any way. He will get generic "sending failed" messages. Worse, if encrypted SMS fallback is enabled, he might not even notice anything is wrong. The recipient will get these messages, but they will not be decrypted, thus making it even easier for the attacker to appear legitimate. Even if the user figures out that someone took over his account, there is no obvious way to fix this. The only one I could figure out is clearing app data, however then he loses his private key and the people he communicates with have no reason to trust him over the attacker. It makes it impossible to securely and with little effort switch to a new device. Normally this would be done by distributing a hash of the new private key via the old trusted channel. However before linking the new device its private key/hash is not known (I have not tried if skipping linking a phone number at first would be possible and help), whereas once the linking is done the old device can't be used to distribute the new hashes.

report.summary: Could GCM messages be lost when more than 100 pending messages are enqueued?
report.label: None yet
report.description: If I understand the current status correctly, the Android version of TextSecure uses GCM exclusively. According to the GCM documentation, only 100 messages will be stored if the receiving device is offline; if that limit is exceeded, all queued messages will be deleted: http://developer.android.com/google/gcm/adv.html#lifetime Is this currently handled on the server side, or could messages potentially be lost? Could the iOS store-and-forward implementation be used to solve that problem?

report.summary: Auto delete messages
report.label: None yet
report.description: Auto delete messages I'd like to request that feature again because many people already requested it in some issues, but there were some privacy concerns and it could be interesting to talk about them and maybe, after finding a good solution, to implement the feature! ;) So the idea is that messages automatically get deleted from the phones somehow. The suggestion that someone could delete the message from all phones remotely let some privacy concerns come up as you should have full control about which messages get deleted from your phone and which do not... Another idea (what I do appreciate) is the option to disable history like it's possible on hangouts (messages get deleted after some time automatically). For example messages get automatically deleted 24 hours after you read them. This could be an option in the conversation itself and you get the message "history turned off". Every participant should have the option to turn it off/on and it applies for all the participants. Like that there's no confusion and all people in the conversation should be happy with this solution and can turn it on/off like they want to do. The messages should of course have another color if history is turned off ;) I do like this feature, the only privacy concern could be that you can still capture screenshots of it, but maybe taking screenshots could generally be disabled in the app or you get a notification that someone took a screenshot (what should be possible somehow because it works on snapchat e.g., too, right?). Do you think this would be possible or do you have some other concerns? Is such a function too hard to implement or would you even like that feature? :)

report.summary: Feature request - email to text
report.label: None yet
report.description: Love textsecure, been using it for years. Got a little feature request. I'm a sysadmin, about to be in the company's on-call rotation. We get nagios alerts sent to our phones via emailing the carrier's email-to-text service. Is it possible to export my public key for textsecure so I can use it to run a script on our nagios servers which calls gpg, uses my public key to encrypt the message contents, and then sends the encrypted message via my carrier's email-to-text service, and have it automatically decrypted in textsecure, even though there's been no key exchange via textsecure's api? Is this already possible and I just don't know how? Thanks guys, really love this program, and really looking forward to the ios port (my gf's on an iphone, and we're loving Signal, can't wait for encrypted messaging, too).

report.summary: how to create a whatsapp like application using textsecure source code
report.label: None yet
report.description: Can any one tell how to create Same whatsapp like application using the text secure source code

report.summary: MMS forward broken
report.label: None yet
report.description: When I choose forward on a picture message the recipient list appears, but after choosing a person, the message text will be in the new message but not the picture. Ive tried on several occasions. Is this intended behavior? Samsung Galaxy S4 on Sprint.

report.summary: Delete message fails when call phone number selected
report.label: None yet
report.description: When I get a message containing only (or almost only) a phone number and I want to delete it this is quite difficult. When I long press the message, Textsecure both shows the upper toolbar with the delete button and I get a complete action dialog box from Android offering several ways to call the number (phone, skype, strangely not Redphone which I have also installed). When I press back to remove this dialog and then press the delete button it does nothing (well, at leat it does not delete the selected message). It doesn't show any message or error.

report.summary: Secure session isn't ended when Bob stops using TS
report.label: None yet
report.description: A friend of mine could never get TS secure to work on their Huawai Android 4.3 system. I had exchanged some messages with them. After they uninstalled TS on their phone, my TS kept thinking they were using TS and kept sending all messages as encrypted. I.e. they always got garbled text instead of the message. I had to select 'End Secure Session' to stop this. The latter should happen automatic somehow.

report.summary: yet another mms failed download
report.label: None yet
report.description: hello, sometimes mms get downloaded, i noticed this happens when i'm NOT using a vpn connection, be it wifi or or mobile data. just got an mms while being on wifi+vpn and it failed again. log here: http://hastebin.com/suxotasolu

report.summary: TS on cyanogen
report.label: None yet
report.description: I am only writing this as a bug because it's unclear if I need to run TS on cyanogen. Specifically I am on CM11 m9 (m10 soon), I read somewhere that CM incorporates TS functionallity for both CM users and TS users. Currently I am using only TS, but if can roll back to the CM messenger and still have private conversation with TS users. Well, that would be good to know. Please help clarify.

report.summary: TS adding new contact
report.label: None yet
report.description: It seems when adding a new contact from the TS app, the info is lost going into the people app. I am running TS on CM11m9, using the stock people (contact) app

report.summary: PreKeyEntity member initialization
report.label: None yet
report.description: The private member 'registrationId' in the constructor of class PreKeyEntity (src\org\whispersystems\textsecure\push\PreKeyEntity.java) is assigned with itself. I assume this is not intended.

report.summary: WhishperPush Integration
report.label: None yet
report.description: Some iota of intelligence or integration in Textsecure with systems running whisper-push (CyanogenMod) would be amazing. My interpretation of this stance here is by lack of integration and support directly from whispersystems is that whispersystems would prefer its users use textsecure app and NOT whisperpush... However this isn't explicitly stated, but seems to be implied

report.summary: Feature Request: WhisperPush Integration
report.label: None yet
report.description: Please make Textsecure integrate with whisperpush.. change color when texts are encrypted via whisperpush on systems where whisperpush exists disable integrated push and encryption system (Or offer migration options between the two) Make Public Key and key verification dialog use whisherpush database instead of integrated. detect when users are forwarding via whisperpush and behave appropriately..

report.summary: Feature Request: Detect and warn about WhisperPush
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, TextSecure should detect if WhisperPush is enabled in the system (did not check how - I guess you can somehow read arbitrary system settings with the right permissions) and then warn the user to switch it off (and instead enable push messages in TS). Here's why: It's actually possible to install TS on a system with WhisperPush as long as you don't turn on push messages. Obviously that makes little sense, but users might still do it, and it leads to a mess, as stated in #1925 .

report.summary: TS canot lock a message
report.label: None yet
report.description: TS is awesome, but one feature missing fromthe stock messenger app is the ability to lock a message withing a thread. As you know, in the stock messenger (well on CM11) I can lock messages from friends with pics, dates to remmeber, etc. and if I try to delete the entire thread. Those messages are not deleted and remain after everything else in the thread is. TS should support this to be a total messager replacement.

report.summary: approve language requests on transifex
report.label: None yet
report.description: please approve the language requests for textsecure and redphone on transifex. i'd like to contribute a translation but am unable due to the pending request.

report.summary: Please add unsafe SMS groups (because MMS are expensive)
report.label: None yet
report.description: I am aware of the decision to fade out SMS/MMS support for security reasons. Unfortunately, I still need to (unsafely) communicate with people with "feature phones". (Think: older people that do not want to (or cannot) use a smart phone.) Currently groups with such people are created as MMS groups. Would it be possible to create SMS groups instead? MMS are expensive for me, and I have an SMS flat rate.

report.description: I am on a Samsung Galaxy S5 with Android version 4.4.2, kernel revision 3.4.0-2089860, build number KOT49H.G900FXXU1ANG. TextSecure is of version 2.1.8. The log in the link below contains both an unsuccessful sending (with Wifi connection available) and a successful one (with Wifi disabled). Please tell me if I should provide more information. http://hastebin.com/usawemiqeq

report.summary: TextSecure not catching all incoming SMS
report.label: None yet
report.description: It works fine for some of my contacts but there seem to be some that never get picked up in TextSecure and instead show up in the default Android messages app. I have TextSecure configured to handle all messages but no luck.

report.summary: cannot send sms to textsecure users even unencrypted
report.label: None yet
report.description: That pretty much sums it up. Cannot send sms to textsecure users even unencrypted. Had to revert to system messaging to send texts to my friends that don't have data.:-(

report.summary: textsecure shows only phone number instead of contact name for some received SMS in the notification bar
report.label: None yet
report.description: behavior seems to be random. sometimes it shows the number, sometimes it shows the contact name.

report.summary: TextSecure Android app cannot verify phone number in Korea.
report.label: None yet
report.description: In Korea, most of carriers are providing anti-SMS phishing service by default. This service puts "[Web발신]\n" prefix to SMS body when they are sent through automated sending service. As a result, TextSecure app cannot recognize received verification code due to it only matches message begins with "Your TextSecure verification code: " (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/service/SmsListener.java#L129). I think this matching filter should include wildcard in front of word "Your" or Throw away everything except last line and filter with them. Here is screenshot of message which I received.

report.summary: What does play-services dependency introduce?
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've been compiling TextSecure for a while now, since @moxie0 has been nice enough to gradle it all together. Today, I noticed new requirements/dependencies for the gradle build for v2.1.8. It specifically calls for com.google.android.gms:play-services:5.0.89. As a gapp-less user, will this cause issues with installation? Am I doing something wrong that I need these dependencies? If they are now required, what potential issues does this raise? Thanks

report.summary: Group chat optimization
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, I read on your blog post (https://whispersystems.org/blog/private-groups/) about some optimizations that could be done to group chats. Unfortunately I happen to spend a lot of time in places where the internet connection isn't so good, and this is often a problem. For example: I send a message to the 5 other members of the group; While the application is sending the message to the 3rd recipient, the 1st already has the message and answers back; Since the internet connection of the 1st is better than mine, the 4th and 5th recipients often get the 1st's message before mine -- that is, they see the message with the answer before the message with the question. Is anything being done to improve the speed of messages sent in group chats? It's not only slightly annoying, it's also causing many problems because it's not so easy to understand "who is answering which message" when messages come in the wrong order. Thank you

report.summary: Wrong key for contact and can't end secure session
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, I have the stock Android 4.4 on a Motorola Moto G and my friend has Cyanogen Mod with TS as standard SMS app. We used it before on another phone, so now he has a different key. Mine however stayed the same. I can't tell my TS to switch his key. He also doesn't receive my messages (they're probably encrypted with the wrong key? Our numbers stayed the same). I do receive his though. I also receive messages with a key symbol and TS tells me that this might mean that someone's trying to intercept messages (I don't remember the exact message). Anyway, so I tried to end the secure session and it said session cancelled but I guess it didn't really cancel it because the "cancel secure session" didn't disappear. My friend send me his new key via QR-code by email and when I wanted to verify it, I got the message, that this is not the same key. Well, I knew that ...;) Is there a way to delete his key on my phone and start a new encrypted converation? Does it have something to do with me using the App from Google Play and him using the integrated CM app? Why can't I cancel the secure session? Shouldn't that always be possible? thanks!

report.summary: Lost all my conversations (again), how come?
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hey, I just reached for my blinking mobile (Nexus One, MIUI 2.3.23, Android 2.3.7) to read a TextSecure message. TS has been restarted (it asked for my passphrase) and after entering that, I see TS has lost all my messages but the newly received one (which is from a group now called Unnamed group). Unlike last time, I did not restart my phone, and instead tried to get some logging data out. I have no USB cable with me unfortunately. On a terminal (on device) as root I tried logcat | grep -E "TextSecure|whispersystems", but all I got was W/PartProvider( 2725): Got master secret: org.whispersystems.textsecure.crypto.MasterSecret@406b92a0 (... or so... beware, I typewrote that) So I guess the ringbuffer is already emptied, meh. Do you know of any way of getting my messages and pictures back? Can I supply you with more information so we can get to the cause of this? Losing the TS database happened to me once before; Last time, I put the blame on the failing battery and subsequent file system recovery. This time, it just happened like that. Of course I tell all my friends to keep backups, of course I have none. So maybe it's just Karma. Meh.

report.summary: In-thread Notification incorrectly applied when screen is locked but conversation still open
report.label: None yet
report.description: First of all, the technical details: Nexus S (Crespo) with CyanogenMod 11-20140916-SNAPSHOT-M10-crespo, Android 4.4.4 Now the problem: It seems, that TextSecure doesn't notify me about new received Messages when i lock the Phone while keeping the Conversation open, even if the Option "In-thread notifications" is checked. No Vibration, no Sound and no Icon in the status Bar.

report.summary: Option to disable "Enable TextSecure messages? ..."
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have disables the push delivery because it does not allways deliver messages and is very slow compared to encrypted sms messages. Currently it is not possible to permanently remove the big green "Enable TextSecure messages? ..." which takes up 25% of the screen.

report.summary: Some mobile carriers distort the verification SMS
report.label: None yet
report.description: Currently TextSecure requires the verification SMS to be exactly Your TextSecure verification code: NNN[N]-NNN[N]. But some mobile carriers apparently append or prepend a certain text to the original SMS. The relevant portion of the verification code should accept them as well. In my particular case, Korean carriers have prepended [Sent from Web] to every SMS sent from non-mobile devices as a (poor) countermeasure to SMS spams, and TextSecure simply misses them. While this (dis)service is optional, it is opt-out and many Korean users are likely affected.

report.summary: Set default communication channel per TextSecure contact
report.label: None yet
report.description: When using TextSecure as SMS replacement app, there occurs an issue if one contact tries out TextSecure but then decides to go back to some other IM. Then TextSecure always pre-selects sending a secure push message - which will never arrive because the contact no longer uses TextSecure. So either one should be able to set the default communication channel for TextSecure contacts back to unsecure SMS, or at least TextSecure should remember the last communication channel per contact and default to that for the next message.

report.summary: Display sent time instead of received time (again)
report.label: None yet
report.description: This issue already has been resolved once (WhisperSystems#597) but now TextSecure version 2.1.8 again displays the received time instead of the sent time for SMS.

report.summary: photos occasionally not downloaded over push
report.label: None yet
report.description: nexus 5 android 4.4.4 push TS 2.1.8 sometimes when i receive photos as attachments they don't download, they thumbnail stays in download mode forever, force quitting and starting again doesn't help. i'm suspecting it can be caused by a handover from data-wifi or vice versa, where the internet connection drops for a bit. i frequently (dis-)connect to wifi networks. my contacts complain about the same problem, i have to re-send photos that show the completed status on my side. so the sender has no indication that the delivery failed. log might be too new :( http://hastebin.com/loduruqiga

report.summary: Video attachment size too small
report.label: None yet
report.description: Somewehre in the issues Video size limit is stated to be 1MB. I had to decrease the size of my Video to be bellow 300KB. It was sent to a push contact and a push groupchat, no MMS was involved. That's so small, that it's almost useless to even start with Video editing to get it down to this size.

report.summary: Feature request: ability to change background image
report.label: None yet
report.description: Ability to change background image would be nice to have.

report.summary: Closing App - Strange Home Screen Behavior
report.label: None yet
report.description: HTC One M8 with CM 11 running on 4.4.4 rooted I notice when I go to close the app within recently opened apps once I close TextSecure, it kicks me out of recent apps and goes back to home screen and freezes for a second. I also noticed volume buttons dont work sometimes which is strange, I cant figure out how to reproduce.

report.summary: TS doesn't send messages on slow connection
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, I have a problem. My internet provider slows my phone's connection after I reach 1GB of data. It slows it so I can't go faster than 30KB/s, but that's better than nothing. The problem is that although I am able to use other messaging applications (internet is slow, but still works), TextSecure doesn't send messages. At all. I do receive them, but I can't send them. They never go from the dull blue to the bright blue. And what's even worse is that even if after I connect the phone to a WiFi, it won't send those messages. Any ideas? I know I could send SMSs, but I'm looking for a solution and not a workaround. Thank you

report.summary: Can we support the dual simcards phone both can send secure message?
report.label: None yet
report.description:
Dear TextSecure develop team, I am a honest user and a developer based on your source code. There are some problems while I am using the TextSecure app recently.
1. We can send the push message and sms message if we change another simcard which is not the same as the register number. But there will be some problems if we send a secure sms message, cause the simcard number is not the same as the register number, besides that, it will leads to anther secret key exchange, if we exchange it again the new received message or secure sms message seems crupt and can not be decrypt in our app. Reproduce steps: 1) register with number 180..... 2) remove the simcard and insert anther simcard 3) send a secure message to a friend in our contacts 4) send a sms messgae to the same number above 5) send a secure message to the same number above you can find some problems here...
2. Can not choose which simcard to send the sms message with a dural sim cards support phone, so my question is can we support the dual simcards phone both can send secure message?
I am waiting for your help, thanks!

report.summary: In the registration number and mobile phone number do not match, messaging and security SMS?
report.label: None yet
report.description: I am a honest user and a developer based on your source code. There are some problems while I am using the TextSecure app recently. We can send the push message and sms message if we change another simcard which is not the same as the register number. But there will be some problems if we send a secure sms message, cause the simcard number is not the same as the register number, besides that, it will leads to anther secret key exchange, if we exchange it again the new received message or secure sms message seems crupt and can not be decrypt in our app. Reproduce steps: register with number 180..... remove the simcard and insert another simcard send a secure message to a friend in our contacts send a sms messgae to the same number above send a secure message to the same number above you can find some problems here... I am waiting for your help, thanks!

report.summary: show symbol when communication partner had read message
report.label: None yet
report.description: Most other text messengers have a small icon on each message which shows status (send, received, read). Espacally the update whether a user has read a message is very helpful. I miss this feature in TextSecure. Because of the traffic, this feature shouldn't be available for SMS.

report.summary: Feature request: Multi-device syncing without putting keys in the cloud
report.label: None yet
report.description: I'd love the ability to use Signal/TextSecure as my primary messaging app, but the lack of multi-device syncing is holding me back. At the same time, I know that most services that offer multi-device syncing (Hangouts, iMessage, etc) do so by storing your keys in the cloud, making your communications snoopable. So, I think it would be cool if I could get multi-device syncing from WhisperSystems apps, through directly transferring my secret key from one device to another, for example through NFC or WiFi direct. This might call for decoupling WhisperSystems IDs from PSTN phone numbers.

report.summary: Bad encrypted message
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, I have to report a weird bug. The other day I sent a message to a group chat. "N" receives the message just fine, and answers back. "A" responds to me in a private conversation (all this is happening via push), probably saying they couldn't read my message (?), but their message appears as "bad encrypted message". Annoyed by this problem that has always plagued me since the very day I installed TextSecure (it keeps happening every once in a while), I end the secure session with A, unregister from the push service and register again. Now A can read my messages and I can read theirs. Yesterday I posted another message to the same group. A could read it and respond, while N couldn't. However, when N writes me in a private chat between us alone, everything works fine (we read each other's messages). This "Bad encrypted message" has been affecting me -- and my friends -- ever since we installed the application. Is there a reason why it happens? Please find a fix, I feel embarrassed for recommending my friends this application and causing them all these troubles.

report.summary: Recipient has no identity key.

What should we do? Also, is there a way to force your device to completely forget the keys of a TS user and start again as. If it were your first text with them? I feel like that would fix some problems I occasionally have.

report.summary: Send SMS to multiple recipients without creating a group

In my case, I don't send messages to one well defined group all the time, it is very usual that I send a message to a group +/- 2 or 3 recipients. And it is often for only one or two messages. Those are the reasons why I think that having a way to send SMS to multiple recipients without creating a group could be useful. Thanks Thorleif, PS: I apologize if anyone suggests it yet but I haven't found with keyword and I have not enough time to scroll every issues.

report.summary: Unable to Message Users That Uninstalled TextSecure
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've seen this mentioned a few times about 8 months back, and I'm just wondering: what's the current solution to this problem? Let's say the user is unwilling to re-install TS to de-register their account from the network. What's the plan at that point? I've had this happen with a few friends, even just when they've had to temporarily use loner phones, and it's fairly frustrating. I spend a bit of time each day reading on privacy and security. They're very important to me, and for someone like me/us, having to mess around with this stuff is no big deal. But for the average person? Believe me, bits of friction like this are more than enough to turn them off completely, making widespread adoption all but impossible. If you need any additional information, don't hesitate to ask.

report.summary: Use Google Play Services 6.5 for reduced APK size and compile time
report.label: None yet
report.description: From an article on Android Police: "Google's final announcement [about Google Play Services 6.5] may actually have the greatest impact of all. With the latest release, the GMS library will be broken up into individual parts for each major set of APIs. This will finally alleviate the stress of including the full library, which weighs in at almost exactly 1 MB after it's compiled into an app. For example, an app that only requires push messaging will be able to do so while only increasing its footprint by about 75KB. While most users with current, high-end devices probably don't notice the burden, this is great for older and budget-oriented hardware. This change will also go a long way towards reducing memory usage and download size. Oh yeah, and this should cut a minute or two off of compile times. Hallelujah!"

report.summary: Missing dependencies in the Wki
report.label: None yet
report.description: I compiled according to the Wiki. According to the wiki, the compile dependencies are: "Android SDK manager" "Android Support Repository" - this need to be installed via the Android SDK manager "Java Development Kit (JDK)" compiler for example openjdk-devel - JRE alone is not enough. At least version 7 of Java is required. Despite having the dependencies, compiling didn't work, it complained about a missing com.google.android.gms:play-services. I had to install the following additional packages: "Google Play Services, Google Repository, Google Play services for Froyo". I don't know if all of these were needed, but I am sure Google Repository was needed. This made the compiler go a lot further. (It still fails but it's probably be an unrelated issue) After doing this, the compilation went a bit further, but now there's a new error:

report.summary: Updating the wiki (Building from the sources)
report.label: None yet
report.description: I would like to update the "Prerequisites" section of the Wiki, because the list is incomplete and compiling fails unless several additional packages which are not mentioned in the wiki are installed via the Android Package Manager. However, I believe I installed unnecessary packages in addition to the needed ones. Before applying the changes to the Wiki, I would like to reduce the packages to the minimum needed set. Please help me by trimming unneeded fat from the following list: Prerequisites "Android SDK manager" "Java Development Kit (JDK)" compiler for example openjdk-devel - JRE alone is not enough. At least version 7 of Java is required. The following packages should be installed via the package manager: Android Support Repository, Android Support Library, Android SDK build-tools 19, Google Play Services, Android 4.4.2 (API 19) SDK Platform, Android 5.0 (API 21) SDK Platform, Android 4.4W.2 (API 20) SDK Platform, Google Repository.

report.summary: Exception in GcmRefreshJob chrashs TextSecure on start
report.label: None yet
report.description: Since the update to version 2.30 of TextSecure I'm no longer able to start it. I'm using a Xperia Arc S with Android Version 4.04 (API-Level 15). Here the StackTrace: java.lang.RuntimeException: Can't create handler inside thread that has not called Looper.prepare() at android.os.Handler.(Handler.java: 121) at android.widget.Toast$TN. (Toast:317) at android.widget.Toast.(Toast.java:91) at android.widget.Toast.makeText(Toast.java:233) at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.GcmRefreshJob.onRun(GcmRefreshJob.java:41) at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:72) at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46) I typed in the StackTrace by hand, therefore there may be typos. But I think the problem gets clear. I tried to trace back the exception in the source code, and it seemed that the JobConsumer should call Looper.prepare, but didn't do so. On the otherhandside I also wasn't able to find a call to makeText in the GcmRefreshJob and I doesn't look like everybody got this problem. I hope this can be fixed soon. Edit: As I just found out GcmRefreshJob changed in commit bf19307 from 13 hours ago. Maybe this already fixes the problem.

Why is it so hard to: Write it in the changelog Check for the version on app-startup and display some sort of dialog (like google maps, e.g.) Provide support for older versions

report.summary: "Use 24-hour format" system setting ignored
report.label: None yet
report.description: in "Message details" view.

report.summary: "Permanent TextSecure communication failure!" on Android 2.3.7
report.label: None yet
report.description: For about the last two days, I've been getting the notification "Permanent TextSecure communication failure!" with the text "TextSecure was unable to register with Google Play Services. Com". After "Com" I'm was sure there were more letters but they are cut off. I don't know how newer Android versions work, but on 2.3.7 the notifications don't scroll so only by reading through code can I find the text that says "Communication over the data channel has been disabled, please try re-registering from the TextSecure settings menu." Of course, the next problem I have is that I cannot find any "re-register" option in the settings menu. Again, reading code shows me that the RegistrationActivity intent is launched by enabling "Push messages", which is already enabled. So, I do that. And now, finally, I get a warning message. Google Play Services needs to be updated to use this. So there's the issue. I'm actually guessing that I didn't need to re-register, I probably just needed to update Google Play Services. Can't say for sure though, as I've already de-registered. Anyway, the original notification is thrown up by a failed call to GooglePlayServicesUtil.isGooglePlayServicesAvailable(context). Instead of just checking for "resullt != ConnectionResult.SUCCESS", TS could also check for the other possible return values and tell the user the actual reason behind the error.

report.summary: Re-enable encrypted database export

report.summary: Validation - Editable sent message

TS version 2.3.2 Best regards rene

report.summary: Can't send SMS on T-mobile WiFi Calling

I can send PUSH messages over WiFi Calling, and if I disable WiFi calling I can send SMS over the cellular network. If I used the built-in Messaging app, I can send SMS over WiFi Calling with no problem. This seems similar to #2137 so I disabled XPrivacy, but that doesn't fix anything. I'm creating a new issue because I'm not having problems with PUSH messages or with receiving SMS. Device: HTC One M7, T-mobile stock Android 4.4.3, TextSecure 2.3.2 App state: Push registered, incoming SMS enabled, outgoing SMS fully enabled Debug logs: http://hastebin.com/unofirefar

report.summary: add + to blank avatar to clarify that you can add to contacts
report.label: None yet
report.description: After setting up a couple of people with TextSecure, we were all stumped that TextSecure did not have a way to add a new phone number to a Contact. We tried everything we can think of and no luck. So I decided to file a bug report, and found #822 then explored a bit more, and found that you can add an unknown number as a contact by clicking the blank avatar icon. This was not intuitive but I think it can be greatly improved by a simple fix: add a + to the blank avatar icon if clicking it will trigger the "add to contacts" sequence.

report.summary: Wrong PIC Diaslayed... Scarry
report.label: None yet
report.description: On many occasions I have received an MMS message with a PIC attached and the PIC displayed on my phone is not the PIC that was sent to me. It seems to randomly use a PIC that I had received previously. This happens on secure and non secure texts. My device is a Samsung Note 3.

report.summary: Refreshing the directory doesn't update displayed contact list
report.label: None yet
report.description: From the contact chooser, hitting the refresh directory action in the actionbar doesn't update the currently displayed list. You have to close the activity and re-open it.

report.summary: TextSecure plays alert twice
report.label: None yet
report.description: Description: TextSecure plays the new message alert twice when the TextSecure app window is active and a new message comes in. Steps to replicate: Open TextSecure and unlock the database Leave the application active Receive an SMS message Hear alert message played twice (with two plays overlapping) Workaround: Close the TextSecure app or switch to an alternate active window before receiving another SMS. Unknown variables: Does this apply to only SMS or SMS and MMS?

report.summary: Menu Button "..." Missing
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi Guys, first of all, you've done an awesome job! I've just one issue over here: Neither in the main app-view, nor in the conversation-views, the "..." menu button shows up. I tried restarting the app and the phone ;) Btw: I didn't know that this button should be in the corner on the top right, until a colleague showed me that I could have been able to attach pictures from within the app, if the button would have been there ;) Phone details: HTC One S Android-Version 4.1.2 Please let me know, if you need additional info (Screenshot, ...)

report.summary: TS tries sending image via MMS instead of PUSH and failes
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have disabled MMS and SMS in the TS settings. I have only PUSH contacts. When i send text all is fine. When i want to send an image+text: First try failes - (Send Error -> Detail: Transport: MMS and time info) Second time message works (Detail: Transport: PUSH and time info) LOG with failed try: http://hastebin.com/ifininumab Android: 4.3 Galaxy Nexus Perhaps related to: #2162

report.summary: Message selection is unreliable for non-plaitext messages
report.label: None yet
report.description: Not sure if this is a regression of the latest release, but I just noticed this behaviour on my Samsung SIII (GT-I9300) and wife's GT-I9305, both with stock Android 4.3 - both with latest TextSecure. When looking at a contact's thread, long pressing on messages that include: a photo or a number that has been auto-recognized by Android (therefore underlined) ... does not work as expected: Such messages cannot be selected (they will not be highlighted), even though the "info", "delete", "copy" and "forward" buttons will show up. Performing any action on them (like copy or forward) makes it obvious (when pasting or sending the forwarded message) that a different message has actually been copied to the clipboard! Example: I long-press on msg number 10 in a thread, click the "copy" icon, then paste in the text input area and a different message (usually 11 or 14 ) is pasted! The same effect is seen with copy/paste, forward and message deletion. To test whether you're affected by this bug: Find a TextSecure message that meets the above criteria (has underlined numbers or a photo) Long-press to select it Tap the "copy" icon Long-press in the message composition area Tap "paste" If a different message (or nothing) is pasted, you're bitten by the bug.

report.summary: Ignore groupinstance notifications for T time
report.label: None yet
report.description: It would be really nice to have the option to ignore group notifications for specific groups. Not having this feature is really stopping me from using groups in TS because I don't want to get 100 notifications a minute I don't care about at that moment, but I also don't want to kill the notifications completely because somebody might want to contact me personally.

report.summary: Nexus 5 MMS not receiving or sending ever since Android 5 upgrade
report.label: None yet
report.description: Switched to TextSecure for my Nexus 5 after 6 months frustration with Android's Hangouts. Very versatile app which worked perfectly for first two weeks. Then I got upgraded to Android 5.0. Ever since, I can't send or receive MMS.

report.summary: Optional revoke
report.label: None yet
report.description: Optional message revoke setting: 0-30 sec waiting time before sending a message + revoke button.

report.summary: Make re-registration of same phone number more userfriendly
report.label: None yet
report.description: When reinstalling TextSecure or switching the SIM card to another phone, PUSH service registration often fails because the number is already registered. This forces the user to go to https://whispersystems.org/textsecure/unregister/ and unregister manually. Average users don't know that they have to unregister first. They even don't know the above mentioned page. And that GCM eventually notifies the server about unregistration seems unreliable due to the fact that many users really have trouble with this issue and are unable to proceed using TextSecure. (just wondering if similar steps are necessary when web sockets come in...) I propose to let the registration process check if the number is already registered and automatically perform the necessary steps to unregister and re-register the number. When I understand the unregister web page correctly, this is authenticated by receiving an SMS (or call). I think this is possible when using the same SIM card / phone number. This would greatly enhance the usability.

report.summary: Black Screen with Android 5.0.1
report.label: None yet
report.description: With Current Unofficial CM Android 5.0.1 Build i get a black Screen after login.

report.summary: Allow setting status message for yourself and group chats.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have searched through all issues and was wondering i couldn't find this issue neither open nor closed. The idea is to have a status message with text and/or emojis for yourself and group chats. The problem for this ER is to display the message, because at the moment there's no space for it. If we look at e.g.: Whatsapp, you can see the status in the chat overview and in a contacts view Currently you can see the last message in the chat overview. I would rather like to see the status message of a user there instead. So I think it would be a smaller problem to achieve this. To have a status message in the contacts view is a tougher job, because there is no contacts view yet. What we have now is the stock android contacts view you get, after clicking on the contacts avatar in the overview. So this would be an entirely new view. Maybe this should be a new issue also... An own contacts view would be a nice improvement, because we could add other little informations there. I think this little nice improvement would make it more fun to use TS.

report.summary: Some push messages are not being delivered
report.label: None yet
report.description: Since Nov 25 (so shorty after the 2.3 release) some push notifications are not delivered. The messages were send without error on both cellular and wifi but they never made it to the reciver. 2/3 of the messages send did however get to the reciever without delay or other issues. This might be related to issue #2198... I'm currently using TS 2.3.3 on a Moto G with Android 4.4.4 and the issue has been arround since 2.3 Thanks a lot for TS! I hope this can be fixed soon...

report.summary: TS crashes (?)
report.label: None yet
report.description: I just had TS ask for the password (nothing new so far). However, when I pulled down the Android menu I had the persistent notification saying that TS was unlocked. The problem is that it shouldn't ask for the password if the notification says that it's unlocked :| What's up? I'd open #2174, which was closed for no good reason and never re-opened.

report.summary: Messages not directly delivered when recipient has TextSecure but data connection disabled
report.label: None yet
report.description: A friend has TextSecure but deactivates the data connection oftentimes during the day. Since I can’t tell when it’s active or not on their side (and I’m too lazy / I forget), I always send via data. This results in the messages not being delivered until said friend activates the data connection again (even though they have normal cell connection, so a text would go through). I’m pretty sure this is a known problem but I couldn’t find an existing issue for it. Also not sure if it’s possible to solve or an underlying architectural problem. I was thinking something like: If the push message isn’t delivered in 10 minutes, automatically re-send it via text and delete the push message from the queue. If that’s possible.

I can send them to my sister and to everyone else in my contacts I've tried. When I want to text to my parents, I have to send a group SMS or attach a photo to my SMS to make it an MMS to them. I receive all texts from them fine. They both have iPhones.

report.summary: message-viewed receipts
report.label: None yet
report.description: While it's nice to have receipts that a message has been received (i.e. by the receiving TextSecure app), in some cases it would be even better to have to know if a message has been viewed. By default, this might be too much information to provide, but it would be nice if a user could specify that s/he wants to make this information available to a set of other users.

Clicking the check mark to "mark as read" seems to work fine. This started happening recently, but it's been probably at least a week since my most recent other group message. I have not tried doing anything with picture messages. Group messages with 3 other TS users are fine.

I can receive text messages using wifi calling, but then I have to switch to the regular texting app that came with my phone to send anything. If I'm connected to cell service directly, I can both send and receive without issue. My phone is an HTC Amaze, not rooted, running android 4.0.3. The debug log from textSecure's settings menu shows just this: Device: HTC HTC_Amaze_4G (htc_ruby) Android: IML74K OS Host: abm022 App :TextSecure 2.3.3 (the "app" line is formatted on my phone with two spaces before the colon and none after)

But I'm not sure how to view the images or messages in the "plaintext backup" on my phone. How do you do this? It is a mixture of mms, sms, and push messages.

report.summary: TextSecure doesn’t see the external SD card
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, I am unable to attach photos and other files from my external SD card to messages. When I select “Add attachment” in a message thread, the file browser only shows the entries “Recent”, “Downloads”, and “Internal Storage”, lacking the SD card (as well as, say, the Gallery app, but that’s of no importance to me) regardless of whether I want to send a picture, video, or sound (see picture). The SD card is a 64 GB, Samsung-made card of the “EVO” series. Sending files from my old, 8 GB SD card worked and works just fine. However, all the other apps I’ve tried accessing the new card with (Gallery, Total Commander, PPSSPP, …) see, read from, and write to it without a problem. It might be an issue with the file picker, but I couldn’t find another app that uses the same one as TextSecure. My device is a European Samsung Galaxy Note 3. I’m running Android 4.4.2 which I have rooted, but I’ve found nothing pertaining to this in XPrivacy’s settings.

report.summary: no way to differ between authenticated / unauthenticated contacts
report.label: None yet
report.description: AFAICS, textsecure uses some Kex based on DH which is effectively anonymous. When I add a new contact, it immediately sells me the conversation as being secure, even when no fingerprint exchange or something like that has happened. This basically makes the whole app and idea of encryption useless as anyone could MitM and I wouldn't notice, which is made even worse by the fact that I cannot even mark such contacts which I've manually verified to be verified (as it's e.g. known from OTR). Actually I'd prefer an option that I can reject any contacts which I haven't verified.

report.label: None yet

Textsecure downloaded it and displayed the whole ASCII encoded image as text which slowed down the app to the point where it crashed. Textsecure was not usable until i managed to delete the MMS (on the 5th try it did not crash). This could be used as some kind of DOS attack i think. Please include some kind of safeguard.

report.summary: GCM message not arriving accurate time

report.description: i used GCM push notification in android application to web server to device notification but sometimes i make delay to receive notification. what can i do you?

report.summary: Unable to send SMS over WiFi -- Republic Wireless
report.label: None yet
report.description: Version 2.3.3 Motorola Moto X2, android 4.4.4 on Republic Wireless. If you're not familiar, RW uses a baked-in VOIP app to allow normally cell-based functions like calls and SMS to go over wifi. While on wifi only, Textsecure will receive SMS normally. It will not send SMS, secure or plain. It does however send secure Push Messages to other Textsecure users with no issue. Stock Messenger app will send both SMS and MMS over wifi no problem.

report.summary: Don't rely on SMS delivery reports
report.label: None yet
report.description: According to @liliakai (we spoke in the Freenode channel), TextSecure uses SMS delivery reports rather than issuing them itself. This allows a malicious service provider (or, depending on exactly how secure SMS is, anyone that happens to be nearby the recipient) to withhold|drop a message that was sent via SMS while issuing a successful delivery report, potentially resulting in heated debates over messages that never actually arrived. To prevent this, TextSecure should issue its own (signed) delivery reports.

report.summary: Groups are unusable
report.label: None yet
report.description: We are using a group chat with 9 members (A, B, C ... H, I). I'm running TextSecure 2.3.3. The following happens when I try to send a message inside our group: I do see the small tick underneath the message (no blue or green background) I receive a warning that there was an error while sending the message (green background, red triangle), the tick disappears I receive a message telling me that there are changed, but unknown identity information. I can tap on the message, the message is replaced with a key. Nevertheless, everyone in the group receives my message. The same problem exists for at least two more users (B and C), but interesteringly not for everyone. Another problem is that I don't receive any messages from user D, but everyone else does (including B and C). There are also some users who don't have any problems at all. There are no problems if I send a direct message to any of our group members. The messages are encrypted and sent (blue background), everything seems to be fine. You can find a complete log over here: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/9d4097ed0db6e0339d53

report.summary: Incorrect delivery confirmation in groups
report.label: None yet
report.description: I created a group. When I sent a message, the message delivery confirmed icon (tick in a box) appeared next to my sent message. But one of the group members did not receive the message. So I got an incorrect message delivery confirmation. 👍 2

report.summary: Cannot send SMS to phone numbers containing + sign
report.label: None yet
report.description: Using Android 4.4.4, Textsecure 2.3.3, on Motorola XT1032. Textsecure was installed from Google Play Store. When I configure Textsecure as standard SMS app and deactivate the internet connections, Textsecure should send messages as SMS also to Textsecure contacts. This does not work for one phone number of my address book (it says error sending message, both for encrypted and unencrypted SMS). The phone number contained a plus sign (+49). When I replaced it by 0049, it worked, so I think the cause for the error message is the + sign. The phone number is also valid with the plus sign, so Textsecure should be able to cope with it.

report.summary: can't connect to push server.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've just reinstalled TextSecure and as I try to register it says that it can't connect to the push server. What's the problem? Does TextSecure relies on Google Services? If yes, why does it need it? I've disabled some built in apps, but Google Services are enabled.

report.summary: TextSecure won't stop asking me to configure my MMS settings. HTC one m8
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello all, Recently, I've switched to Viperone m8 3.2.1 rom on my HTC one m8 (Verizon). Everything seems to work fine including calls, 4g/3g, etc. However, it doesn't detect my sim card properly as it should. So this causes TextSecure to ask for my MMS settings even though it already had them entered. The strange part is that I can send MMS txts just fine. But not receive them. See the pictures below. I even tried to add my APN, but there is no option to add it. Debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/aba2acd498cfc7b53ec4

report.summary: Notify local user when remote user's Axolotl message keys are expected to have be deleted based on timeout
report.label: None yet
report.description: Several times now, I've sent a friend a message only to have them tell me out-of-band that they received it, but couldn't read it. All of these occasions happened when we didn't communicate for several days. I'm guessing that the undecryptable behaviour is intentional, due to Axolotl deleting unused message keys after a timeout, to prevent an attack where the adversary withholds ciphertext in the hope of recovering the recipient device later. If my diagnosis is correct, please add some sort of UI indication on the sending side that this may be taking place. Currently, the absence of "delivery failed" suggests to me they received it and decrypted it, when only the former is true and the latter is false.

report.summary: Error on transmission results in large message, crashing TextSecure.
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, the scenario: B sends an image to A over encrypted channel. There is an error on transmission A cannot decrypt the message Textsecure interprets the message as plaintext (in the pane with all chats it is visible in preview as some base64-string) On opening of the chat Textsecure tries to render the multi-kilobyte "text" message Crash This is critical as A can not chat with B any more. The only hotfix so far seems that B sends 10-20 messages to A, so the corrupted message is not visible on opening the conversation, but only after scrolling. It is still impossible to scroll behind the corrupted message this way, so this is just a temporary hotfix. Suggested fix: all text messages with more than X characters are rendered only partially and have to be clicked on to be shown completely. This will allow for the corruped message to be rendered partially and removed by hand. (As a side effect this will allow for easier scrolling beyond long messages)

report.summary: Section on export controls in README.md is wrong
report.label: None yet
report.description: The section on export controls in README.md is wrong. For one thing, ENC and TSU are two different Export Exceptions. The way it works for "publicly available encryption source code" is there is a section in the TSU exception that allows export providing that notification of the location of the source is sent to NSA and BIS using email.

report.summary: Desktop client
report.label: None yet
report.description: I know this is a huge feature request and my intention is to begin the discussion. I've just started using TextSecure as a secure replacement for Google Hangouts. I use Hangouts both on my Android phone and on the desktop, so that I can switch to a full size keyboard when I am at home or work. This is a great feature that I'd love to see implemented by a secure messaging system. My suspicion is that multiple clients acting as the same identity (and hence all being able to read the same chat history and send messages) is either impossible or very difficult to achieve in a client-side encryption model. Is this true? Do you have any intention to support such a feature in the short or long term?

report.description: Hi A friend of mine doesn't receive push messages unless she has ts open in front of her. However she has better stuff to do than staring at the phone to get the messages...
