report.summary: TextSecure incorrectly thinks recipient is registered
report.label: None yet
report.description: Over the past week I've experienced a very strange failure mode. Me and person P were exhanging unsecured text messages. I was using TextSecure (push registered), while P was using a stock messaging app. At some point, TextSecure on my phone started thinking that P was registered with TextSecure, and switched to sending encrypted messages. I sent a few encrypted messages to P, which P never received. Upon learning that P wasn't receiving my messages, I tried ending the secure session with P on my phone. This had no effect: TextSecure still insisted on sending encrypted messages. I tried de-registering my phone and then registering it again, but that didn't help. Ultimately the only way to reach P was to de-register my phone and keep push disabled :( The most pressing issue is: Why did TextSecure think P was registered? P never installed TextSecure or Signal, and did not change their phone number, or anything like that. The secondary issue is: Why did TextSecure not allow me to send plain SMS, even after I selected "end secure session"? I looked at the log, and the only potentially relevant line I could find was this: W/Directory(22806): Adding active token: +*********xx, 47+CqoNE/Fv5gw (where xx is the last 2 digits of P's phone number, so I know the line corresponds to their account.) (PS. Is the debug log designed to be safe for posting in public, or is there a document describing which fields should be censored?) Version info for my device: Device : LGE Nexus 4 (occam) Android : 5.1.1 (1836172, LMY47V) Memory : 33M (0.13% used, 192M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : wpiw7.hot.corp.google.com App : TextSecure 2.16.4

report.label: None yet

report.summary: Not possible to know if a contact is verified or not
report.label: None yet
report.description: If I look at my TextSecure contact list or directly in a contact conversation, there is no way to know if a contact has been verified or not. In case I'm not sure I can only verify the contact again to be 100% sure. It would be nice to have an indication of verified contact. I.e. it could be an orange dot for unverified and green dot for verified, or the lock in the conversation view could change is color when it's verified. Or at least on the "Verify identity" screen you should write: "Successfully verified", Verified" or "Verified on + date/time", I don't know what is more suitable but I'm sure it would be a very useful and important feature to help people use the app in the best possible way.

Replacing "Mute for 1 hour" with "For 1 hour" helps a lot and "Mute" is already mentioned in the title.

report.summary: No updates for device?
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have a bad feeling I am not going to get a friendly response to this. :) My device (samsung gt-p5113) has TextSecure 2.5.3, which works fine. I recently was looking through the Play Store, and noticed that TextSecure was not listed among my apps. I searched for it, and when I found it, the app page said "this version is not compatible with your device." I checked with some other people, and they had versions up to 2.17.0! Can someone explain why newer versions are "not compatible," and (I hope) change something so that I am able to install newer versions, and keep up with development. Thanks.

report.label: None yet
report.description: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/84ce697b6cb0257ced5e Like the subject says, received duplicate message. Had exact same send/receive time. Have not had this happen before that I know of.

report.summary: option to rejoin broken group
report.label: None yet
report.description: It is clear that uninstalling/reinstalling is a big problem for group chats. Receiving a message from a group makes it impossible to answer or open the keyboard or update the group. An idea to fix this could be this. You could add an "restore/ask to rejoin" option (available only when you detect that the user can't reply), which asks all the people who have written so far for the metadata of the group chat. This would be the least painful way for newbies to get around the current problem which requires an avatar update. Do you think this is feasible?

report.summary: Feature Request: Different notifications for groupmsg and PM
report.label: None yet
report.description: I would like to set different notifications for group and direkt messages. When I get a direct message I like a rather intrusive notification while I don't want group messages to play the same ringtone all the time (example: threema). If you are bothered with the additional settings for this, please at least consider an option to only allow the first new message to spawn a notification and suppress the rest (for 1h?).

report.summary: New message notifications shown whenever TextSecure is locked, no messages received when opened.
report.label: None yet
report.description: (Creating new story from thread in #970) I'm seeing an alert that I have two new messages whenever TS is locked. Upon unlocking no message is received, and the alert disappears, but when TS is re-locked I once again get an alert for two "Encrypted Message". (There are two messages from this contact that were sent to me but which I have still never received. This problem began immediately after these were sent.) I've uploaded a capture from logcat -v long while locking and unlocking to reproduce this. This problem has been ongoing for a week now. Re-initiating secure session does not help, restarting the phone does not help. Currently using the latest Play Store version: 2.18.2.

report.summary: TextSecure 2.18.2 -- Unable to Verify Phone #
report.label: None yet
report.description: What's your device? LG L90 D415 (Also confirmed issue on a Nexus 5.) What Android version is it running? 5.0.2 (Nexus 5 is running 5.1.1) What version of TextSecure do you have? 2.18.2 Are you push registered? Yes What are the relevant preferences that you have set that may be related to the issue? Friend installed TextSecure from the Play Store on his Nexus 5 and received a "Connectivity error" message during phone # verification. I then uninstalled the same version of TextSecure and reinstalled from the Play Store. I also received the same error message. The app was working fine prior to its reinstallation. Full logcat: http://pastebin.com/BvJ6CpAP Of Interest: 06-22 00:26:25.754 W/RegistrationService(14902): org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.push.exceptions.NonSuccessfulResponseCodeException: Bad response: 500 Internal Server Error

report.summary: receiving sms twice
report.label: None yet
report.description: Since the last few updates of TS (since 2.17.0 or so), I sometimes receive normal sms twice, although the other person only sent it once... it happens with different contacts and with around 1 in 15-20 sms... https://gist.github.com/381e55cf8f655ba2e186 I had the same problem in the past while using Android 4.1.2 (and I thought it was a problem with the ways, TS catches the SMS before the standard app), but with installing nAOSP 5.0.2 / 5.1.1 the problem ended, now it happens again

report.summary: Unregister TextSecure service upon uninstalling
report.label: None yet
report.description: My problem is that I have several contacts that tried TextSecure but uninstalled it after a short time without unregistering. Unfortunately they're also unwilling to use the unregister function on the Website and so I'm stuck with several phone numbers still shown as TextSecure Contacts and whenever I try to send a Message it automatically uses the push service instead of the normal SMS system. It would be helpful if there was a possibility to permanently deactivate push messages for certain contacts or even better, to automatically unregister contacts that have uninstalled the app.

report.summary: Typo on the TextSecure Private Messenger beta news

Meant new messages in old groups after pairing.

report.summary: Allow arbitrary usernames instead of only phone numbers.
report.label: None yet
report.description: Currently, only phone numbers are allowed as user IDs but this is a breach of privacy as phone number is identifying information for the user, even if it is encrypted (no trust should be needed). Instead, allow users to pick arbitrary usernames and contacts can be added by their usernames.

report.summary: Password not working
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've been using Textsecure for more than a year without a password. Today I decided I wanted to work with one. I used my SIM's PIN as the password (that's four digits). Now I can't enter the app. It says my password is invalid. I know the consequence is that I've lost all my messages. Not a drama but very annoying indeed. I've warned all of my friends using Textsecure to not use a password. It's simply not possible that I typed my PIN incorrectly when creating the password. I type it everyday many times and Textsecure asked me to repeat it before accepting it as the password, so something's definitely wrong with Textsecure regarding passwords.

report.summary: How do I send a message to several people WITHOUT creating a group?
report.label: None yet
report.description: I'm not interested in groups. It's the very feature why I run away from Whatsapp. It creates too much noise. I'm not interested in having a chat room, which is what groups seem to be like (yes, I'm that old). But I do want to send messages to several people at once in many occasions. Is that possible at all with Textsecure? How do I do that?

report.summary: Importing messages from just one contact
report.label: None yet

Most of the lost messages were not important, but I'd like to keep my wife's ones. They also live in their phone, so I was thinking of backing them up, moving the backup to my phone and then import them into my new Textsecure install. Can I do that? How? (If it involves the use of a PC, I'm an Ubuntu user and consider myself "computer literate", so feel free to suggest any solution no matter how convoluted. :-))

report.summary: Don't ask contacts to reconfirm after reinstalling Textsecure.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have family and friends using Textsecure. ALL of them asked me what was going on when I reinstalled Textsecure and they received a message telling them something about confirming me to their contact list again. The message looked scary to all of them and they didn't know what was going on. Why exactly is this being done? The phone number is the same. It should be trivial for the server to know this is just a reinstall. What am I missing?

report.summary: Register time too short, cannot register without both wifi and phone network
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've tried over and over and cannot register my phone for TextSecure. I live in a remote rural area and cannot get decent phone reception at the same time that I have a wifi connection. If I drive to a spot to receive the SMS then I lose the wifi connection. If I try to do Voice Verify then it says no network - presumably meaning no wifi connection. So it's impossible to register here. I almost got it once by driving out to get reception but the short time limit of 2 minutes cut off before the SMS that came in moments later. I don't understand why you have to make it so difficult to register the phone, or even why a secure messaging app needs to have my phone number registered in the first place. Is this some hidden tracking agenda - why need the phone number for text messaging. But my real point here is to let you know that registration is broken for people like me in rural areas. It seems the only way for me to do this is to wait for some day when I'm at some cafe with free wifi and decent phone reception both together. Can this not be made less onerous?

report.summary: libtextsecure-java version skew
report.label: None yet
report.description: build.gradle is at version 1.6.1 of libtextsecure-java: compile 'org.whispersystems:textsecure-android:1.6.1' while https://github.com/WhisperSystems/libtextsecure-java/blob/master/build.gradle is at 1.6.0. The versions should match.

report.summary: Duplicate messages sent to non TS user when two conversations exist (group and single)
report.label: None yet
report.description: I had a strange issue this weekend using version 2.20 of TS. I had a conversation with a non-ts user on iPhone (non-signal) and I also had a group conversation with that same user + a TS user on android. When I would send messages to the single-user conversation, said user would get duplicates of every message. I tried rebooting my phone, etc, to no avail. Once I deleted the mixed-group (TS/non-TS) the problem stopped. I accidentally submitted the log w/o grabbing the link for the log to post here. If this isn't enough info, feel free to nuke this, just thought we should have a record of it.

report.summary: Missing ability to send PDF
report.label: None yet
report.description: I wanted to send a PDF to one of my contacts, which isn't possible at the moment. I estimate this missing feature as really important due to the fact that it might be relevant to security measures being able to send documents encrypted.

report.summary: Colors palette in 2.20 much prettier (and more functional!) than 2.21
report.label: None yet
report.description: My phone just updated from 2.20 to 2.21 (Moto G on 4.4.4). I think the new colors are not nearly as pretty or as useful as the 2.20 colors were. 2.20 was beautiful and extremely functional!!! You had it right! :-) The two major issues I find with the new colors are... Insufficient Variability: Before you had a nice wide array of colors for the recipient names. It was great because I didn't have to read, I knew which text was which user with a simple glance at the colors. Now most things are dark green/gray/blue and that information is lost, I'm back to reading the names to find the thread I want. Dark/Intense: The new colors are quite dark and quite intense. It almost looks like they're all some sort of warning messages. The last colors were calm and reassuring. Awesome work overall! Textsecure has come so far from where it was a year ago!

report.summary: Ticks as status indicators are not intuitive
report.label: None yet
report.description: The double ticks that were introduced in version 2.21.0 as status indicators are not intuitive. I guess they mean: one tick for "message delivered to server" two ticks for "message delivered to chat partner(s)" but these icons have nothing to do with the status. Even the former design (light blue until delivered to server and tick once it was delivered) was way more clear than now. What will happen if one day tha status for "message read" will be added. Three ticks? My suggestion: Look at Threema's status icons (grey envelope --> dark envelope --> mailbox --> eye). I think this is one of these example where design killed usability.

However, sending messages to such specially formatted numbers is not included by my flatrate.

report.summary: group SMS feature: still missing; why has issue #413 been locked/limited?
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi! I am am wondering why there is yet not an update on the still missing group SMS feature in Textsecure.The original issue concerning this question, issue #413, has already been opend in 2013 and now, in mid 2015, there is still no information, when the feature will be implemented. For 1 1/2 years this feature has been wished by a lot of people, as the lively discussion in #413 shows. But now, the conversation #413 has been locked and limited to collaborators ca. a month ago and you cannot participate in the discussion in #413 anymore. Why this limitation of the discussion? Can you provide us, please, with any concrete information, when the missing group SMS feaure will be implemented? Thanks! @moxie0 : I did not want to open a duplicate, but as it is technically impossible to write in #413 which is in general about the missing feature and not about technical details. I saw no other way. Sorry, if the new issue caused trouble. However,my question was not about a regular update service, but was only caused, as this group SMS feature request is open since quite a long time and I was wondering if it is still planned or not. Thanks again.

report.summary: Lock symbol and date have very low contrast in incoming message bubbles (phone number in conversation toolbar has the same issue)
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, the incoming message bubbles in TextSecure 2.21.0 have a colored background (color depends on setting per contact) and the text inside those incoming message bubbles is white. So far that is fine. But: The lock symbol and the date in those incoming message bubbles basically have the same color as the bubble's background, which results in a very low contrast and bad readability. In comparison: The outgoing message bubbles in TextSecure 2.21.0 have a white background and the text inside those outgoing message bubbles is black/dark gray. And the lock symbol and the date in those outgoing message bubbles have the same (or similar) contrasting color as the message text (black/dark gray), which results in a much better readability. So: Could you please change the lock symbol and the date in the incoming message bubbles to a white color? With white they would have a much better contrast to the colored background and would have a much better readability. PS: The phone number in the conversation toolbar (the phone number that is being displayed below the chat partner's name) has the same issue. So it would be nice if you would change that to a white color as well. Regards

report.summary: Please add option to change default theme color globally
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, with TextSecure 2.21.0 you can change the color for each contact. When changing the color, the color for the conversation toolbar changes as well. So it's a bit like changing the theme color. However, the attachment button inside the conversation remains blue (default theme color) for example. It would be really nice if you could add an option to TextSecure which would allow to change not just the color for each contact, but also change the theme color globally, so that the color is changed everywhere, including the main screen and settings and so on. Or with other words: Currently the default color in the TextSecure "Light" theme is blue. I'd like to have an option to change this default color to something else. Any chance you could do that? It could be placed under Settings -> Appearance. It would be much appreciated. Regards

report.summary: Quick response on call wrong number
report.label: None yet
report.description: In Austria we are mainly using E.164 format on mobile numbers I.e. +43 664 12345678. If I receive a call and send a quick response it will be sent to the wrong number: 243664 12345678 instead of +43 664... It seem like the plus is converted to a 2.

report.summary: Option to hide/replace emoji button
report.label: None yet
report.description: It would be great if one could hide the emoji button and/or replace it with something more useful (e.g. attachment button). There are various reasons why one might not need the emoji button: The keyboard used might already provide an emoji button (as in my case). One might prefer to use/type old-fashioned ASCII emojis, therefore not needing the advanced emoji menu provided by TextSecure. One might not want to use emojis at all. and probably some more that I can't think of...

report.summary: Use system look for emoji or add a "compatibility mode"
report.label: None yet
report.description: Some want uniformity and emoji can get lost in translation but this is not a TextSecure problem and shouldn't be fixed here. Even if it were to be fixed here, why settle on the Apple ones? I can't see how many people have installed Signal but there are 253 ratings, compared to 19,627 ratings for TextSecure. Would iOS users like Android emoji? Probably not. Most people likely prefer whatever they're used to, so it's better to let the system handle the look instead of forcing everyone to use the Apple ones which look really cheap and doesn't fit in at all on Android. TextSecure uses one set of emoji while the rest of the system and other apps uses another now. Also notifications still use the system emoji and apparently nothing can be done about this. The inconsistencies look really sloppy. Adding options is usually not a good idea but the same goes for changing the look that people are used to, so if anything there should be a "compatibility mode" where those who want to make sure nothing gets lost in translation can switch to Apple emoji.

report.summary: Crash on message received (with bonus "Bad encrypted message")
report.label: None yet
report.description: First off, the gist of the debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/b4bd3001d8c0525e81c9 I've used TextSecure for a long while, but I only very recently picked up my first contact who also uses it. I was so excited when I sent my first message! I was slightly less excited when she said that all she received was a "Bad encrypted message" error. I did some debugging on my end, which led to a debug log that looked something like the one that I posted above (but without the crash). This morning however, her "Bad encrypted message" to me also resulted in TextSecure crashing upon receiving the message. I don't know why today's message exchange led to a crash but the previous ones didn't. I'm also confused as to why I'm trying to JSON decode an HTML error message. Any ideas as to what could be going on and/or suggestions on what to try next?

report.summary: Bad encrypted message from WhisperPush user
report.label: None yet
report.description: Starting off with the debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/76b13998ebfb86b7142c As we discussed in #3642, I had previously used Titanium Backup, which I had learned after doing so is frowned upon. So I went with the nuclear option of nuking my TextSecure install (wiped data, reinstalled too just for good measure), and starting fresh. The above debug log is after nuking everything. I have a bit more details about what's going on this time, too. First, and probably most importantly, is that the person on the other side of this issue is running WhisperPush version 5.0.2-30bd462d41 on a OnePlus running CM (which is the stock OS on the device). My encrypted push messages to them are good, but I just receive the "Bad encrypted message" error. They can exchange messages with other WhisperPush users, but I'm currently not sure about other TextSecure users. Normal SMS works, but that's probably not shocking. Normal MMS also works. Thoughts/suggestions?

report.summary: keyboard type predictions not shown in landscape mode
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, When I write a message in landscape orientation, the keyboard does not show its text prediction suggestions. This only occurs when writing a message in landscape mode. In portrait mode, the keyboard works like it is supposed to be. Also in other apps, writing in landscape mode shows the prediction suggestions. System: HTC Desire, cyanogenmod 7.2.0.1-bravo, textsecure: 2.21.0, stock keyboard (german) Attached some screenshots: 01: textsecure app in landscape mode (predictions are missing) 02: textsecure app in portrait mode (predictions are shown) 02: note taking app in landscape mode (predictions are shown) Please let me know if you need any further information. And after all: Thanks for providing textsecure!

report.summary: New permissions in TextSecure 2.32.2
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, I am a big fan of TextSecure and just discovered the new version (2.32.2) in the Google Play store. Unfortunately, the app is requesting a lot of new permissions. The stated reason is so you can integrate RedPhone later on, which makes sense to make TextSecure more like Signal. While I don't want to imply that I think you guys are doing anything fishy with my data, you will surely understand that people might not install a secure messaging app that has just about access to anything. For example, I cannot see how access to my Calendar is important to exchange messages nor to make phone calls. I think it would really serve you and the community well if you would put an explanation of all the permissions in a prominent place on the open whisper systems website. Having this information easily accessible (link from Google store to that site?) will help users to build trust. Of course anyone can read the code to see that you are not up to anything, but that isn't a good enough answer here since not many people will have the time nor the technical expertise to do so. If your code is audited you could add information about audits on your website, stating who did the audit, with which version of the app and link to their results. Thanks!

report.summary: Wrong emoticons in Android

report.summary: Deliver a full and a small TextSecure version for enhanced trust
report.label: None yet
report.description: Not everyone wants to use all the features, but the standard install now asks for calendar, microphone (in RedPhone preparation), location, and other permissions. How about a second smaller TextSecure version that really is just a limited secure messenger? Should not even be able to take pictures. Even though it is Open Source and I could check things, most people cannot and hence less Android permissions would create more trust. Please consider two builds, one full featured and one with just messaging capabilities. You might even kill SMS support and make it even less requiring. Thanks.

report.summary: TextSecure changes colors of Google contacts
report.label: None yet
report.description: Contacts without assigned images in the default Google contacts app (also used in the default phone dialer) are assigned a color which normally cannot be changed. Recently however, I've noticed that contacts of the people who are TextSecure registered users do change. The color changes are seemingly random (one was grey, then light blue, red, orange, now purple), and I have yet to find a pattern as when they happen (once it occurred right after I switched back to the contact screen from TextSecure; sometimes I only notice when I open the phone dialer). When it happens all of the contacts of TextSecure users change at once. I'm not exactly sure what causes the problem, but I'm pretty sure it is an issue with TextSecure since all my contacts' colors stay the same except for those who also use TextSecure (even one whom I've never actually texted). Note that this does not apply to the colors that you can assign people within TextSecure; those remain the same. Changing them within TextSecure is probably not the impetus for a change in contacts either, since one that I've never changed within TextSecure has changed in Google contacts. I wonder if it has something to do with the new searching contacts screen in TextSecure? I feel it happens more often after I go to that screen, but that's just a guess. I'm using TextSecure 2.23.2 on a Nexus 5 running Android 5.1.1. Here is a log, if that helps: https://gist.github.com/e5166ff4b9b0ea4b55e0

report.summary: Crash on start due to old session files
report.label: None yet
report.description: Since the recent update to 2.23.3 TextSecure crashed for me directly on the start of the app before even showing the main screen. Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms From the code there it seems the session files in the /data/data/org.thoughtcrime.securesms/files/sessions-v2 dir should have already been migrated to version 3, which was not the case for me. report.summary: Previous conversation's contact name messes up ellipsization when opened from notification
report.label: None yet
report.description: Go to a conversation with Eva (a contact with a short name) Receive a message from Reinhold (a contact with a longer name) Tap the notification to open the conversation with Reinhold Notice that Reinhold's name is truncated as R... TextSecure seems to use the length of the contact name in the previous conversation (the length of Eva's name) as the basis to ellipsize the contact name in the conversation that was opened through a notification (Reinhold). TS 2.23.3, Nexus 4, stock 5.1.1 I guess this is somewhat related to the latter part of #3718.

report.summary: Multi-device strings inconsistent, confusing
report.label: None yet
report.description: The act of adding a device uses at least 5 verbs: Create Link Add Register Pair The act of removing a device uses only 1 verb, but it is unrelated to any of the positive actions: Disconnect This inconsistency is both confusing to end users and troublesome for translators. It would be awesome if we had a single positive action verb, with a related single negative verb. For example: Add / Remove Register / Unregister Link / Unlink Authorize / Deauthorize (used in Google Play Music) The related string resources follow:

report.summary: Support for multiple recipients without creating groups or support for local groups
report.label: None yet
report.description: In TextSecure, if I want to send the same message to multiple persons I can create a group first and send the message to the group. However then everyone in the group becomes aware that it is a group message -- in other words groups are always global. It would be nice to either send to multiple recipients without the need for creation of groups (I think this has already been requested) or allow the creation of groups which are local, so that we can send the same message to multiple people without the recipients being aware of the fact.

report.summary: MasterCipher constructor is sloooooow
report.label: None yet
report.description: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/crypto/MasterCipher.java#L65 As it turns out, over the course of loading the items in the conversation list view, Cipher.getInstance is called 32 times from its various initializations and takes ~100ms of main thread time per dataset change, which means ~300-500ms of main thread time per message sent since the cursor is reloaded up to 5 times when a message is sent. Seems like we should either have one MasterCipher instance that we pass along to the various Mms/SmsDatabase readers or at least have the Cipher instances be static singletons.

report.summary: General rules for translations?
report.label: None yet
report.description: I'm on the translate team for TextSecure and SMSSecure for the Dutch language, and I noticed in both projects some inconsistencies. In Dutch, you have 2 forms for the English "you" (ignoring the "thou" form here): the informal "jij", and the more formal "u". I noticed both forms are used in translations, probably depending on the personal preference of the translator of the specific string. In French you have "tu" and "vous", in German "du" and "sie", but I didn't check the French and German translations to see if the forms are mixed there too. I don't know any other languages well enough to say if it can be an issue there. In current Dutch both forms are socially acceptable (although some mostly elder people frown on the use of the informal form). I would suggest the app choose one of the forms to be more consistent. Having both forms mixed makes a sometimes strange impression. I have no strong personal preference for either form. What is the opinion of the developers?

report.summary: Single thread notification overflow not ellipsisified
report.label: None yet
report.description: If you expand the notification drawer, there are 9 lines (in my case) of message text shown. There is no indication for how many messages were received or if there is more text. If you received more than 9 lines (wrapped single message, multi line single message, multiple messages) then there should be ellipsis in the ninth line, like it is done for the multiple thread notification. And as of the current sort order this gets even more confusing. You see the most recent message in the collapsed notification and it is not shown (or indicated to be anywhere) when you expand the notification (when there 9+ lines of notification) Can screenshoot if my description is too confuse 😉 Edit: ... and totally forgot to demand a message count indicator

report.summary: Linking device with no TS groups crashes
report.label: None yet
report.description: This is the stacktrace: W/JobConsumer(10381): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No length specified! W/JobConsumer(10381): at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.messages.TextSecureAttachment$Builder.build(TextSecureAttachment.java:80) W/JobConsumer(10381): at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.sendUpdate(MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.java:101) W/JobConsumer(10381): at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.onRun(MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.java:68) W/JobConsumer(10381): at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18) W/JobConsumer(10381): at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:76) W/JobConsumer(10381): at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46) E/AndroidRuntime(10381): FATAL EXCEPTION: JobConsumer-3 E/AndroidRuntime(10381): Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 10381 E/AndroidRuntime(10381): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No length specified! E/AndroidRuntime(10381): at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.messages.TextSecureAttachment$Builder.build(TextSecureAttachment.java:80) E/AndroidRuntime(10381): at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.sendUpdate(MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.java:101) E/AndroidRuntime(10381): at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.onRun(MultiDeviceGroupUpdateJob.java:68) E/AndroidRuntime(10381): at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18) E/AndroidRuntime(10381): at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:76) E/AndroidRuntime(10381): at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46) Basically, I wanted to check the current status of the TextSecure-Browser project. Since I'm lazy, rather than rebuilding the android application to use the staging server and create another account, I wanted to try to use it to contact my mother and I modified the javascript sources to not use the staging servers (I just removed the -staging string from the urls, as a wild guess) I thought: what's the worse that could happen? the messages might just fail to be delivered well, apparently I was wrong... maybe because the browser plugin expects a newer version of the app, but now I always get the above exception. The problem still happens even after removing/disabling the extension on my browser. The exception doesn't happen if I put the phone in airplane mode, but otherwise it keeps crashing (and showing the related popup) I tried to find a way to disassociate my browser from the phone, but apparently there's no such option. Rebooting the phone didn't help. I frankly could do without TextSecure for a few days... I'd switch back to the normal sms app until this issue would be fixed. But afaik, the only way I could do that, is by uninstalling textsecure/removing the account. Unfortunately this would then create a new key and I'd need to notify my new contacts of the changed fingerprint. I'd like if there was a day to do one of the following things: Tell textsecure to stop connecting altogether Tell textsecure to disable automatic restart Export my textsecure's private key (ok, this is less than ideal, but I'm already suffering from a self-inflicted DOS :P ) Also, I understand that an Android application's lifecycle is not as simple as a normal Java app, so it might not be that easy. But is there no way to have a top-level catch-all exception that recognizes such an issue, increments a counter to detect if the failure was a one-off or is cronical, and does something sane (temporarily disabling itself... don't let the exception bubble up to the system, etc.)? Thank you

report.summary: repeating notification 2 times - but it does never stop
report.label: None yet
report.description: With the current version 2.24.1, and also with the previous version, I noticed, that on my two different devices the repeating alarm (I set this to "repeat two times") never stops. Because the support forum has no related entries, I regard this as a bug and report it here. First device: Android 4.0.3, second device: Android 4.0.4.

report.summary: twitched direct capture to crash
report.label: None yet
report.description: As usual I had nothing better to do than testing how robust my display glass is right at the emoji and direct capture button, with rappppid tapping Just did fast changes between camera and emoji and sometimes keyboard, as you can get from to log. report.summary: Wording: 'SD Card' vs. 'Storage'
report.label: None yet
report.description: The wording of several strings is inconsistent regarding the use of 'SD Card' and 'Storage', although all of these strings refer to the very same thing (as seen in the source code). I'd like to do a small PR correcting that, but want to gather information first what term is prefered. Some things to consider: As far as I know, TextSecure is not able to access a 'real' SD card when using KitKat or Lollipop. The term 'SD card' could be confusing to users with no SD card slot on their phone. The concept of a 'emulated SD card' could be even more confusing to those users ('There are no power users'). Possible terms: SD card storage device storage external storage (thx, @2-4601) anything else? I'd appreciate your input!

report.summary: Most Required Features
report.label: None yet
report.description: This is my first post. I just compared textsecure with whatsapp and found that many features is required. Hereby i try to list the most required features. Audio call Brodcast Profile Pic Status Last seen Typing Wallpapper or Custom Background Email Chat Location Share Delete Account Change Number Optiin to Auto download media I just mentioned above features after comparison with whatsapp. Its not necessary that we build application like whatsapp but above mentioned features is required for any messenger application. I also found some issue in ts. Like if you add any friends in group after that admin can not remove any friends from the group. Admin must remove any member from group. When some members post text message in group then notification shows that this friends post text message but does not show the group name, so we think that this is private message but actually its group message. Other issue is we only select one image at time, we must select 10 to 20 image at time. Sorry for my bad English but i tried to contribute to this awesome app. Thanks Bahadursinh

This is not the first time this has been requested: WhisperSystems#1891 WhisperSystems#1966 WhisperSystems#2734 Unfortunately, these threads are all closed so I cannot add my request to them... the explanation appears to be that encrypted standard sms support is going away, but I don't understand how this is an explanation for this request, isnt non-encrypted standard sms still to be available? It appears that all those thread writers are not interested in encrypted sms, but rather just plain sms, as am I, and as far as I can tell, this issue has not been addressed yet for us. Again, my reasons for using textsecure is not encryption, but rather that it has some nice features as an sms application, and is not as vulnerable to the stagefright bug.

report.summary: Completely disable SMS sending
report.label: None yet

In this way I won't be allowed to send unencrypted messages using TextSecure, not even by error. Currently if I long press the send button, or if I specify a phone number that is not using TextSecure, I am allowed to send a plain text SMS. Especially in the latter case it is not immediate to realize that this is happening. I think that the average user expects to disable any kind of SMS operation when setting "SMS and MMS" to Off. Thanks!

report.summary: Second factor for re-registering with the server
report.label: None yet
report.description: Currently, if someone gets the ability to get my SMSes, such as by stealing my SIM card or somehow intercepting them at the carrier, or number cloning, then the only thing standing in the way of that person impersonating me to a user I've already chatted to is the key mismatch warning. Some users will click through that without thinking. And someone who's never chatted to me before will not get any warning because of TOFU. Since I don't think there's any intention to aggressively push users to manually verify key fingerprints, it would be nice if I could add a passphrase to my registration that would not let someone register a new device with my phone number without also having that passphrase. Since this adds some friction, it would be reasonable for it to be opt-in; that is to say, once I register my number for the first time, I should be able to go into the settings and enable the passphrase requirement. The biggest drawback I can see is that if I give up my phone number and then it is reassigned, someone else will be stuck unable to use textsecure with that number. I can't really think of a perfect way to solve this, but expiring a registration that hasn't been used at all in some period of time, say 12 months, would probably be a reasonable approach. Alternatively, instead of just requiring use, the server could periodically send the client a liveness check of some sort (via push), and clear the registration if those don't succeed for some shorter period of time (3 months?) if the app isn't even responding at all.

report.summary: Cannot share photos from Google Photos
report.label: None yet

The steps are: Take a photo with the phone camera; Go to the Photos app, open the image and "share it to TextSecure"; TextSecure opens. Chose a recipient. The image appears in the conversation; Press "send". The message disappears, nothing is sent. Here is the debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/32aae2e2352b96d4bf40 The initial logged crash is probably not related to this, but to another issue that I'm going to report right after this.

report.summary: Brand new Signal user's attempt to start session crashes ALL other TextSecure sessions permanently
report.label: None yet
report.description: Well this is an interesting one. TS 2.25.3 on Android 2.3.4. I coaxed somebody into installing Signal and after some confusion about a verification code (I was getting texts that didn't tell me to send it to her, eventually we figured out that I should do that) she attempted to start a session with me. It failed. At that point, every other active textsecure session I have with every other contact is now completely broken. I get a "failed to send" both on regular messages and on attempts to end the secure session. The 'tap for details' UI just says "failed to send" in red, and the "tap to resend" button will fail again. With another TextSecure user in the same house, now he cannot send me messages ("failed to send") or end a secure session with me. He also reports that it's asking him to verify my new identity key (?!). It appears to have persisted one reboot and I will try another.

report.summary: SMS fallback not triggered if recipient offline
report.label: None yet
report.description: Use case: I and my contact are "push registered", but at various times one of us goes offline for a few hours and would like to seamlessly switch to SMS. Explanation: I only use data when connected to WiFi, so SMS is prefered communication channel much of the time. This is common amongst my contacts here in Europe, but some have mobile data. Issue: TS seems to switch to PUSH whenever sender has data (or even if previous conversation was PUSH). This leads to frustrating undelivered messages if sender simply hits reply without deliberately forcing SMS. Feature request: When there is evidence that the sender or recipient is offline, there should be some way to prefer SMS. Two possible ways to avoid these undelivered PUSH replies: Seamless SMS fallback if either person is not online. If "seamless" is not an option: receiving an SMS should trigger SMS mode for the conversation. I understand that defaulting to SMS is problematic now that SMS encryption is gone, but this could be an "Advanced" option for nerds like me. Can add a warning as modal, or in settings: "Warning: this could cost you money or accidentally lead to insecure SMS communication." Related: This behavior was outlined by @cramu here: WhisperSystems#984 (comment) If sender or recipient are not reachable (because mobile data is not available) a popup appears, warning the sender that the message could be delayed and asking him for confirmation or to edit his message and send via SMS/MMS. Issue #678 looked promising, but that bug is huge, stale and it is unclear what was finally decided upon / implemented.

So no user has to have 10 Apps that have their own messaging and contacts. You only have one installed and you can use every feature of this 10 Apps in one. A Permission System should be included.

report.summary: Key's QR code never matches when opened through "You may wish to verify this contact"
report.label: None yet
report.description: When your contact's key changes and you try to scan their QR code through the "You may wish to verify this contact" link the keys won't match because the QR scan expects the old key even though the hex fingerprint screen shows the new key. Steps: Your contact's key changes They send you a message. You tap the message to open the "The identifying material for contact has changed..." dialog Tap the link "You may wish to verify this contact." Notice that you see two fingerprints on this verification screen (and their fingerprint is the new one) Open the QR code scanning mode You either a) get a toast "Recipient has no identity key!" (in the case your contact has no previous key anymore - e.g. they unregistered at some point) OR b) Barcode Scanner opens, you scan their QR code, and you will get the dialog saying "WARNING, the scanned key DOES NOT match! ..." You can see the mismatch when you compare the fingerprint verification screen opened through the lock icon vs. the screen opened through the "You may wish..." link. As expected the former shows the old fingerprint and the latter shows the new one. However in the latter screen the QR code matching seems to still use the old key. Nexus 4, 5.1.1, TS 2.26.1 and before

report.summary: Problems with properly accessing contacts stored via CardDAV on older Android devices?
report.label: None yet
report.description: Could it be that TextSecure has problems with contacts stored via CardDAV on older Android devices? Since a couple of weeks (then on 2.25.3, now 2.26.5) I'm experiencing some problems. I have all my contacts stored via CalDAV, none on the SIM card and none on the phone (that runs on 4.2.2). Since a couple of weeks almost all TS-using contacts are shown twice in the list of TS users (and once under "All contacts"). Only newly added TS contacts are listed once. It started when I used TS 2.25.3. Today I noticed that one contact was listed (in the conversations list and in TS' contacts list) without her name, only by her number. Although the native contacts app shows a perfectly fine entry, when I tried to call that person, her name was not shown when dialing (as it would normally happen); instead her number was listed as an "other" number---in the native contacts app, her number is labeled "mobile". In fact, when I tried to edit the contact in the native contacts app, at the bottom there is an entry for TextSecure (that cannot be edited) that indicates that the number is stored on the phone with the label "other". (In turn, when I restrict the contacts to app to show contacts stored on the phone only, it lists none, as I would expect.) Does that imply that TS creates a local copy of the CardDAV phone number on the phone? In fact, said contact is one the many duplicates. I played around and "separated" and re-"joined" the varying accounts via which I'm connected to said person in the native contacts app. Now her name (instead of her number only) is listed twice again in the list of TS users, but the two entries are not listed in two subsequent rows, but the first entry jumped to the very top of the list, before the names starting with an A. I repeated that exercise with another duplicate entry, to the same effect: it seems that a second list of TS users is created that is alphabetically ordered and stacked on top of the other one. Apologies for this lengthy post. The only previous issue I found that mentions CardDAV is WhisperSystems#2533, which "solved" itself when the user updated to a higher Android version.

report.summary: Everything is messed up after phone number change
report.label: None yet
report.description: I recently had to change my phone number and used the recommended protocol from the support pages to do so: http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/portal/articles/1468975 After reenabling push messages everything worked fine on my side, but most of my contacts only received an error instead of my messages (Message encrypted for non-existant session). After they sent a message to me this problem was resolved. I guess a new session was opened by that? Furthermore my old number did still show up in all of my group conversations and broke them for everybody (Error sending message). As I can't reactivate my old number, our only option was to create new groups. My first attempt to do so was also unsuccessful because of the session errors mentioned above. Half of the members still had their old session with me and only received notification about an "unknown group" in which they could not read or write. I'm not familiar with the specifics of how Textsecure handles sessions or group conversations, so all I can do is report this strange behaviour and hope for some smart people to figure out what went wrong here.

report.summary: SMS messages received from TextSecure users are blue not green
report.label: None yet
report.description: Device Model: MotoG Android Version: 5.1.1 (CyanogenMod 12.1.20150820-NIGHTLY) TextSecure Version: 2.26.5 Situation: PersonA and PersonB both use TextSecure. PersonA uses TextSecure as their default SMS application. PersonB does not use TextSecure as their default SMS application. PersonB does not always have a network connection and will at times send SMS messages to PersonA. Expected Behaviour: SMS messages sent from PersonB to PersonA will be shown as green in TextSecure. Current Behaviour: SMS messages sent from PersonB to PersonA are shown in blue. Problems Caused: PersonA does not know if the message sent from PersonB was sent securely. PersonA may assume PersonB has connectivity due to them sending messages, and thus wrongly assume their messages have been received. PersonA may not know over which medium (SMS/TextSecure) they are expected to reply to PersonB.

report.summary: Proposal to speed up QR code verification
report.label: None yet
report.description: The prequisite would be including barcode scanner into TextSecure/Signal and to move the "end secure session" to the three dot menu. Tapping the lock would enable QR code verification immediately. When Axolotl protocol assigns Alice and Bob roles to devices by comparing the base key, they could also be used assign roles for QR-code verification: e.g. display QR code on Alice's device and open camera on Bob's device. Bob could then scan both fingerprints from Alice's device at the same time: It could both verify that Bob's device had received the proper key from Alice, and that the proper key was delivered to Alice's device. After verification, Bob's device would either report successful verification or MITM risk. Here's a mockup I made: This approach would reduce the amount of user interaction from nine taps to two, and after crude measuring, verification would be 20 seconds faster.

report.summary: Attaching/Sending contact info should attach a contact record, rather than a number
report.label: None yet
report.description: Using Signal 3.0.1 (beta) for Android on a Nexus 5. Debug log (though I doubt you'll want it) is https://gist.github.com/526f0bbf1de80801e008 On WhatsApp, when I attach a contact, it brings up the contact's record with checkboxes next to each item of information that you have for him/her (e.g. numbers and email addresses) and you can choose which you want to include. You then click send and it sends them all together as a record, formatted specially. Clicking on it in the WhatsApp chat then allows you to add that information to your contacts (giving you the option to add it to an existing contact, or create a new contact, as is normal for receiving a contact). It also has a clever little message icon under the contact record that allows you to send a WhatsApp message to that contact straight away without adding them to your address book. The interface in Signal is much less developed. When you select attaching contact information on the same contact, it only shows me the phone numbers for the contact (rather than the email addresses) and selecting one just inserts the number alone (with no name or formatting). I would like to see Signal send a proper contact record with a similar flow to that described above for WhatsApp, at least if the recipient is also a Signal/TextSecure user and the message is being sent over the data channel.

report.summary: Direct captures (image only) cannot be copied or forwarded (do not show actions which are unavailable for d-cs)

If my observation is correct - that a "direct capture" cannot be copied, or resent, for technical reason, --> then I suggest to disable those context menu items (long-click onto d-c-message) which are not available in that case (do not show the copy/paste item, do not show the resend function, but show the save-to-file icon for a direct capture message).

report.summary: No warning when getting a call from contact with new key
report.label: None yet
report.description: I'm not familiar with the redphone internals, so correct me if I misunderstood something... I have two devices running Signal 3.0.2. They were exchanging messages and where having some calls. Now device A reinstalled Signal (resulting in a new identity key) and called device B. The call was established without problems, no warning was given. Writing a message from A to B lead to a warning ("Receives message with unknown identity key..."). Shouldn't be there a warning during the call as well? This allows to impersonate someone else, no?

Build Information Model: Nexus 5 Android Version: 6.0 TextSecure Versions: 2.28.1 and 3.0.3 Steps to Reproduce Click drop-down menu in upper-right-hand corner Click "My identity key" Click QR-code icon in upper-right-hand corner Click "Get scanned to compare" Click Share icon Select App to share with [WORKING] Share to Textsecure (or Signal in v3.0.3): Picture is attached to message after a conversation is selected. [ERROR] Share to Gmail: Error message is "Can't attach empty file", only text shows up in the new email draft. [ERROR] Share to Google Keep: Error message is "Error importing data.", only text shows up in the new note.

report.summary: TextSecure without Gapps
report.label: None yet
report.description: TextSecure won't work without Google Play or the underlying Google Play services. I think this is a bad situation: IMHO the secure open-source messenger app, with strong open crypto relies on a proprietary (right? It's not open source, or is it?) library from a US based company. If the whatsapp client uses the TS-protocol, why should I use TS? There are quite some gappless phones and honestly, it is either Gapps and TS or no Gapps and no Messenger-App at his point. :) Also compare for #725.

report.summary: TS resending the last sent SMS some 100 times after "network unavailable" and flight mode cycle
report.label: None yet
report.description: The following has happened for the first time, after many months of TS working flawlessly on this phone: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/723ba29a67dcafdd3664 I sent a plain SMS message as expected (and done many times before) with TS. It was received by the adressee. Hours later, I found the GSM network "unavailable" (supposedly due to GSM hiccup, as the phone wasn't moved nor touched). I enabled, then re-disabled flight mode in order to cleanly reconnect to the tower. As soon as this happened, I was briefly notified that TS had troubles sending a message, and TS apparently started to flood the send queue with hundreds of resending attempts. Unfortunately, many (if not all) succeeded, giving the stunned recipient a massive SMS flood / DOS experience. There was a system popup dialog asking if I wanted to allow TS to send the high number of SMS messages it tried to, but the phone (S5, normally very fast and slick ROM) was so busy sending and playing sound alerts that dialog didn't seem to care about my answer (or was immediately replaced by a new instance, I don't know). I shut off the phone and restarted, but as soon as GSM was connected, the mess continued. Alas, I did not manage to capture any logs. When the phone finally got reponsive again, they appeared empty (I looked with System Tuner Pro).

report.summary: "Load full conversation" string is implementation-detail-ish
report.label: None yet
report.description: In ae97495, a limited number of messages are loaded and displayed in a conversation, with an affordance labeled "Load full conversation" (load_more_header__load_full_conversation) provided to load and display the rest. "Load" is a technical, implementation-detail-ish term which the user doesn't need to know. Platform apps use "view" or "show" in cases like this to clearly state to the everyday user the direct benefit of activating the affordance: View full conversation Show full conversation View all messages Show all messages

report.summary: Messages from the future
report.label: None yet
report.description: My friend is in a timezone 1h ahead of mine. When they send me a message, TS shows the time as one hour ahead of the current local time. There are two problems with this: It is confusing for the user when following the conversation / reading the message. The conversation list shows the conversation as 23h in the past, sorted below a conversation that was only a few "proper" hours in the past. Possible reason for the time difference: My friend did not set the timezone, but the time, when traveling to their current location. Thus our timezones are the same, but their time is wrong. I did not ask them to confirm that, yet. What I would expect from TS: When a conversation is in the future, show it above all others (sorted by relative/signed time difference), instead of sorting it by absolute/unsigned time difference. The server could append its own time, so that the receiving client has three times: sent-by-sender, received-by-server, received-by-recipient. Then: TS could show all three times in the message details. In the conversation view, it could show the time that (roughly) agrees with the others, filtering the third from the user's view by default. E.g. show an average of the two (of all three) times with the least difference.

report.summary: TextSecure keeps crashing
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, I am running updated textsecure on an HTC One M7 with Android 5.0.2. Yesterday, a friend with Signal on iOS tried to send me a picture. I have received messages and pictures from that person just fine before. But I got the "incoming MMS failed" instead of the actual picture. When I clicked on the "resend" link to the right of the message, it crashed the app. I then tried to re-open the app, but it immediately crashed and then gave the "Unfortunately, TextSecure has stopped" pop-up, and that pop-up comes up twice. I have tried restarting and powering off/on my phone, but still can't open TextSecure and get the same error message twice. The strange thing though is that I can see my new messages (from a different Signal user) that have come in by swiping down on the notification banner. But I can't reply because that would require actually opening the app, which isn't happening. I don't know how to send a log, but if this is something you can look into, please respond and I'll try to work with you on it. Thank you!

report.summary: Cannot send encrypted messages to a registered Signal user
report.label: None yet
report.description: Me (A) and two other persons (B,C) are using TextSecure (the current version 2.28.1) for several months to communicate via encrypted messages (showing the lock icon). Another person (D) has just got Signal freshly installed and registered (on iOS 8.4.1). She has got the phone numbers of A,B,C in her contacts (but strangely her Signal contact list shows A and B, not C). When A now sends a message to D, it shows the lock, and D can answer via Signal. However, we did not manage to send encrypted messages from B or C to D, and from D to B or C: B's and C's TextSecure always falls back to 'unsafe SMS', and D's Signal does not even offer to send a message to B or C. It seems that D's Signal did not find out that B and C are registered TextSecure users. I have put a protocol of B at https://gist.github.com/77a449110e97b2aecf39, and one of D at https://gist.github.com/ff7d002f0eb2f0d27883.

report.summary: Awkward/uncomfortable fingerprint-verification word combinations
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, one issue that comes up frequently when I make TextSecure/Signal calls with extended family is uncomfortable fingerprint-verification word choices. For example, today I had to explain to my parents why the words "retouch puberty" came up on their phone. Some other possibilities that will probably happen to people at some point: "newborn puberty" "showgirl penetrate" "facial escapade" "adult visitor" 95% of the time it doesn't matter at all, but if it were possible, I'd prefer that the word combinations be extremely boring. I want to be able to recommend Signal to anyone without worrying about whether they'll get weird words and end up being creeped out. I'd be happy to go through and change the words in src/org/thoughtcrime/redphone/crypto/zrtp/SASCalculator.java, but I think there may be some additional work to do around versioning. Is changing this list possible / realistic? If you all think this should be changed too, I'm happy to help... I was building TS from source for a while but stopped a few months ago. I don't mind getting everything set up again if it means this will get changed.

report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi All, I did upgrade to version 3.1.1. and delete "Redphone", unfortunately I find out that secured calls will be "muted" on both sides after around 500ms. The only what I can hear is a piece of word "Hallo". I did run Wireshark and it looks that after around 500ms all UDP packages have the same length 72 bytes (from the package 55). Before length was jumping from the 28 till 164 bytes. Assuming payload is "0". If you check logs, the call start from the line 4576 --> https://gist.github.com/anonymous/a0f9b5a517dbadac4b8a#file-cat-log-L4576 Traces https://www.dropbox.com/s/0anbpmi5sbtwysn/TC_call_v311.pcap?dl=0 Samsung GT-I9305 + CyanogenMod 11, Android 4.4.4.

report.summary: Pal sending me signal messages, I don't have it, it says delivered
report.label: None yet
report.description: So, I had an Experia Z1 months back. I tried TextSecure over a year ago and thought it was OK, but I didn't really commit and so removed it. Factory-erased it a couple months back and sold it, bought a Galaxy S6. Didn't install Signal at all. When I look in the play store, it says it's installed. Doesn't say where tho. I'm allowed to install it and it offers my Galaxy. The Experia no longer shows in my devices as of course I removed it. To be clear - Signal is absolutely NOT installed on my Galaxy and never has been. He texted me yesterday via signal and it said it was delivered securely. I didn't receive it (of course, I don't have Signal). So I texted him a normal SMS today and it came up on his device with the little padlock. How is this? I can't possibly have sent him a secure message, and where are his messages to me going? When he goes to message me, it says "Send Signal message", which would have led him to believe it was encrypted and being sent to me. I've kept my same mobile number, and the buyer of my experia didn't get any old sim cards or anything. So, ummm... bug?

report.summary: (some) users in Mexico cannot register / can register only temporarily
report.label: None yet
report.description: At least some users in Mexico are having difficulty registering with Signal. As far as I've heard, this is an ongoing problem that also affected TextSecure. The symptoms I've seen are that 1) SMS registration does not work - the registration times out unsuccessfully. 2) The user can successfully register using voice verification, and an encrypted session can be initialized, and messages sent back and forth. 3) However, the Mexican phone then decides that it is no longer registered, and encrypted messages cannot be sent or received. I suspect this issue may be related to #3360 - there are multiple valid formats for a Mexican phone number. I've posted a debug log.

Due to differencies between languages I can't use () keys in the cases above and if I don't use them Transifex doesn't let me save my translations. I suggest you solve these issues the same way as you did with #2421, without using () keys.

report.summary: Contact's phone number doesn't update when changing sim
report.label: None yet
report.description: So a friend of mine recently changed their sim card and thus got a new phone number. In the normal Signal chat session pane it will show the person's name with their phone number below it. However, this number has stayed the same when I view my chat with this person. I actually had no idea this person had changed their sim/number until a few weeks later, even though I was frequently messaging them via Signal. After they told me I then added their number to my contacts list (so now both the new and old numbers are listed under their name in my phone's contacts list). However, the Signal chat pane still shows the old number. I should point out that this in no way affects functionality of the app, it's purely the aesthetical display of the phone number under their name. If this is due to the fact I still have the old number saved, I cannot remove that as that friend still swaps between the 2 sims on rare occasions.

report.summary: receiving a group message from changed identity appears in normal coversation
report.label: None yet
report.description: Reproducible like that: A and B are having a normal Signal conversation A gets a new phone and registers for Signal again -> new key A is creating a new group with B A is writing a message in that group B is receiving 2 key exchange messages in the existing/normal conversation with A (group creation + message) B is accepting the new key in one of them: the message appears in the existing conversation and the group is created without this message

report.summary: microg GmsCore as free alternative for proprietary Gms
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello As @moxie0 stated here: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=10498671 he would be pleased to see a 'API-compatible open source implementation of play services' to make it possible to use signal with GMS without the need to install GAPPS. Well, there is now good progress in this direction with the project microG GmsCore. This aims to be a 'framework to allow applications designed for Google Play Services to run on systems, where Play Services is not available'. Would it be possible to accept this as an alternative? At the moment this project can be used to run Signal without GAPPS. The disadvantage is that microg GmsCore needs to fake app signatures at the moment to get Signal running. This is a huge security risk. If Signal would accept microg GmsCore as an alternative to the proprietary implementation, there would be no need anymore to tamper with the android security system. What do you Signal developers think about this and would you consider this as an alternative? Kind regards. PS: I am not affiliated with this project. More can be found here: http://forum.xda-developers.com/android/apps-games/app-microg-gmscore-floss-play-services-t3217616 https://github.com/microg

report.summary: Contacts with WhatsApp appearing twice in Signal's contact list
report.label: None yet
report.description: I guess this is somehow related to #4029, but that one seems to be fixed - while I'm still experiencing that kind of issue. Almost all of my contacts appear a couple of times in Signal's contact list - with all of their different phone numbers. So far, so good (expected behaviour). But many have additional duplicate entries with the same number (it's always a mobile number) listed twice. One of them has the format +12 345 67890 (which is exactly how I format all of my phone book's entries). The other one (the duplicate) has the very same number, but formatted as +1234567890 (a format not to be found in my phone book). I've noticed that - as far as I looked - each of the contacts with this kind of duplicate has an WhatsApp entry in Android's phone book (actually 2 entries - one for calls and one for messages). Interestingly, though, the WhatsApp entries in Android's phone book are also (sort of correctly) formatted as +12 345 67890. I don't necessarily say that the WhatsApp entries are the culprit (i. e. they confuse Signal). But it surely looks like they are. It has been like this for a long time, but I just took the time to inspect this more closely. I'm using vanilla Android 6 on a Nexus 5 with Signal 3.3.0.

report.summary: registering with the same phone number breaks original registration
report.label: None yet
report.description: Since commit 5757962 was added, you can now install Signal on WiFi-only devices like tablets. However, if you do this, and register using the same phone number as your phone with a Signal install, your phone will no longer be able to receive or send Signal messages (and vice versa). The obvious solution is better multi-device support, which is already on the roadmap. But until then, there should be some warning that you can only have one device per number right now.

report.summary: No dialer integration since move from Redphone to Signal
report.label: None yet
report.description: Previous behavior (with Redphone): If I initiated a call from the system dialer for a user that was registered with Redphone, I received a pop-up asking if I wanted to upgrade the call to a Redphone call. In addition, calls showed up in the list of sent, received, and missed calls in the system dialer even if placed via Redphone. Current Behavior: With the introduction of Signal, there is no longer any dialer integration. Why the change matters: I think this was a nice feature as it means a user could simply initiate calls through the system dialer as opposed to opening Signal to initiate a call. This make it more likely that unsophisticated users, like my mother, would actually make secure calls since they don't have to do anything differently. A Google search revealed another user brought up this issue, but attempting to access that page results in a 404. I didn't see any existing issues in Github. Tested with Signal 3.1.1 and 3.3.1 on Cyanogenmod 11 (Milestone 11), Android 4.4.4, on a One Plus One (A0001).

report.summary: Feature Request: Ephemerous messages (local AND remote)
report.label: None yet
report.description: Any plans to add the same feature as Wickr ? ie. allowing one user to attach to a message a period at the end of which the message is destroyed locally and remotely (on both the sender and receiver phones). Like you can see on this screenshot of Wickr, you set up a time bomb on every new message, and all past message have an indication of when they will be deleted: Signal allow this locally but not remotely such as Wickr does. With this feature, there would be no more reason to use Wickr over Signal ! Thanks !

report.summary: Annoying SMS notifications when a messages have been received
report.label: None yet
report.description: I see two different behaviours when I am in Canada and in Chile, whenever I send a SMS (non-secure text message). In Canada (koodo), I see a check next to the message I sent, and that is. Good. In Chile (virgin, a virtual provider), I see a check, but I also receive from 1 to 3 extra messages saying: Mensaje fue recibido por +56######### . (which translates to Message was received by +56######### .) I believe I receive 1 message for as many cell-operators (roaming) the message have passed to get to its destination. And I guess that because the message is in Spanish, Signal does not parse it in order to hide it or change it for something else. The annoying part is that in a conversation, it appears that infamous message every time I sent something, so the thread is hard to follow. Besides that I get a notification when I have not received an actual reply, tricking me. If you point me in the right direction, I might provide a patch to fix it. Update: Android 4.4, Signal 3.3.1 (when it just became Signal from TextSecure).

report.summary: Signal messages delayed and unable to initiate secure calls until recipient restarts Signal app
report.label: None yet
report.description: Over the last several days, I've noticed that messages are occasionally not being delivered (one checkmark) and I am unable to initiate a secure call to said contact. I confirmed that the user's phone was on at the time, he had a data connection (Wifi), and in fact the Signal app was opened in the background. The user was able to receive emails and regular phone calls without issue. Restarting the Signal app fixed the problem. In addition, after restarting the app, he recevied all my previous messages. This user was running Android 4.4.4 on a One Plus One with Signal 3.1.1. I had a similar issue with a Signal iOS user (Signal 2.2, iOS 8.4.1, iPhone 5S). Messages to that user went through nearly instantly but I was unable to initiate a secure call. However, the user could call me via Signal, and my phone rang nearly instantly. When the user closed the Signal app, I was able to initiate a call, and it rang on her phone within a second. I understand that Google Cloud Messaging is believed it be causing delayed message delivery intermittently. However, the behavior I'm seeing appears to impact both iOS and Android clients, the messages are not merely delayed but do not arrive at all until the app is restarted, and when the recipient restarts his/her Signal applicaiton, new messages sent to that user are delivered within seconds. As noted above, calls are also impacted. I can't see why restarting Signal would suddenly make GCM more reliable, so it seems there may be a bug in Signal causing the delays and inability to initiate secure calls. Would logs useful? If so, do you want them for me (sender) or the recipient that isn't receiving the messages?

To fix this George can call someone with Signal or system dialer and end the call immediately. Now audio will play through the loud speaker again and normal volume controls become available. This has been an issue for me since Signal 3.3.x (currently using 3.4.1) Affects both of my devices: Nexus 4, stock 5.1.1 Huawei U8800, 4.0.4

report.summary: Cannot connect with 6-digits NSN
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, I cannot connect using my phone number from New Caledonia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_New_Caledonia). The regulator uses 6-digits NSN (National Significant Numbers) and it seems there's an application validation before sending it to twilio. The application say that the number is invalid, twilio says it's OK using Lookup. The twilio's format verification API is free, it should be used instead of the in-app test.

report.summary: Improve error handling if a member of a signal group unregisters
report.label: None yet
report.description: When creating a group with one or more contacts which aren't registered with Signal, there is a very clear notification that an MMS group will be created, which could lead to additional costs. Current experience: When someone unregisteres from Signal while s/he is part of a group, the other group members receive error messages saying the message couldn't be sent, even tough it is in fact sent to the remaining members of the group. The error message is even more confusing, because the message has the same "click for more details" notification next to it like messages that failed to send because the server couldn't be reached. In the latter case you can see to which members the message failed to send and just click "resend" to resolve the issue. In the "a member of a signal group unregistered" case there are no more details and nothing to do for the user. Proposed experience: When Signal notices that a group member is no longer registered, there should be a notification that this member was removed from the group and has to be readded manually if they register again. A fallback to MMS would probably be the worst option, because it could create huge intransparent costs e.g. for European users, leading to the immeadiate removal of the app. I'm looking forward to your thoughts and improvement ideas! Edit: The messages are usually delivered even if the error message is shown. But the constant error messages confuse users and make them loose faith in the app.

For example for 2282 it adds +47 to the number so it will be +47 2282 if you live in Norway, that makes it impossible to send because the GSM networks (at least here in Norway) don't allow +47 in front of short numbers. I tried with version 3.3.3.

report.summary: GIF animation quirks
report.label: None yet
report.description: Noticed on mcginty/TextSecure@35d003a (#4589) GIFs shared with forwarding or from outside Signal don't move in the thumbnail or convo list preview, though the draft preview does move as well as it does in the image view some repro steps: in app attach: attach animated image gif see it move in draft send see it move in thumbnail see it move in convo list see it move in image viewer see all moving on receiver side forward moving preview gif forward message to self (or other convo) see draft moving send see STILL of gif in thumbnail see STILL of gif in convo list see it move in image viewer see SAME behavior on receiver side share to signal: choose your favorite gallery app pick animated gif share to signal pick contact or group see draft moving send see STILL of gif in thumbnail (or in one case just blackness instead of thumb) see STILL of gif in convo list (correct still in the above blackness case) see it move in image viewer see SAME behavior on receiver side
