report.summary: Messages (delivery receipts?) are slow to deliver
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports For some reason, all messages delivered through Signal are slow to deliver. I say this based on the checkmark (sent/delivered) indicator, but also based on manually talking to a contact to figure out when things came through. I find that when this happens, asking the other person to send me a Signal message will force all undelivered messages to go through. In this case, calling through Signal doesn't work - it's just stuck at dialing forever (although it's possible, though unlikely, that I just didn't wait long enough). However, once pending messages are "flushed", calling starts working again. This happens both on Signal Android and a linked Signal Desktop. I've also seen it happen when contacting contacts on both Android and iOS. At least one of the contacts I've seen this with has been on Signal for months, and at least one contact I've seen this with had literally just installed and registered. When this doesn't happen, I find that messages will sometimes take a couple seconds to go through, but before I started running into this issue (which was a week or two ago), messages would generally go through almost instantly. All contacts that I'm sending messages to are in the same geographic area, so in theory we should all be contacting the same server region (in case there servers run in e.g. multiple AWS regions). Device info Device: Nexus 6P Android version: CyanogenMod 13.0-20160604-NIGHTLY-angler, based on Android 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.16.0, installed via the Google Play Store gapps was installed via the OpenGApps nano package. I'm on Play Store 6.5.08.D-all [0] 2792142, Google Play Services 9.0.83 (440-121911109). The problem seems to occur regardless of whether or not I'm on a WiFi network. I called my contact over the cell network - he was on WiFi while I was seeing the issue, and said that both my test messages went through when he disconnected (although I only saw a delivery receipt on one of them - possibly a different bug). Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/7e71ea3ce262b82d798d5b5bdd40b49b

report.summary: Please consider supporting Firefox
report.label: None yet
report.description: Signal is an open source application meant to protect users' privacy. Firefox is an open source browser with privacy as one of its main goals. It doesn't feel right to use Signal on Chrome, a closed-source browser. Please consider supporting Firefox.

report.summary: Remote Deletion of my sent messages on other chat partners devices AKA kill switch for messages
report.label: None yet
report.description: Feature suggestion: Remote Deletion of my sent messages on other chat partners devices AKA kill switch for messages, that I wrote. Current Situation: Android: can limit to e.g. 50 messages, older messages get deleted automatically. (need to define this for all chat partners individually) Feature Suggestion Variant A) I can set the "Remote limit of my messages" to automatically cut off after 50 messages in MY chat with the other chat partner on THEIR devices. (kill older messages, than 50) Variant B) Remote Delete my sent messages on other chat partners devices (kill my messages) Reason: I want to keep control of my messages, of my lines that I sent, after I sent them.

report.summary: Message not delivered until the phone is unlocked
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I'm using Signal on a Sony Xperia M2 and it works perfectly. My sister just installed Signal on her Sony Xperia M4 a few days ago but when we're sending messages to each other, the message doesn't deliver until we unlock our Android phones… Is there something we can do to avoid that? It's very annoying and I have to unlock my phone every 30 minutes or so to be sure that my sister hasn't sent me a message… And she has the exact same problem. Steps to reproduce I send her a message or she sends me a message with the Android Signal app. Actual result: I don't receive the messages that my sister sends me with the Android Signal application when my phone is locked. I have to unlock my phone to receive her messages. And she has the same problem when I send her a message. Expected result: I should receive her messages without having to unlock my phone, like you normally receive messages on a phone. Device info Device: Sony Xperia M2 (for me) and Sony Xperia M4 (for my sister) Android version: 4.4.4 Signal version: 3.16.0 Link to debug log There's no debug log.

report.summary: Signal asks for access to everything
report.label: None yet
report.description: This is a credibility issue. I try to get everyone to use Signal, but twice in a row now when I try to get Android users (i have iOS) to do it, they are fine until Signal requires access to everything. Then I look like a liar, a dummy, or both. For example, why does Signal need access to the calendar? Just because it's open source isn't enough for many people to trust it if their phone tells them it wants to see everything. Is there a way to let users opt out of some features so they can decide what the appropriate level of access is?

report.summary: Provider reusing old phone number leads to some fun
report.label: None yet
report.description: Changing phone number after verifying old phone number can lead to interesting stuff if provider decides to reuse old phone number. NOTE: This might not be an issue with app or might not be an issue at all but something to keep in mind, or maybe it is known (quick google returned nothing similar). Or maybe something can be done with protocol or by making app verify SIM_card/phone_number did not change. No idea. Just putting this here. Steps to reproduce Register and verify current phone number with signal. Change phone number. (get new sim card in my case). 2.1. Forget to register and verify your new phone number with signal (because it still works! I still get messages from my signal contacts...). Get old phone number blocked and reused by provider. (someone else now has your old phone number) (I think this could be easily reproduced without providers reusing your phone number and just putting sim card into some other phone) (TO RESEARCH: what would happen if new owner of my old phone number also registered that phone number with signal? Would I receive his/her messages assuming I did not change my signal phone number?) Actual result: Other people can still send SMS to you by using your old phone number while using signal. Using not_signal to send messages sends them to person who now has your old phone number. Calling them via signal (icon was of not encrypted call) calls new owner of your old phone number (awkward conversation...). Expected result: No idea. Check if user has not changed their phone number to prevent such fun incidents?

report.summary: Sending regular SMS to a Signal user
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I can't send a regular SMS to a contact with whom I normally use Signal. This is sometimes necessary if a contact exhausted their data plan for example. The only workaround I've found is to make the regular SMS app the default app, send the message, then set the default back to Signal. Steps to reproduce Make sure Signal is the default app for SMS Look up the contact in the address book Click in the message icon next to the number Compose a message Actual result: Message is sent through the Signal protocok, and there is no way to change that behaviour. The contact doesn't get it if they don't have an internet connection on their device Expected result: There would be a way to switch temporarily to regular messages for the contact. Not sure of the exact optimal behaviour in terms of UX, but it should be technically possible to send an SMS.

report.summary: Stopped using signal, new signal user's message to me didn't get delivered
report.label: None yet
report.description: Bug description I used to have Signal for Android which I loved. However I got an ubuntu phone which doesn't have signal. My friend got a new phone and I recommended that they get signal. They sent me a message (which was an encrypted one as it detected my cell number) which I never received. I presume this is because Signal is trying to deliver an encrypted message to me which I can't receive. Ideally Signal would detect that I no longer use the app and can't receive encrypted messages, and should deliver a normal SMS instead. Steps to reproduce use signal stop using signal someone who still uses signal sends you a message Actual result: you never receive the sent message. Expected result: signal defaults to SMS (or asks sender if they're okay downgrading to SMS) once it realises you're no longer using the app and can't receive encrypted messages. Device info Sending device Device: Huawei P9 Android version: 6.0 Signal version: 3.16.0

report.summary: Suggestion about how SMS should be handled with signal users
report.label: None yet
report.description: I think it should be made more clear that SMS is possible with signal contacts, as it's not immediately obvious that you have to hold down the send button. There are a few annoying edge-cases that come up when a user doesn't have an internet connection. One, is that signal doesn't "remember" that it's sending a message. If you consider another platform like WhatsApp, if there isn't an internet connection, the app keeps trying to send it until it succeeds. With signal, if a user sends a message and forgets about it, it won't be sent even when an internet connection becomes available again. Another solution is to transition to SMS when there isn't a connection. Obviously a seamless transition brings forth security concerns, but a warning message alerting the user that a connection isn't available and then asking if they'd like to send an insecure SMS message instead could work. The app would display the messages differently and ask again after n minutes.

report.summary: Delivery confirmation not carrying over from Signal Desktop to Android in group chats
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The second checkmark that should be displayed when a message is delivered to the recipients does not show up on Signal for Android when the message is sent from Signal for Desktop. The message itself shows up, but not the delivery confirmation. Messages sent from Android do show up as confirmed delivered on the desktop, so I believe this is an issue with the Android version. This bug only happens in a group chat, private messages do not encounter this problem. This bug makes it hard to keep track of what has been delivered and what hasn't. I have confirmed that all of the messages in the screenshots were delivered by talking to the recipients in person. Steps to reproduce Connect Signal on Android and desktop Send a message from the desktop version to a group chat Check the conversation on Android Actual result: Messages don't show delivery confirmation on Android, but do show it on desktop Expected result: Messages show up as delivered on both Screenshots The messages sent in this first set of screenshots were sent from my desktop. Notice that the delivery confirmation is missing in the Android version. As a comparison, these messages were sent from my Android. The delivery confirmation does transfer to my desktop. Device info Device: Motorola Nexus 6; Windows Desktop Android version: CyanogenMod 13, Android 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.16.0 Android; 0.16.1 Desktop Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/425ddb3e370d74bcb8948f3d9ab69b96 👍 2

report.summary: Feature: Delete encrypted database with deletion passphrase
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Currently it is possible to retry and to guess the passphrase for an encrypted database. In case a person is enforced to reveal the data, after some time and multiple threats one may decide to use the correct passphrase and the data gets decrypted although it may contain sensible information. It might be useful to be able to set a deletion passphrase which causes creates an empty new database or a sane version with some dummy messages and deletes the actual messages. Steps to reproduce This is not a bug report but a features request. Actual result: Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) The feature does not exist yet. Expected result: Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) Ideal steps: In Settings -> privacy, in case a passphrase is set, provide a field "set deletion passphrase". It should not be visible if such a passphrase is enabled. Old ones may not be overwritten. If this passphrase is entered to access signal, all data shall be deleted. Screenshots Device info Link to debug log Concerns: Professionals who know about this feature would first backup all data, so this feature won't provide full security of the data. It is assumed that in most cases the technical competence and knowledge about app specifics of enforcement is limited.

report.summary: Limit contact access to user-chosen contact group
report.label: None yet
report.description: I'd prefer not to share my Signal availability to all my contacts, but rather to a contact group I can select. I recognize this is perhaps a niche request, I'd also be helped with pointers how I can program this myself in a private build. I have contacted support@whispersystems.org and they said they couldn't help me, so it looks like that channel isn't the right path for feature requests or tips on how to get into the code base. I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal uses all my system contacts when looking for people to contact/sending the list of number hashes to the signal servers for discovery. I'd prefer not to announce my usage of Signal to everyone in my contacts list but rather to a specific contact group. Steps to reproduce Sign up for Signal All my system contacts are notified I use Signal Actual result: All my system contacts get notified I use Signal if they also have Signal installed Expected result: Only those contacts which are in a special selected group (Let's say "Signal") should get that notification

report.summary: Need protection against SMS interception by hostile carrier
report.label: None yet
report.description: Telegram has recently been involved in a government-led hack that exposed many of their Iranian customers: https://nakedsecurity.sophos.com/2016/08/03/telegram-apps-sms-activation-used-to-expose-activists-and-journalists/ The problem is that the carrier intercepted the activation SMS and set up new devices for one's account. Signal seems to have the same vulnerability, maybe worse, since there doesn't seem to be a way to add a password to an account (which Telegram has). There should be a way to better protect users in countries where the government and the carrier cannot be trusted.

report.summary: Add "Paranoid Mode" or something similar to further encapsulate the complexity and make Signal even more userfriendly
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hey there, I hope this issue is correctly placed here. I want to split it in two tiers: My perception of what the Signal client lacks to be even more user-friendly and easily adaptable, and my personal suggestion, how this situation could be improved. I just realized, that this is a extension of #838 with a slightly different approach. Its still a relevant and interesting topic, in my opinion. The Problem There is a huge trade-off between privacy / trustworthiness and usability (ok, this was obvious). I use signal ever since it was TextSecure and started with SMS (maybe 3 years ago?) and watched it evolve over the time. It continuously became more seamless to use but in my perception, some of this implementations are diametrically opposed to the reason, we all use Signal: privacy. And on the other hand, there are some features that are still very annoying, and I'd bet that this is because of the integrity of the encryption. My Suggestion Eliminate the trade-off between security and convenience: Every feature, that makes the usage more smoothly but on the other hand compromises security / integrity / privacy, should be opt-in/opt-out (with reasonable defaults or a wizard to set them). I assume, that this could help signal to differentiate itself from the competition (e.g. WhatsApp, Threema, Telegram), while makeing it smoothly and even more secure and trustworthy at the same time. Some examples Convenience features, that should be defeatable The sync of my contacts (and everything, that is connected to it): The option could be something like "Stop uploading my contactlist to the servers" - with an explanation what that means to usability. Annoying "features", that kill the user experience when re-registering or reinstalling the app, my friends need to manually add me to our groups. (My guess would be that this is because of the changed encryption-keys, however, it annoys me.) The option could be something like: "Ignore key-changes in all conversations" - with an explanation of what that means to vulnerability. What do you think? Is this even reasonable? Do you have more suggestons of opt-in-features? Best Regards!

report.summary: comparing mac digests with Arrays.equals
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, out of interest, when comparing MAC digests, current implementation uses Arrays.equals(ourMacBytes, theirMacBytes) (in lieu of, lets say, the crypto friendly java.security.MessageDigest.isEqual). Not sure how relevant timing attack is in the context of the client performing such comparison in non-constant time fashion, but as a matter of principle, in a crypto conscious app, you'd think that ought to be there regardless, specially, that MAC digests are already truncated relative to their original ful length values.

report.summary: Group chats are broken after switching to a new phone.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates, which is getting more and more complicated, due to all the open issues. read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I was member of a Group when I switched phones and wiped the old one. Upon registering on the new phone the Group did not appear. When someone wrote tot he group again it appeared as Unnamed group, which I cannot rename, and in the group details view has a cryptic name. I can not write messages to the group from my phone (the text input area seems locked). I can however send messages to it from a linked web client, which works just fine and all members receive the messages I sent. I can however not remove myself from this group, nor can anybody else remove me. This behavior is utterly broken. Steps to reproduce Be member of a group, switch to new phone, receive message from group. Device info Device: Oneplus 3 and Oneplus One Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.17.0 👍 3

report.label: None yet
report.description: Bug description When I want to invite people to Google's new video service Duo I get the wrong number in Signal but not in other SMS applications I tested. Steps to reproduce Open Google Duo Click on "video call" Click on "invite" of someone Use Signal for sending the SMS Actual result: The country code is wrong, so the number +49 161 7654321 looks like +49249201617654321. The first 492 is my local country code, it stays the same no matter what the actual one is, the second 492 depends on the number, if it Germany it is 492, if it the US it is 12. After that the number follows in a local form, so for German numbers it begins with an 0. Expected result: The SMS should be sent to the actual number. Screenshots Device info Device: Google Nexus 5 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.17.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/0760c4767d1cc6b25fa0eb9cb14d1ee5

report.summary: Group messages that are only sent to some of the members may be sent multiple times to all users when attempting to resend.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I have a large group chat of Signal users (12), and when a message is sent to some, but not all of the members, (likely due to intermittent internet connectivity) that message may be spammed when the user attempts to resend the message by clicking on it for details, then manually clicking "Resend" to each member, to all members, the number of times the "Resend" button was clicked, plus one if they received the message the first time. Steps to reproduce Take a group message that failed to send to some users, but not all users. Click "Resend" on all of the users it failed to send to the first time. For every time the "Resend" button is pressed, all users will receive the message again, if this time it is successful. Actual result: So I walked around a large building that I was in, while on data, sending messages until one of them failed to send to some users, but not all. I then walked outside of the building, to where I had a good data connection, and pressed the "Resend" button on all of the users. Instead of re-sending to just the ones that were clicked, all users received the message, and those that had received it the first time, received it once more. Expected result: If a message fails to send to some users, when I press the "Resend" button to a specific user, it should resend the message to ONLY that user, or to all users that failed originally, but preventing the user from pressing the "Resend" button again, unless the resend fails once more.. Notes All users that have caused the spam have been Android users. I believe this might be caused by rapidly pressing all of the "Resend" buttons before Signal Resends the message. Device info Device: Galaxy Note IV Android version: 5.1.1 Signal version: 3.17.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/879a9a137d8874e854b38a87d34a240b

report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Since the upgrade to Signal 3.18.3, i do not receive SMS nor acknowledgement of receipt. Steps to reproduce Send an insecure SMS to a contact who do no use signal wait for the acknowledgment nothing happen Actual result: Look like an idiot when you meet you friend and you have receive their message. Expected result: acknowledgment and response message Send an unsecure SMS to a ping call reporting service. wait You never receive the acknowledgement nor the automated response. Actual result: No response nor acknowledgment Expected result: acknowledgment and response message Try to buy something only with Visa secure 3D, etc. You never receive the one time password via SMS Actual result: you never receive the confirmation code Expected result: response messages The phone have been restarted, signal is the default SMS application, hangout is not setup, messeger is not setup and do not have access to the phone SMS. Screenshots The 33700 is ping call and automatic caller reporting service, it automatically respond to reporting with an acknowledgment message. 33700 is french public number, the other number are scammer numbers. Device info Device : LGE Nexus 5 (hammerhead) Android : 6.0.1 (3067468, MOB30Y) Memory : 43M (10.97% free, 192M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : wpef17.hot.corp.google.com App : Signal 3.18.3 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/df5b91e07599cc91260372c8762843ed

report.summary: Allow user to specify the directory where media, backups, etc are saved
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports This is a pretty straightforward feature request. Right now, saving media places it in the root of the media type (eg the "Pictures" directory) and backups get exported to the root of the device. I'd like to be able to specify an alternate directory, to keep my device less-cluttered. In the case of media in particular, it would be great if it would be possible to do in settings, so that the user won't have to choose a location in a dialogue every time they save something (or if there must be a dialogue, have it remember the last chosen location so the user doesn't have to navigate to the right directory every time)

report.summary: Feature Request: Distribute Signal w/ deterministic biuilds (Gitian).
report.label: None yet
report.description: Deterministic builds (Gitian) is an excellent, decentralized, secure means of distributing binaries: Gitian is a secure source-control oriented software distribution method. This means you can download trusted binaries that are verified by multiple builders. Gitian uses a deterministic build process to allow multiple builders to create identical binaries. This allows multiple parties to sign the resulting binaries, guaranteeing that the binaries and tool chain were not tampered with and that the same source was used. It removes the build and distribution process as a single point of failure. Gitian is used in the Bitcoin project. Yes, there have been many issues (e.g., #122, #127, #281, #282, #458, #525, #722, #2858, #3435, #3954, #4429, #4430) regarding distributing Signal in other ways than via Google Play or Apple Store, but I do not think my feature request is a duplicate of those.

report.summary: Plans for Numberless accounts
report.label: None yet
report.description: While contact discovery is useful for the usecase of an average user just wanting secure communication with their friends, it is a huge security risk for activists. Although Signal is not primarily aimed at activists, there are no suitable alternatives on mobile. Are there plans to improve Signal in this area? Numbers are available to anyone in the group chat, so adding someone to a group requires you have to trust them not to leak phone numbers. There are no display names, so having everyone introduce themselves to each other is tedious and requires adding each other to contact lists, which is potentially a security risk as well. Global display names would not solve the problem, as you'd need to use a separate one in your activism group chats and with your friends.

I tried that link in the browser, but Signal said that for my own protection I should scan from inside Signal. I attempted again after having unlinked my previously linked device, with the same result. So, I'm stuck. Device info Andorid 4.0.4 and Signal 3.18.3 on HTC Thunderbolt I am only using the Signal client, it is not set as the default SMS app. Ubuntu 16.04 Gnome and Signal 0.22.2 on Thinkpad T530

report.summary: Android N Additional emoji Support
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal doesn't support the full range of emoji's now offered in Android N such as skin color. I know Signal uses the Apple emoji's but it doesn't offer the latest emoji's incorporated into iOS either. List of Emoji's on Android N: http://emojipedia.org/google/android-7.0/ List of Emoji's on iOS: http://emojipedia.org/apple/ Is it possible to add support for the new emoji's supported by Apple and Google? I know this is a pretty low priority issue but from a "usability" standpoint, it stands out as an "issue" for non technical people who have been converted by their techy friends. Would be nice to stay current on the flashy parts of the Android and iOS ecosystems so it is easier to be an evangelist and get people to convert to Signal. Steps to reproduce Use the new skin tone emoji's using a keyboard such as google keyboard or Swiftkey Actual result: Unicode support for skin tone are not supported in Signal. Expected result: Accurate depiction of the most recent emoji's used by Apple and Google. Screenshots Device info Device: Nexus 6P Android version: 7.0 Signal version: 3.19.0 👍 1

report.summary: Play sound when call ends
report.label: None yet
report.description: Especially when the internet connection is bad, Redphone calls sometimes break. It would be great to hear a sound as soon as a call ends, because I happened to continue talking quite often without noticing that the call is already over. The feature is available in normal phone calls too, so I think Signal should definitely have it.

report.summary: Offer option to choose emoji font
report.label: None yet
report.description: After reading #3675 and #3445 I would like to request a feature that the user can choose which emoji font (Apple or Emoji One) to use. The default would be whatever is used now.

report.summary: Option to display contact in terms of name and/or number
report.label: None yet
report.description: In order to counter shoulder surfing an option could be added to show a contact in: name + (wherever possible) phone number (as is currently done and default option name only (no phone numbers are shown anywhere unless contact is not in address book phone numbers only (no names are shown anywhere, only initial letter in contact avatar) (alternatively as name, the same initial could be used as is used for the contact's avatar) Places where this applies is the overview of contacts, a dialogue, notification drawer et cetera. Implementing would greatly counter shoulder surfing in terms of with whom one is commuicating.

report.summary: [Feature Request] Automatic backups/exports (as an option)
report.label: None yet
report.description: I want to see Signal to have a setting where it can automatically create a backup on the phone of it's messages (SMS/MMS/etc) and the key set, in a bundle that I can backup to my servers (for example, to ownCloud). There's already a way to export to clear text, but this doesn't backup the keys. And, this is manual. I need this, otherwise wiping my device, or switching to a new one, is going to be painful. Or, to put it another way, if my phone is lost, so is all my messaging. Who isn't an advocate for backups? Please?

report.summary: Need way to persistently mark contact as insecure contact
report.label: None yet
report.description: We need a per-contact setting to disable secure messaging, and just use regular SMS. Why? I have come across contacts who are incorrectly considered to be Signal users. That is to say: Signal wants to send them encrypted messages over data, but these people do not have Signal installed, and claim to have never used Signal or TextSecure previously. I assume the issue comes about from mobile number re-use.

report.summary: Signal Icon in App Drawer/Home should return the user to last viewed screen.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When Signal is called from the "Recent Apps List", or "Overview" the user is properly returned to the window they were last using. However, When Signal is selected from App Drawer, or Home, the conversation list is always displayed as if first being run. This is nonstandard from other messenger apps and does not give the user the functionality they expect. Steps to reproduce Select Signal from either Home or App Drawer Select a conversation Press the Home Key Select Signal from home or App Drawer Actual result: When selecting signal from either the app drawer or home screen you are always presented with the same conversation list. Expected result: A New user expects selecting signal from the app drawer or home screen to return to the last open window (be it the last conversation, setting screen, etc) just as if they selected it from the recent apps list.

report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description This seems to be related to #3989, #4374, #4339, which is marked as fixed in 3.3.0. I think what is different in this case is that Signal only crashes if the app is locked when I share to it, not when it is unlocked. Steps to reproduce Make sure Signal is locked with a passphrase Share an image from Google Photos to Signal Enter Signal Password Actual result: Signal crashes Expected result: Presented with recipient list to send image to Device info Device: Huawei Nexus 6P Android version: 7.0 Signal version: Tested on 3.18.3 and 3.19.1 (Built from source) Link to debug log (3.18.3) https://gist.github.com/99b00f670f72768e438cb01a21307b39 (3.19.1) https://gist.github.com/1714e592a4cad1d08fe7f0d68c16e49a

report.summary: Disappearing message notification disappears in group thread but not in contact thread
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When you change the disappearing message timer, a notification appears, but whether that notification hangs around depends on whether you're in a group vs. contact thread. Steps to reproduce Given I'm in a group thread When I enable the (unreleased) disappearing messages feature And set the timer to 5 seconds Then I see the "You set disappearing message time to 5 seconds." In five seconds that info message is deleted. Given I'm in a contact thread When I enable the (unreleased) disappearing messages feature And set the timer to 5 seconds Then I see the "You set disappearing message time to 5 seconds." The info message never gets deleted. Actual result: Contact thread "You set disappearing message time" info messages are never deleted. Expected result: Primarily I expect the Contact thread info message to be deleted. Though if you could make a case for why the notification should remain, then at least it should be consistent across group and contact threads.

report.summary: Use read receipt envelope timestamp to infer startExpirationTime of disappearing messages
report.label: None yet
report.description: Link Android and Desktop with disappearing messages support Go to conversation list on Android Open a conversation on Desktop Receive a 10s disappearing message on Desktop Note that it is also received and marked read in the Android conversation list Wait 10 seconds Actual result: Message expires from Desktop, but is still readable Android Expected result: Message expires on both clients at about the same time Note that it's not enough to start the timer when marking the message read. You have to back-date it by looking at the send time of the read receipt itself in case your client has been offline for a while.

report.summary: Disappearing messages: Window size of timeframe picker jumpy
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description In some translations (e. g. German...), the vertical window size for the 'Disappearing messages' picker is changing when changing the selection from 'Off' to some timeframe. This is because the description string changes from the rather short ExpirationDialog_your_messages_will_not_expire to the rather lengthy ExpirationDialog_your_messages_will_disappear_s_after_they_have_been_seen. Please add space for one (or even two to be really sure) more line of text in the description so the window size stays constant for both strings. I guess this should suffice for any language. PS: Additionally, I think it would look better if you added a bit of vertical space below the title ('Disappearing messages') as well. Steps to reproduce (doesn't apply to e. g. English) Open conversation Select 'Disappearing messages' Scroll from 'Off' to some other timeframe Actual result: Window size changes when switching timeframe Expected result: Window size stays constant Device info Device: LG Nexus 5X Android version: 7.0.0 Signal version: 3.20.0

report.summary: Build fails due to invalid checksums in build.gradle
report.label: None yet
report.description: The Android Play Services and play-services-maps were upgraded from 8.1.0 to 9.4.0, but the checksums in build.gradle (line 107 and 108) were not changed, so the build fails. Removing the lines solved the issue, but the checksums have to be updated. The same holds for com.android.support:appcompat, com.android.support:recyclerview, com.android.support:cardview, com.android.support:design, com.google.android.gms:play-services-base, com.google.android.gms:play-services-basement and com.android.support:support-v4. I wonder how OWS builds the project. Are there things not checked in or do they disable the checksums completely? After that, the build fails with Signal-Android\build\intermediates\res\merged\debug\values-v23\values-v23.xml Error:(4) Error retrieving parent for item: No resource found that matches the given name 'android:TextAppearance.Material.Widget.Button.Inverse'. Error:(34) Error retrieving parent for item: No resource found that matches the given name 'android:Widget.Material.Button.Colored'. I'm still working on that one.

report.summary: Crash when viewing thread with media messages
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The app crashes immediately upon viewing a message thread that contains a media message (i.e. image). The thread can never be viewed, not even in airplane mode. It is also not possible to delete the thread: moving to archive works, but trying to delete from archive results in the same crash. Because I expected it to be a corrupt database issue I have completely removed the signal app data and re-registered my phone. The app worked again but was more unstable than I previously experienced. As soon as I received a media message the thread makes the app crash again like before. Two things I did before I ran into those problems: Updated Fairphone OS from FP2 release 1.6.1 to 1.8.1 Updated Android Web View from Play Store I have no idea if any of those events are really related to the crashes, though. Just to try I have also uninstalled the Web View updates but that did not lead to an improvement. Note: The updates to the Fairphone OS should only have contained the latest google security fixes up to October and no other feature changes. Steps to reproduce receive media message from contact try to open message from notifications or from contact list in app Actual result: App force closes immediately Expected result: Message thread should be displayed Screenshots none Device info Device: Fairphone2 Android version: 5.1 (r4275.1_FP2_gms66_1.8.1) Signal version: 3.20.4 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/845adc40ff80f0d3fdd506641bc41f2c

report.summary: Enhance Signal to allow transfer of arbitrary file types
report.label: None yet
report.description: One of the requests that came out of the work to improve photo quality (#672) was the ability to simply send photos exactly as they are, without reprocessing them. In the other thread, there are many good reasons why there isn't an option to handle photos that way, dealing with the previews, display, memory limitations, etc. It occurs to me that the way to allow this option to those that need it - and also provide more utility overall - is to provide an option to send arbitrary file types - including photos - without processing them. There are currently choices for Images, Audio, Video when sending a message. Just give us an option for "Files". Add an option to the attachment area for "File". If we pick a picture via the file option, instead of the image option, we just send the image exactly as is with no processing / preview / etc. The bonus is it now works for any file type.... and I can finally send full resolution images without having to revert to e-mail or something like that. Giving us the ability to push them through as files, however, bypasses a all of the issues related to device memory, preview, etc. Following the existing UI design / pattern gives the user customizability over what is downloaded (and when - only wifi, etc). It also now lets us send any other document securely, which would be a great bonus. Not sure what the upper limit needs to be on the file size... but even if it was as low as 10 MBs, we could send full resolution photos.

report.summary: Emoji implementation breaches copyright
report.label: None yet
report.description: Signal includes the Apple Color Emoji library to render emoji's on Android. The problem is that Apple developed it strictly for their own use and they are not licensing it to anybody. This puts the Android version of Signal in a legal grey area. This could be fixed by switching to an alternative emoji library. For something similar to Apple's library, Twitter's Twemoji could be considered.

report.summary: Can't register Signal from Faroe Islands
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Can't register Signal from Faroe Islands (+298) xxxxxx Steps to reproduce Start Signal choose country code (+298) and enter 6-digit phone number Actual result: Connectivity error - Signal was unable to connect to the server Expected result: The rest of the steps- i.e receive an sms for verificatition etc. At one point there was an bug in a library that Signal uses, so I wouldn't even get this far in the registration process. That got fixed. But I guess that the same or similar error is still running server-side. Because if I: Steps to reproduce Start Signal choose country code (+298) and enter 6-digit phone number+0000 Actual result: Connecting - check Wating for SMS verification - times out I get the option to make a voice verification or edit my number again Expected result: Well, since it's not really my number, I did expect the SMS to hang. Conclusion: I am guessing that this is a server-side issue with an old version of: api/util/PhoneNumberFormatter.java :-)

Sometimes when i respond to a signal message, it send's an sms (I'm not Holding the send button) wich don't get delivered because i don't have a simcard in my phone. It is sitting in airplane mode just with wifi turned on and connected to the interent via hotspot. When i delete this particular sms message and try to send another message to an registered Signal user it just shows the bouncing 3 dots. It never leaves the phone. It never tells that the message can't be delivered or something similar. I have to wait till an update is avalable or reinstall signal. EDIT: And i just noticed that the camera ain't working in the app too at the moment. I will terminate the signal process and capture another log. When i get my other Phone back i will try to reproduce this behaviour. The last time it happened, was when i got a msg from a user who just registered and typed my phone number in and hit send after the app showing him that i am a signal user. I got the msg, but couldn't reply to it with a data msg. Only SMS Steps to reproduce -I could not reproduce this one Actual result: Signal users dissapear. Can't send any Messages. Just make calls Expected result: Don't stuck in any thread where it tries to deliver the sms and send normal signal data Messages. Device info Device: Nexus 5 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.22.2 Link to debug log First Log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/95674be12129d233c47fcb359807f72a Second Log: I terminated signal and startet with logging in and trying to connect a device. The screen where the camera should show what i wan't to scan is just black. Then i typed a msg to a friend that is a signal member and hit sent. https://gist.github.com/anonymous/b516a5b6355be7141c19a8062738b3ec

report.summary: Incorrect Icon For FAB?
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The current FAB in the main conversations list shows a pencil icon which is indicative of composing a message while the button actually leads to a screen letting you pick a contact and initiate a new conversation. This button actually adds a new conversation to the screen and this is why other apps use the "add" button while email apps use the compose button as they mostly directly take you the message composing screen (Gmail and Outlook are examples). Actual result: The FAB icon is not consistent with its action. Expected result: The icon should be replaced with the "add" icon from Google's Material Design Icons like in other messaging apps (Google Messenger, Facebook Messenger, QKSMS, etc.) Screenshots 👍 1

report.summary: Push to talk is enabled in SMS Mode
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal lets you send voice notes, even if it is plaintext sms. Therefore GSM message. And therefore extremely expensive. Steps to reproduce Have Signal installed as your default messenger. Use it to send regular SMS. Open conctact who is not a Signal user. Press push to talk. Send voice note. Actual result: Voice note is send. Since it is transmitted via GSM it is converted to an MMS message. And MMS messages are extremely expensive. I pay 0.49€ for a single one. I know that in other countrys you pay a lot less, if at all. So I wanted to you to be aware of it. Expected result: I don't know really know to be honest. Just hide it in sms mode works for me. But at the same time is probably quite annoying for someone who does not have to pay for mms messages and would like to use that feature even in sms mode. Differentiate userbase for location and mms fees and hide/show push-to-talk button accordingly is probably a PITA. Sorry no easy solution here. But I can see people using the voice-notes. And paying a hefty bill afterwards. Which, although it is the users fault, could lead to bad Signal reputation. Screenshots Device info Device: should not matter Android version: should not matter Signal version: 3.23.0 Cheers, have a nice day Link to debug log 👍 1

report.summary: Automatically remove leading 0 in UK numbers stored in phone otherwise can receive not send Signal messages to numbers of +440xxxxxxxxxx (zero after the country code)
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Fresh installation: the registration procedure completes successfully. Basically nothing else works: the contact list is empty; I can receive secure messages (blue lock, "Via: Data (Signal)") yet Signal prompts me to invite the sender: "Take your conversation with Xxxxxx Yyyyy to the next level."; I cannot reply: I only see a big gray button "ENABLE SIGNAL FOR SMS"; SMS and MMS are off and I'd like to leave it that way, but if I enable it then I'm able to see the contacts (awkwardly duplicated, e.g., xxxxxxxxxx and xxx xxx xxxx); this situation lasts for months (since the first time I tried signal), I even performed an hard reset recently; the phone is not rooted. Note: due to an operator switch my current SIM cannot always provide the correct phone number (like in this case), so I need to manually fix that. It happens for other services as well, e.g., WhatsApp, without any problems. Anyway, as I said the registration procedure works. Device info Device: Nexus 5 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.23.0 (from Play store) Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/86ddc6e25f17dacb07b1415d0bd294f7

report.summary: Signal is censored in Cuba
report.label: None yet
report.description: As I see from 541718f Signal does implement some ways to circumvent censorship. This issue is mostly a report, I'm not sure if anything can actually be done. I've been in Cuba recently with Signal, registered with an European phone number (there are wifi hotspots in public locations); The Signal servers are not reachable from Cuba, I could not send/receive messages; It did work properly using Tor (Orbot). I see from the commit I referenced that Signal identifies censoring countries with their international phone prefix, so I'm not sure if it would have helped in my case. I did not try to register with a Cuban phone number. 👍 1

report.summary: [feature-request] Possibility to disable multiple clients
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, There was a case in Germany some months ago, where a suspects end-to-end messenger traffic has been decrypted by the German police. In this case it was the application telegram. But I started thinking about this issue, and maybe the same hack could be used with signal too. You might know that signal has a desktop application. The German police used a desktop Application like this to get access to the messages of the suspect. They just requested access to a desktop application, man-in-the-middle'd the incoming Activation-SMS, and had full access to the messages. [1] Is this possible with Signal, too? It would be nice to have an option to disable multiple clients [1] https://motherboard.vice.com/de/read/exklusiv-wie-das-bka-telegram-accounts-von-terrorverdaechtigen-knackt (GERMAN, sorry no english version available)

report.summary: [feature-request] Make domain fronting an option (for now)
report.label: None yet
report.description: Because domain fronting will not work when, for example, you go to Egypt as a tourist with a number from another country, it would be nice to be able to switch it on with an option. When automatic detection of blocking is implemented this option could then be removed again. Another question: why not enable domain fronting for everyone? In some countries Signal may not be blocked but contacting the Signal servers may give you a big "red flag" from intelligence agancies. Is there some technical or other reason why activating it for everyone would not be a good idea?

report.summary: "domain fronting" availability
report.label: None yet
report.description: The "domain fronting" technique to circumvent censorship can be enabled for all users regardless of what mobile number they had used to register or will use to register. Consider the case in which a user with a Canadian number already registered in Canada goes to UAE where Signal is blocked! He must use a VPN solution to access Signal servers. Signal can try main servers if it needs to establish a connection, if failed then try again using domain fronting and this can be enabled for all users by default OR can be added as an option in the welcome screen (first time registration) and in the advanced setting page.

report.summary: Image Keyboard Support
report.label: None yet
report.description: feature request: https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/text/image-keyboard.html Users often want to communicate with emojis, stickers, and other kinds of rich content. In previous versions of Android, soft keyboards (also known as input method editors or IMEs) could send only unicode emoji to apps. For rich content, apps had to either build app-specific APIs that couldn't be used in other apps or use workaround like sending images through Easy Share Action or the clipboard. With Android 7.1 (API level 25), the Android SDK includes the Commit Content API, which provides a universal way for IMEs to send images and other rich content directly to a text editor in an app. The API is also available in v13 Support Library as of revision 25.0.0. We recommend using the Support Library because it runs on devices as early as Android 3.2 (API Level 13), and it contains helper methods that simplify implementation. With this API, you can build messaging apps that accept rich content from any keyboard, as well as, keyboards that can send rich content to any app. The Google Keyboard and apps like Google Messenger support the Commit Content API in Android 7.1

report.summary: Signal rejected because of Android Auto "voice commands"
report.label: None yet
report.description:
Hi Developers at Open Whisper Systems,
Thanks for submitting your app for Android Auto. We reviewed your app, Signal Private Messenger, with package name org.thoughtcrime.securesms, and noticed some eligibility issues.
App status: Your app has not been accepted into Android Auto, and the update is not live on Google Play.
Eligibility issues by APK version: APK Version(s) Eligibility Issue 230 Your app does not support all of the required voice commands. You can read more about how to support Voice Actions here: https://developer.android.com/training/auto/audio/index.html#support_voice To be considered for Android Auto:
Make the necessary changes to your app. Increment the version number of the upgraded APK. Submit your app for another review. Or, if you’d like to exclude your app from Android Auto:
Remove the Android Auto manifest entry from your APK code. Sign in to your Developer Console and upload the new APK. Click Submit update. I don't really know what voice commands they're referring to, and I don't have any way to test. It's blocking the release, so I'm going to remove android auto from the manifest entry for now. @snaggen are you willing to look into this?

report.summary: DOS'ing self when turning phone on again after much texting with desktop app
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description App floods phone with nonstop notifications after desktop texting Steps to reproduce Turn off your phone Open the Signal Private Messenger app Do a bunch of texting with the desktop app. Make sure to view all messages sent back at you. Turn on the phone Actual result: Watch your phone flood with notifications - buzzing, etc. It will last for many minutes. In my case, almost 5 full minutes. My phone died, I needed to do a bunch of texting via the webapp, and when I turned the app on again - I basically DOS'ed my own phone. It was going through messages slowly and individually, since it gets the message first, sends the notification, and only then marks its read/unread state. Expected result: From a user experience/product perspective, if I was opening the app after the phone was shutdown (or reception was reentered or whatever), I wouldn't want to see the buzzing, and have to wait. I'd simply see a single notification (or perhaps, no notification at all), and be able to use my phone immediately. tl;dr I shouldn't get a notification at all for a message if it was read on either platform. Screenshots (Not a single event, so no screenshot) Device info Device: Moto X Pure Signal version: 3.27.1 Link to debug log ( Can post this if necessary, but a little uncomfortable with posting the raw debug log atm )

report.summary: Personally-identifiable information (PII) is being included in logcat logs
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description On inspecting my own device using adb logcat, I noticed that Signal is writing sensitive personally-identifiable information to logcat. 02-03 16:21:15.603 14609-16502/? W/Directory: Adding active token: +10005550000, REDACTED/+6A Where +1000555000 is the phone number of one of my contacts. There is one line per contact. Steps to reproduce Install Signal Sign in Connect Android device to desktop computer running the Android SDK Use adb shell to inspect logs. Impact If a device is rooted, any app running on the device can have access to read sensitive PII. If the user chooses to submit a bug report for any other unrelated app, even on a factory device, sensitive PII will be leaked. This PII may be uploaded to a phone manufacturer’s servers for crash report analysis, compromising the security of that user’s Signal contact list. How to mitigate The offending Log.i should be removed entirely. If that is not desirable, then some attempt must be made to write only a redacted or hashed version of the contacts' phone numbers.

report.summary: Onboarding Screen should tell user how to add/recover existing account
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When a user reinstalls Signal onto their phone after formatting it, going through the onboarding process creates a new account, instead of restoring the old one. Steps to reproduce install Signal on phone and setup account Link a second device (opt.) Format device (or just delete Signal files) Re-install Signal, and go through the onboarding screen Actual result: A new account is created, which causes all contacts to get a warning about the magic number having changed. If the user does not realise this has happened and continues to use the linked device as well, repeated warnings may result. Expected result: Either the original account should be restored, or the user warned that the old account will be lost. This can also be reproduced by moving the SIM card from a old phone to a new one. Device info Device: Motorola X Force (XT1580) Android version: 6.0 Signal version: 3.28.4

report.summary: Short authentication string (SAS) word pairs not visible on WebRTC calls
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates [ x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description There are no SAS word pairs visible when placing a call with WebRTC. This is not intended to be a critique of the crypto design or implementation of ZRTP but rather to reflect that two call recipients without knowledge of cryptography expressed concern that not having the SAS could result in possible interception of the calls. The reaction was not related to the technical details of the Signal protocol but rather a sudden, unexplained change in a ritual that accompanied previous usage of the service. At least one call recipient was using the latest iOS beta. I apologize if this is considered more to be a comment than a bug. Steps to reproduce Place WebRTC call Look for previously existing SAS codes Actual result: SAS codes are not visible and there is no explanation for why they are no longer there. Expected result: Either to see the SAS codes or, in the case that they have been purposefully removed, perhaps some other (transitional) visual indication of call security (particularly vis-a-vis tapping or middle attack interception in lieu of the old SAS word pairs. Screenshots Device info Device: Huawei Nexus 6P Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.29.2 Link to debug log

report.summary: Can't send/recieve messages on WiFi
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Messages (also pictures, GIFs, voice notes, etc) is sent to participant are shown as pending to download (white rounded icon), but never downloading till change from WLAN to Cellular network. On other device media is marked as send and received (if in Cellular). Or pending to send if on wifi Works in both ways (from device A to B and from B to A). Both devices using Android 6.0.1. It seems I should blame my WLAN. But nothing is blocked there. Could it be that Provider did blocked something? It also strange that placeholders are created (information is partly received), but not messages. Steps to reproduce Device A is in the home WLAN. Picture/GIF/Voice Note was sent from B to A. B see Medial marked as send. A see only message placeholder and spinning circle forever in WLAN. A disable WLAN and immediately in Cellular Network got all media files downloaded. Works in a both ways. Actual result: Only message placeholder and spinning circle are shown forever in WLAN. Expected result: Media downloaded, messages recieved. Screenshots Device info A Device: Huawei Nova Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.28.4 B Device: Samsung S III i9305 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.28.4 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/9360580da4b3d6be89753271757f572d

report.summary: Wrong string in the "Update group" screen, bad wording in general
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When in the "Update group" screen, the button to tap to finish the update says "CREATE GROUP", while it should say something like "UPDATE" or simply "DONE". In general I don't like the "Update group" wording, it's confusing and doesn't pass the idea of an active action (modifying the group). "Modify group" or "Manage group" would be better. Moreover, after updating the group the string "Updated the group." is shown to the modifying user in the conversation. I think it should be "You updated the group.", for clarity and grammar. Steps to reproduce Create a group, enter its conversation and then open the "Update group" menu item. The "CREATE GROUP" thing is probably shown only on bigger displays. Try to reproduce with a Nexus 6 in an emulator. Device info Device: Nexus 6 Android version: 7.1 Signal version: latest beta 👍 2

report.summary: Signal reverts back to unsecured messages
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When an SMS message is received from a user that DOES have Signal (but doesn't want to use it at the moment, Signal reponds via SIGNAL vs SMS. It should respond in kind. Also, if you try to write an unsecured message to a user who has signal (but wants sms), and you leave the app and come back, or compose and mms and then cancel, signal reverts back to SIGNAL secured messaging. Steps to reproduce Receive SMS from SIGNAL user respond to message (SIGNAL will default to encrypted) open new chat with SIGNAL user switch to UNSECURED leave app return to signal, you will be back in secured mode Actual result: SIGNAL defaults to SIGNAL Expected result: SIGNAL should respond in kind when replying, should remember preferences Screenshots Device info Device: Pixel XL Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.28.4 Link to debug log

report.summary: images being compressed beyoned being usable
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Image compression is so high that images become unusable. Steps to reproduce send an image, taken with the standard camera from one device to another, no other steps involved Actual result: Image is compressed from 3264x2448px, 1.5MB to 408x306 px, 36.4KB. Image is not even close to being usable (in this case it is a foto of an time schedule). There is no option available to send the image in a way where it can be used on the recipient side. Seems to be related to #672 (didn't read though it as it is closed and I would expect that to mean resolved) Expected result: Images are received only with mild compression, not affecting the image visibly. Suggestion: Lower the compression rate and allow for the option to send uncompressed images (either via the image send dialogue or introduce an option to send all file types. Last would be fulfilled by #993, which is unfortunately locked for comment. Also I don't like to idea of my data being modified without the possibility to change this. Note: I did not add any further information as I expect this to be device independent. Further information can be provided if needed.

report.summary: Add an f-droid repo signed by WhisperSystems
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports f-droid repo signed by WhisperSystems Please add an f-droid repo, so people without Google Play Store could have Signal updated on a regular basis. I totally understand and partly agree with @moxie0 's critcism of f-droid security. However, one can address those issues by creating his own f-droid repo and sign it with his own key. Projects that did so include Guardian Project. Information on how this can be done can be found here Why this is important Recently, a very important change has been made - it is now possible to use Signal without Gapps, and that also means that many new Signal users have to download the Signal apk off third party services, like apkpure, which is insecure and makes it impossible to update in a timely manner, which contradicts fundamental believes shared by WhisperSystems team in general and @moxie0 in particular. 👍 20

report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description While I was writing a message, several messages came in (media and also text). Suddenly Signal froze, shortly after the phone froze and rebootet. Now I cannot start Signal anymore. It crashes instantly at the start. Steps to reproduce No idea how to simulate my phones/Signals state Start Signal -> Crash Actual result: Signal crashes instantly and does not load Expected result: Signal should work as expected (in this case it should be able to handle the error, whatever error it is actually) Device info Android version: LineageOS 14.1 Signal version: 30.3.4 ###Additional information: Maybe this is of relevance: I see a lot of websocketconnection in the crash log but actually I am using play services... report.summary: Can't send photo/gif
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Attempt to send photo or video is unsuccessful, photos are not delivered, which leads to signal messages also not being delivered. To be able to send signal messages again, I must delete the photo I'm trying to send, delete the signal messages that were also not sent and only then I can send signal messages again, but still no photos/gifs. I've been experiencing this problem since today only (no app update today) Steps to reproduce attach photo/gif, press send after some time signal stops trying to send and says "message not delivered" delete photo/gif delete signal messages that were attempted to be sent afterwards now able to send signal messages but still not able to send photos/gifs Actual result: Cannot send photos and gifs Expected result: Able to send cute cat pictures to friends and family Device info Device: Blackberry Priv Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.30.4 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/c4cddcf79d721c92ab2cfdc8dddf2b32

report.label: None yet
report.description: I think if we had different and subtle sounds upon receive and sending of messages while you're in the conversation, it'd make the app feel much more polished.

report.summary: Feature Request: Let users choose between GCM PUSH and the new WEBSOCKET based notifying service
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Feature description Most of signal messages I send to my buddies only get delivered( or calls tried notified) when their signal app is opened. This was the case with me until I moved to AOSP and with the new solution for non play services users, now the messages come in very swiftly even when the app is not in foreground. All my buddies are on stock rom and I understand there may be issues with play services configuration etc.. But not everyone are geeks and everyone cannot move to AOSP for different reasons and not everyone can or wants to contact support with debug log when there are good alternatives for instant messaging already installed on their phones. So if the affected users have ability to choose between type of notifying services (GCM PUSH or the WEBSOCKET one), it would simply overcome the issues of no/sluggish notifications and message delivery. 👍 5

report.summary: Other party suddenly becomes silent during a call
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description It has happened a few times now that while I'm having a call I suddenly stop hearing the other party's voice after a while (~several minutes) but they can still hear my voice. So far this has happened only when I'm having a call with Signal iOS. But I haven't had long calls with another Signal Android so nothing to say about that. Steps to reproduce Call Signal iOS device Talk for some time Actual result: Suddenly I stop hearing the other party's voice but they can still hear my voice. Expected result: Both parties can hear each other for the duration of the whole call Device info Android Device: Moto G4 Play Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.30.4 iOS Device: iPhone 4S iOS version: 9.3.5 Signal version: 2.7.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/3d87be38fce2a11107b10164322a96bc https://gist.github.com/anonymous/c0102e788ffd853143dbd1ec78a213f1 I guess the relevant parts are before I disconnect the call after I notice that I can't hear the other party anymore Unfortunately, I don't have logs from iOS Related issues In #4532, #6140, #6271 the other party can't hear anything but it seems that the silence is there from the beginning of the call, not after talking successfully for several minutes.

report.summary: Delete function inserts characters from earlier in the message
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When I have entered text into a text message field and then want to delete a typo I press the delete key. At this point signal inserts a previous word from my message, appends it to the location below my cursor and deletes from it. This causes it to take about twice as long to delete any word, as it inserts a word on first delete press. Steps to reproduce Type a message hit delete notice that there are extra characters inserted that were not there before delete was pressed. Actual result: A word from previously in the message is now before the cursor. (but with a letter deleted as a result of pressing delete) (the word is also still in its proper place in the message) Expected result: The character before the cursor should be deleted. Screenshots Device info Device: Nexus 5 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.30.4 Link to debug log

report.summary: Trying to place calls between phones with Signal 3.31.0 -> no ringing
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Both devices have Signal 3.31.0. Both devices re-registered, synced contacts, rebooted, after 3.31.0 update. If I try to place a call from the Blackberry, all seems ok, I have the "DIALING" screen and sound, but the other end (device Alcatel) doesnt ring. After 20/30 seconds I abort the call on the Blackberry with the red "hangup" button; the other end (Alcatel) gives instantly a missed call notification. Exactly the same happens when calling the Blackberry from the Alcatel. Steps to reproduce Call Alcatel from Blackberry, and viceversa. Actual result: Call the other device, the other device doesnt ring. Expected result: Call the other device, the other device rings. Device 1 info Device: Blackberry Classic Android version: 4.3 Signal version: 3.31.0 Device 2 info Device: Alcatel Pixi4 5010D Android version: 6.0 Signal version: 3.31.0 Link to debug log Blackberry calling Alcatel: http://gist.github.com/05c8bf579c2e551b9cc9619e948f23cf Alcatel calling Blackberry doesnt give useful info, IMO, in the debug log: http://gist.github.com/992da1527c45c58d5d0cd25ef4b3f62c

report.summary: Chrome Desktop app window will not open consistently for windows 10
report.label: None yet
report.description: Debug logs: https://gist.github.com/a2c764a64dcd5c6b0b7cb297554d4c46 Chrome Version 56.0.2924.87 (64-bit) I use multiple user profiles simultaneously to keep work and personal content separate. : installed extensions: Cisco WebEx Extension 1.0.8 Google Docs 0.9 Google Docs Offline 1.4 Google Sheets 1.1 Google Slides 0.9 LastPass: Free Password Manager 4.1.41 Signal Private Messenger 0.32.1 Tampermonkey 4.2.7 OS version: Windows 10 Enterprise Version 1607, OS build 14393.693 Behavior: After upgrading from a windows 7 machine to windows 10, Signal has become unreliable. I see the message popup indicating I've gotten a new message, and about 80% of the time when I click the popup, my chrome instance is highlighted, but the signal instance does not appear. I've enabled, disabled, removed, re-added, re re re,moved , re re added etc a number of times with no change in behavior. Once I have the window open and working, it will continue to work as long as I do not close the window. once I close the window, it's anyone's guess whether it will come back again. Sometimes I have the signal icon showing in the control panel open programs list, where I have attempted to bookmark the signal icon so it is easily accessible: If I hover over the icon and I can see the program preview, signal will work as expected. If the icon will not show up, or hovering does not show the program preview, there is literally nothing I can do to convince the window for signal to show itself. It is obviously running, because I still get the message alerts- but the actual message window can not be accessed. I attempted to go to the extension, and use the "create shortcut" option from the extension window. This will very occasionally work, but it's rare. the shortcut mainly gives me a "working" icon, and then does nothing. I can also go to the "view in store" and select "launch app" from the chrome store. Again, occasionally this will work, but almost never. mostly it just does nothing. I have been paying attention, but I can not find any consistency for when it will work vs when it will not work. It does not seem more likely to work after a reboot or before, And I believe it has randomly started to work in the middle of a browser session (though I'm not 100% sure). The only thing that Has changed about my configuration is the OS version, so I'm sure there is something environmental causing this- but I have not been able to narrow down what triggers the behavior. One more interesting thing I just discovered: It's more likely to work if I use one chorme profile than another. when it fails to work, it always highlights the shortcut to the chrome profile that works less often. The extension shows as installed on both. Perhaps this is a strange side effect of windows 10 + profiles in chrome?

report.summary: Signal messages/calls "enabled" after unregistering
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description This issue has been introduced with the webrtc calling functionality. (tested with 3.30.x enabled beta calling and 3.31.x) When you open a conversation with a signal contact after unregistering, it looks as if you are still able to send signal messages and make secure calls. It is even possible to initiate a secure call that never successfully connects, but the other device will receive a "missed call" notification. (gray send button, phone icon without lock etc.) Screenshots Device info Device: Nexus 5 Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.31.1 Link to debug log 👍 1
