report.summary: Issue with recents screenshot
report.label: None yet
report.description: Bug description When using the power button of the device the FLAG_SECURE is ineffective and the screenshot appears with the information. This is actually a bug on Android platform and have been fixed only in versions above 7.x. My goal with this issue is to understand if there may be implemented a workaround for earlier versions of android like change to a blank fragment during the onPause() or onStop() event. In the API there is supposedly a function that would allow to generate a custom thumbnail but it's never triggered. I opened a ticket in Google regarding this but so far nobody assigned the ticket (https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=235166) Steps to reproduce Navigate to a particular screen with information Press the power button of the device to lock the screen. Go to the recents list and confirm that the information is shown on the screenshot Screenshots Device info Device: Nexus 5x Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.30.4

report.summary: Allow auto fallback from Signal message to SMS/MMS
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Family uses Signal to communicate but Teenager has limited cellular data (e.g. used up monthly quota on YouTube). Other family members cannot send messages to Teenager in a timely fashion without knowing in advance whether Teenager currently has cellular data available. Steps to reproduce Attempt to send Signal message to Teenager Message is sent fine (one tick) Hours later, notice that Teenager has not replied, and message still has only one tick Manually send message via long-press SMS Actual result: Teenager doesn't actually receive the message until it has been manually been sent via SMS Expected result: An app setting should allow automatic fallback to SMS/MMS if the message has not been delivered to the recipient after N minutes. (Signal would ideally need a way to identify when two copies are received, one via SMS/MMS and one via Signal when cellular or Wifi permits the original message to arrive) For many people, the encrypted nature of Signal messages is less important than a single, reliable messaging app, and these people are nonetheless important for growing the Signal user base. (BTW, I found some old bugs about fallback if the senders internet is intermittent, but not the receivers)

report.summary: Signup Failure - prompt to update while Play Services are actually disabled
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I was eager to try out the new non gcm functionality, got an android phone and promptly disabled the Google Play Apps (precise lising below). Trying to sign up for Signal resulted in a failure, as the App requires me for some reason to update the Play Services before continuing. This locks me out. [I dont think this is wanted behavior. Looking into src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/RegistrationActivity.java, it looks like ConnectionResult.SERVICE_DISABLED is supposed to be treated as MISSING but that doesn't seem to work.] Steps to reproduce Disable all 3 Google Play "Core Apps" (listed below) Open a freshly installed Signal Type in Country and Phone Number and press Register Actual result: A pop up appears: Update Google Play Services Signal won't run unless you update Google Play Services. This is impossible as they are intentionally disabled and unwanted as we want to use Websocket push. Expected result: The registration happens and Signal sets up so that gcmdisabled true is set. Signal can be used. (Treat this as if the Google Play service components were just MISSING) Device info Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.31.4 Stock Rom. Newly of the shelf bought phone. disabled apps: com.google.android.gms com.android.vending com.google.android.gsf Debug log not available as signup is impossible. A fix would be greatly appreaciated, as it would allow to quickly setup an android burner phone for Signal without much technical sophistication. 👍 5

report.summary: Technical document/details missing for creating own server

report.summary: "Permanent Signal communication failure!" since updated to 3.29.6
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Since updating to Signal 3.29.6 I get, several times a day, a failure notification saying: "Permanent Signal communication failure! Signal was unable to register with Google Play Services. Signal messages and calls..." Also I no longer receive messages unless i open Signal. I dont have Google apps on my phone but before updating (which i was forced to do) signal was working fine with MicroG core. Since then I have updated microG core, but this has not fixed the issue. I guess I am going to be told to report this issue to microG devs rather than here, but since it's a signal update what resulted in this issue, I would like to know if we are gonna see Signal go further into the road of being incompatible with phones not monitored by google. We are forced to update Signal too often. (not too often would be once every 1 or 2 years). if every update is going to bring problems, I will move on Steps to reproduce normal Signal usage. The failure notifications usually come when network state changes and when opening Signal Actual result: Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) Expected result: receiving notifications of messages without having to open the app. not receiving notifications of communication failure with Google. Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy S4 Android version: 4.4.2 Signal version: 3.29.6 Link to debug log

report.summary: Allow users to specify their own display name
report.label: None yet
report.description: When joining a large group, where most of the users are not in any user's contacts list, it's very annoying to see messages coming from phone numbers. They are difficult to recognize, remember, and associate with a name. There should be a way for users to specify a name to be shown when in a conversation with an user that doesn't have the number in his/her contacts list. When the number is in the contact list, the contact list name has to be displayed. This has to be optional.

report.summary: Change New Signal Contact Behavior - "XXX is on Signal, say hey!"
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When a new user installs Signal, Signal notifies all of their contacts who have Signal that Signal has been installed. This is an invitation to communication which may be unwanted or long outdated. Steps to reproduce Install Signal Get messages from ex-lovers or business associates you have no interest in communicating with Actual result: Signal, without advising me, tells everyone with my phone number stored in their phone that I have installed Signal. Expected result: When I install Signal, it should be my choice if Signal tells everyone who has my phone number, intentionally or not, that I've done so. Screenshots Notification from an OKCupid date 8 years ago. Two suggestions: Allow the new user to choose if these notifications are generated. Only notify a contact that Signal is available when composing a new message to a contact with Signal installed. 👍 1 👎 1

Steps to reproduce make a call with headphone inserted make a video call Actual result: The headphone and microphone plugged into the headphone jack are unresponsive Expected result: The audio should continue to pass through the external mike and headphones which are plugged in rather switch to the internal speaker and mike when video starts. report.summary: Disable touch functionality while listening to a voice note through earpiece
report.label: None yet
report.description: Thanks for improving the voice note feature. When raising the phone to the ear, voice notes are now played through the earpiece. Maybe it would be good now to also disable the touch functionality of the screen while one is listening to the voice note. Right now it can happen, that the ear is pressing buttons. Steps to reproduce: start playback of voice note raise phone to ear listen to the voice note through the earpiece expected result: during the playback through the earpiece touch functionality of screen is disabled actual result: ear is accidentally pressing buttons on the touch screen 👍 2

report.summary: Feature Request: Move to SQLCipher so destination information is also encrypted
report.label: None yet
report.description: Improve local storage encryption. Now only the content of the messages is encrypted. If forensics can bypass androids FDE, they can collect metadata. Please don't assume that androids FDE is safer than local encryption implemented right. Android FDE is light years away from ios and even ios is not bulletproof. please read on the discoussion forum: https://whispersystems.discoursehosting.net/t/passphrase-encryption-only-for-message-contents/917 Moxie commented he would want to phase it out in favor of android fde. Wich would be a mistake.

report.summary: Feature Request: User generated entropy for private key generation
report.label: None yet
report.description: Let the user put some extra entropy like threema does for the long-term private key.

report.summary: Signal update 4.1.0 wiped out lost erased entire message history without plain text backup or like
report.label: None yet
report.description: Bug description I opened Signal after an automatic update to 4.1.0. It asked me to re-initialize my phone number as if it were a new install. Once it opened, my message history was completely gone. I re-imported from the sms database, and it only imported everything from before I installed Signal, nearly 6 months ago. I attempted to import from a text backup to see if the update had made one, but it was not found. It appears the message history is lost. Steps to reproduce Allow Signal to auto update via the play store. Open Signal It will ask you to re-initialize your phone number. Upon successful initialization, find all of your messages lost. Actual result: All of my Signal message history was gone. I was able to re-import SMS messages from before installing Signal the first time, over 6 months ago. Expected result: I would still have my SMS message history. Device info Device: Google Nexus 5 Android version: 0.0.0 Signal version: 6.0.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/d153a015ef8574c0cf7bf3092d40c964

report.summary: Feature Request: Multi-Device support
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Related closed issue: #5102 which I feel the point of which was missed for the user's misunderstanding of the implementation. Bug description I cannot have two android devices or two mobile phones logged in to the same identity at the same time. Steps to reproduce Open up the app Attempt to identify yourself without a SIM present. Actual result: No options to use this app Expected result: Identify via ((mms)), ((email)) ((SIP/VOIP Provider)) ((Google Voice)) ((OAuth Provider)) ((scan QR code from existing device)). You should also be able to link identities accross different ID providers (multiple phone numbers + email address, for example) once signed in by using a device scan. Device info Device: ZTE Axon Mini 7 / Affects all Android + iOS Android version: 6.0.1 / Affects all supported versions Signal version: 4.0.0

report.summary: Missing aggressive app restart capability in background.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Clearing recent apps in my phone kills those apps in recent list. Well it is a bug but some apps like WhatsApp are being restarted aggressively and working while Signal doesn't start and stays inactive. Aggressive restart behavior of WhatsApp is only observed when phone is connected to Internet. Steps to reproduce Open Signal, Whatsapp and settings> app management > running apps. Check in running apps both signal and whatsapp are running. Minimize all and goto recent app list. Clear signal and whatsapp from recent. At this point whatsapp and signal services are killed. Quickly switch to settings >app management> running apps Actual result: WhatsApp service shows restarting, Signal is inactive(not listed in running until we open signal app explicitly). Expected result: Signal app service also restarts aggressively in background. Screenshots Device info Device: Lenovo vibe k5 (A6020A40) Android version: 5.1.1 stock Signal version: 4.1.0 👍 1

report.summary: Signal incompatibility with NetGuard
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal is unable to send or receive messages over an LTE / 3G connection if NetGuard is active simultaneously on the device. This behaviour persists even if Signal is given full access to both WiFi and cellular connections in NetGuard. This behaviour is unique to cellular data connections. Signal works properly on WiFi while NetGuard is active. It is not yet clear whether the problem is in Signal or in NetGuard. If it turns out to be the latter, then a help / faq page saying "NetGuard breaks Signal, there's just no way to make it work, here are alternatives / workarounds" would be a good idea. Running without NetGuard or a similarly capable alternative is not a workaround, as that would permit other apps to quickly gobble up mobile data (which, in this case, is expensive and in extremely limited supply). Steps to reproduce Debug log attached, generated as follows: While an active WiFi connection is present, close and then start Signal. Verify that NetGuard is set normally (firewall is on, Signal has full access for both WiFi and cellular modes). Move outside the range of the WiFi connection. Device automatically switches to LTE connection. Attempt to send a plain text message in Signal. Actual result: Get a "failed to send message" error. Expected result: Message is sent, shows 1 checkbox (sent), shortly thereafter shows 2 checkboxes (received). Turn off NetGuard entirely. Try sending the message again in signal. Actual result: Message is sent correctly. Expected result: No change. Re-enable NetGuard and move back into WiFi range. Actual result: Signal works normally. Device info Device: LGE Nexus 5 (hammerhead) Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 4.1.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d9a7d59b0737474aec9191101ee182a5

report.summary: Missing possibility to manually insert the SMS registration code
report.label: None yet
report.description: There are situations where the device where Signal is installed can't directly receive SMS messages, but the users can receive the message on another device/service. Some devices do not have a sim card slot but the users owns another phone that can receive messages. Other users want to register with a phone number bought from a service like Twilio. In these cases it is difficult to register with the current procedure. I propose this kind of solution: After the 2 minutes SMS timeout, a screen is shown to the user, asking to manually enter the code receives via SMS. The screen also have a clear button that says "I didn't receive any sms", or something like that. If the user taps on "I didn't receive the SMS", the current voice verification screen is shown. The vast majority of the users will never see this screen. I think there are more users which can receive messages on a different device than users that try to register, expect to receive the message, but then something does not work. 👍 2

report.summary: "Don't submit WIP PRs" is a bad contributor experience
report.label: None yet
report.description: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submit-only-complete-prs-and-test-them states that folks shouldn't submit work-in-progress PRs. That seems like a very bad idea to me. WIP PRs are very useful for answering questions like: Am I heading down the right direction with respect to this code's design? I implemented part of this change, if I finish the rest would it be accepted? I'm stuck with such-and-such an error, how can I solve it? I've made a change on this line but I'm not 100% sure it's correct, can someone confirm? All of these questions have to go somewhere. It might as well be somewhere where it's easiest to answer - in a Pull Request where you have the full diff available to contextualize all discussion. Does this requirement exist because people would submit incomplete PRs that made tests fail, etc.? In that case, I propose the text be amended to say something like "if submitting a Pull Request that's not ready for merging, prefix its title with [WIP]." 👍 6

report.summary: Signal goes into crash loop after messaging contact, receiving message from contact with data connection
report.label: None yet
report.description: Signal version 4.3.2 Android 7.1.2 Pixel XL, not rooted Google Play Service 10.2.98 I had a prior conversation with a contact today. About 20 minutes ago I tried messaging that same contact after leaving my office, Single immediately went into a crash loop and threw the screen allowing me to report feedback (I've reported it a few times with some descriptive text). The crash still happened after I deleted the cache to Signal. I set the device to airplane mode and reopened Signal. I was able to open the app without a crash. Opening up the conversation with said friend I could see the message I had sent was still in a pending state (3 dots animating). I long held on the message, deleted it, killed the app (app switcher swipe), turned off airplane mode, reopened the app. No crash. Again I attempted to message my friend, again hit a boot crash. Repeated my airplane mode steps, then went back to Signal while online and tried to send a message to a different contact. That worked fine, no crash, double check marks. I left it alone. After about 30 minutes said contact tried messaging me again and the app in the background threw the Android crash submit feedback popup box. The airplane mode trick no longer works, nor does clearing cache. Also my session through the Chrome extension is running fine. I can see the last message I received from the friend was "Yeah, k" before any further messages from me or him would cause the app to give up on life. At this time I was able to logcat the crash in the state that it is in now and attaching thta at the end of this bug report. I am assuming my only option at this point is to clear app data to get out of this bad state. bitmoji

report.summary: Play services issue
report.label: None yet
report.description: First of all, I've never come across another app that won't allow the user to bypass the "update play services" popup by clicking outside the popup, and then work as normal, if indeed the app doesn't REQUIRE play services (but still attempts to use it for something). Signal registration fails completely if play services isn't the latest possible version, even if the user has it disabled. You should allow the user to click outside that popup and proceed without updating/using play services if in fact Signal works without it. That's what most apps do if they don't require play services. Second, your comment about Signal being designed to work if play services isn't installed on the device at all is completely facetious. ALL android devices have this installed. The only way to get it completely deleted is to root the device, which thanks to google, can only be done by using third-party apps like Kingroot which is made by unknown people in China and introduces a huge security risk. Therefore, it's only feasible to DISABLE play services, google services framework, the play store, and google account manager. Third, you ask what is the benefit of making play services disabled "if it is some kind of malware." Well, (1) play services constantly phones home to a google domain at 1e100.net. It has complete permissions to your device and, knowing how google is, most likely uploads the user's contacts and files, and may even record audio and video without the user knowing. The mere fact that it has permission to do all of that is a security risk in itself (and opens a backdoor for the government to collude with google to develop spy tools for Android phones). (2) Play services is constantly updating, which I have found can cause major incompatibility issues and brick phones, since google doesn't test the update on every phone in use in the marketplace. Google forces the updates on users, which is unethical and unnecessary if the old version is working. So, hopefully you can see why play services is a major problem. Basically, google treats peoples' phones as if it belonged to google, controlling what can run on the device, forcing updates, accessing god knows what, and constantly phoning home, as any user with a firewall app can see. They act as if they are only "licensing" the phone to the user, rather than the user actually owning the phone and controlling it. Honestly, I would think any developer working on a privacy/security product like Signal would have grasped this already. With regards to publishing annoucements, see: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=13691050 https://www.reddit.com/r/Android/comments/5v9evr/signal_can_now_be_used_without_google_play/ http://forums.crackberry.com/blackberry-10-apps-f274/official-signal-app-without-play-services-available-1100790/ https://www.wilderssecurity.com/threads/signal-can-now-be-used-without-google-play-services.392235/ https://opensignal.com/android_app/non-market-download.php

report.summary: Disclose when installing that metadata is visible
report.label: None yet
report.description: Pardon me if this had been already discussed, but I only found one relevant issue, #838. Since TS only supports phone numbers as an identity mechanism, it means the telcos (and hence governments) have all the metadata they need to identify users. Thy don't even care about the communication contents - see Why Metadata Matters | Electronic Frontier Foundation and Using Metadata to find Paul Revere. Thus TextSecure offers a false sense of security. I'd love to be proven wrong if perhaps I misunderstood the underlying handshake and transport mechanisms (SMS, GCM).

report.summary: FOSS gradle build flavor
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Since March 13, you can now download Signal as an .apk from the official website. This is partial done for people who have no Google Play installed on their devices. A part of this group does not have Google Play installed because they don't want to have proprietary software on their device. Fortunately, you can use Signal without Google's Firebase Cloud Messaging but unfortunately, the proprietary libraries are still included in Signal's build. Some of these are: compile 'com.google.android.gms:play-services-gcm:9.6.1' compile 'com.google.android.gms:play-services-maps:9.6.1' compile 'com.google.android.gms:play-services-places:9.6.1' In my eyes it makes sense to add a fully free and open source gradle build flavor to Signal which builds get published on the website instead of the default Google Play release. If this is done, F-Droid can reproduce and distribute the official binaries of Signal by OpenWhisperSystems. Reference thread in F-Droid's forum: https://forum.f-droid.org/t/signal-discussion-about-google-play-alternative/95 👍 6

report.summary: Setting disappearing messages in a group also removes entire group after messages expire
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: [ x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates [ x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description [Caveat] Please note, I'm not entirely sure this is a bug, as I could see the utility of this behavior, depending on the use-case. When I'm in a group conversation with (in this case) two other users, and I've set the disappearing messages timer to 1 day, if that amount of time passes and no one has sent any messages to the group, not only will the messages disappear (as expected), but the entire group will disappear, no longer showing in the contacts list. Steps to reproduce Create a messaging group with two other Signal users Set disappearing messages timer to 1 day Exchange messages as expected Note that your group appears in your contacts list Allow all messages to expire, with no messages being sent or received by the group for the duration of the disappearing messages timer Note that the created group has disappeared Actual result: Note that the created group has disappeared Expected result: Noting my caveat above, the expected result would normally be that the created group does not disappear without the user manually deleting it. Work-arounds The following work-arounds were found to negate this behavior (assuming you don't want to disable the disappearing messages functionality): When first creating the group, prior to setting the disappearing messages timer, send one message to the group, serving to anchor the group in your contacts list. Once that message has been sent, set the disappearing messages timer, which will automatically delete subsequent messages (excluding the anchor). It is unknown if this will serve to anchor the group with recipients, especially if they manually delete the anchor. Assuming you're using the desktop client, where the group will not disappear once the timer has expired (but messages will), send a message to the group. This will serve to recreate the group on the mobile app. The group will disappear on the mobile app should the timer expire again. App State Signal messages and calls registered SMS/MMS Enabled Notifications on Passphrase on, Screen security on Theme Dark, Language Default Message trimming off 3rd party app info unknown, other than being Signal registered Device info Device: Huawei Nexus 6P Android version: 7.1.2, build N2G47H Signal version: 4.4.0 beta Link to debug log Bug(?) was not noticed in a timely fashion, so no debug log was generated.

report.summary: Signal sounds and codecs
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: [X ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates [ X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Actually this is not a bug, just proposal for UX improvement. Current sounds (sonar sound and ping when call is established/terminated) are by my opinion too aggressive. They contain too much high tones. My proposal is, to use more soft sounds. My proposal is also to replace sonar sound with something more similar to ringing... for instance instead of sonar there should be "slow" ringing and when ringing starts, there should be regular ringing (as it is now). Another proposal is also to measure bandwidth and quality of call. When quality of call starts to get to low, user should get a very soft beep-beep-beep sound, so he/she is alerted there are problems with bandwidth. This should also be visible on the screen. If connection drops (because of bad connection), it should be re-establisher automatically - user should be alerted of this re-establishing by sound and by screen text. Anyway, I am also noticing some problems with bandwidth consumption. Are there any plans that when bad network conditions occur, codec automatically "switches" to lower quality? I am not talking about VBR codecs, just that maybe there should be two codecs used - one for normal bandwidth and another when bandwidth is lower. 👍 2 👎 2

report.summary: Track verified safety numbers
report.label: None yet
report.description: Signal should remember that you've verified safety numbers with a contact. When you run into a friend, it's easy to forget whether you've done this or not, and anything to make it more convenient increases security. Some users add a check mark to the contact's name, but this is a terrible solution. This change shouldn't require any new options or settings. It would be nice: for both users to see a "Your safety number with XXX was verified [/ not verified]" message in the conversation in the style that you already see e.g. "Your safety number with XXX has changed" to see an indication of whether the safety number for any given contact has been verified in "Conversation settings > verify safety number", and perhaps also additional info about it e.g. when verification occurred, how ... to have some ongoing visual indication of the verification status within each conversation (maybe the lock and checkmarks could become green instead of grey? or there could be a different color in the title bar or background color?) I'm guessing it's unwise, though, to prevent someone from re-verifying a safety number with a contact in case, e.g., their threat model includes physical tampering Thanks for considering this! 👍 4

report.summary: [UX] Passphrase-protect and hide only "sensitive" contacts.
report.label: None yet
report.description: As part of an intermediate threat level(?) model, I'd like to have - like in GO SMS Pro, for example - the passphrase-protection apply only to a subset of my contacts/conversations, which should not affect normal usage of the app for the rest of the conversations in any way. The "sensitive" conversations should only show up and be available to interact with when the passphrase is entered. For this to happen, of course, there needs to be an entirely different handling of the passphrase-protection (or just a new dedicated contacts-hiding passphrase mechanism?) where it doesn't auto-lock the whole app but only some conversations. In this case I should have something like an Unlock option in the Settings menu rather than as the first thing shown on app launch. The scenario I'm thinking of is probably a quite common one, where you expect to forget your phone on a table somewhere and to have people looking through it while you're gone. In that case it's not much of a problem if they can get past the lockscreen but it becomes more important that a few apps or app sections holding sensitive information be really locked down with something more complicated than what's typically available as a screen locker. (If I complicate the screen locker by making it a long PIN or passphrase I severely reduce the usability of my phone, and in my opinion it's the same with my SMS handling app, which should be able to deal with "inocuous" conversations quickly and easily even if I have other conversations that I want to keep under a tighter lock.) As for new message notifications from the hidden contacts, they should have some generic new-message text that doesn't disclose either the contact's name or the contents of what they've sent you. 👍 1 👎 5

report.summary: Show "new safety number" warning in group for group messages
report.label: None yet
report.description: Bug description When a user changes key, the "safety numbers changed, accept?" message appears in a private conversation with the user, even if the message was sent in a group. I observed that people find this confusing, sometimes not realizing that they're missing group messages and then blaming Signal for losing them. I know that the fact that a message is a "group message" is itself part of the message, and if the message is not trusted this information shouldn't be trusted too. Still I think that in this case the sweet spot between security and usability lies in showing these messages in the group conversation. Partially related: #5985. Steps to reproduce Have a group conversation One of the users changes key (reinstalls Signal) Check where the "safety numbers changed, accept?" warning appears. Actual result: The warning appears in a private conversation with the user. Expected result: The warning appears in the group conversation. Device: Nexus 6 Android version: 7.1.1 (stock) Signal version: 4.5.3

report.summary: Improve use of space in the message view
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description These are small issues but I think they could have some impact on user experience. Here they are (in order of importance): There is too much empty space between messages from the same person. The amount of space is OK for messages from two different people but that space is too much for messages from the same person. I often express my point in several consecutive messages and the spaces are breaking the flow. Right now you could fit about two extra lines between the text of two consecutive messages. Similarly it's not necessary to display the profile picture for every message. In one-on-one chat you actually don't need the pictures at all. But I'm less sure if this is actually an issue. Actual result: a lot of space between messages which interrupts the flow of conversation Expected result: good use of space

report.summary: Split long messages to a few messages while you are writing or pasting them
report.label: None yet
report.description: Please do like in Telegram messenger: remove a limit for a single message (currently it is a 2000 symbols and very annoying). Just split long messages to a few messages while you are writing them or pasting them (when you try to copy/paste long text to a Telegram, it automatically splits and sends to a few messages).

report.summary: Message received notification is a lie. No way for recipient to reset connection.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I sent an encrypted message. I see two ticks indicating that it has been delivered. The recipient received the error "Message encrypted for non-existing session" The recipient couldn't send me a message saying there was an error, so tried resetting the secure connection. That didn't work. It turns out that the Sender has to reset the connection - but there's no indication in the UI that is what is needed. Steps to reproduce Send message Get notification of delivery - which is a lie Spouse gets annoyed Try to work out how Signal has broken itself Go through menu options, get frustrated Read online help, get more frustrated Switch to Telegram which seems to work just fine Actual result: Messages aren't delivered. Notification lies. No information for sender that there is a problem. Expected result: "Hey, looks like the message didn't go through. Click here to reset your connection!" Screenshots Device info Device: Nexus 6 Android version: 7 Signal version: 4.6.1 Link to debug log

report.summary: Crash after tapping lock screen notification
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal crashes when entering a conversation via new message notification from lock screen. It's definitely not the first time that I encountered such a crash. Steps to reproduce I cannot reproduce the crash. But here is what I did: Receive a new message while phone is locked Turn on the screen Double tap the notification Enter Android PIN (because the screen is still locked) Actual result: Signal crashes without visibly appearing. There is just a system dialog which offers to send a crash report. Expected result: Signal opens showing the conversation with the new message. Device info Device: Fairphone 2 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 4.6.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d2fc6ab17fcbc9b4a9bcf84ae80fa32b

report.summary: Call quality degrades into choppy playback when both people talk at the same time
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: [ x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates [ x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports When two people talk at the same time (or when talking overlaps eachother) android user's voice quality goes down and voice starts to become choppy. One must wait for another to finish talking otherwise they can't hear clearly. I've tried Pixel XL into iPhone 5S, Nexus 5X into iPhone 5S. HTC One M8 to Pixel XL. All same results. Only iPhone 6s to 5s works without problems. Using relayed calls from signal servers does not help. Only the device running android gets choppy, I can always hear the iPhone user fine. Both got choppy when called from android to android. Device info Device: Pixel XL Android version: 7.1.2 Signal version: 4.6.0, 4.6.1

report.summary: Syncing with other android devices?
report.label: None yet
report.description: Since one can sync the Chrome extension it seems like the infrastructure is already in place. Is secondary android device syncing coming?

report.summary: [suggestion] Making signal server world readable
report.label: None yet
report.description: I respect that Signal is trying to improve the state of secure communications and is designed in such a way as to minimize the amount of metadata available to Open Whisper Systems, but because it is not a federated protocol, all Signal users must trust that Open Whisper Systems is telling the truth. While we have no reason to doubt that, it would be better not to have to operate solely on trust. There should be no downside to making Signal's servers world-readable (except for API keys, of course) so that users can verify for themselves that all messages are encrypted and minimal metadata are stored.

report.summary: Feature request: Option for Data only / SMS only / Both
report.label: None yet
report.description: What An option allowing the user to choose how messages should be sent. For encrypted chat all 3 options would be available. For unencrypted chat only SMS would be available. Why A person has ran out of data --> SMS has ran out of free texts --> data doesn't care --> both wants more control has a good package and can use both at any time I haven't read up on the protocol, but I assume the encryption is end to end and since this once was called TextSecure, encrypted texts should still be possible.

report.summary: user abadoned signal, workaround
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Well the problem i have is some contacts hav tested Signal (on iOS) but have stoped useing the app. Signal stil expect them to use Signal. Since on my P9 I use Signal for all communiction SMS get to Signal conversation flow. If the contact that have passively abadoned signal write an SMS it gets listed and Signal defaults to send them an answer over data service, which the doesent reach the Phone of the SMS message received before. This is very bad. Moste of the time I am aware the person doesnt use Signal and chose SMS to sen dthe message but sometimes I forget it and the to be receiving person is going to be upset because she doesn't receive an answer. Steps to reproduce register mobile number A for signal delete app from phone of user A send an SMS from user A to B B uses Signal Android as SMS App B receives SMS message insecure B knows A has removed Signal from phone and wants to write back but forgets to choose SMS for sending the message A doesn't receive the message because it never contacts the server Actual result: contact doesn't receive an answer Expected result: Either the receiver should get the message over the way he sent it to the receiver or the sender should be made aware the receiver probably doesn't uses signal anymore or sms should be a default option to chose from in contact setting There are some workaround for this drop SMS on Android app altogether (which is a no brainier in myy eyes) make trafic type selection permanent, in user settings, which would just wire up some available functions as defaults (workaround) implement active database , eg a number doesn't communicate once in a (to be defined, weeks/months ) timeframe to the server (connect to server not sending receiving a message) either drop the number from Secure user circle or notify the sender of a data message the chat partner has seen no data usage recently and my not receive the message in time (optimal, but provides probably meta data leak) Device info Device: HUaweii P9 to iPhone 6 Android version: 7.0.0 Signal version: All until to date as of writing 👍 3

report.summary: Backup/restore doesn't properly import group chats
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I installed a different ROM for my phone and made a backup of my conversations. After installing the ROM I registered my device and tried to restore the backup. That seemed to work fine but on closer inspection it turned out that group chats had been split into separate conversations, one for each person in the chat. So, for example, if I was in a group chat with Tom and Jerry, I would now have one chat with Tom (with all messages he sent to the group) and one for Jerry (with his messages). The group chat was not restored at all. Steps to reproduce Use Signal like normal (I did use a custom build with layout changes I've been working on with my own signing key, version 4.6.0), participate in group chats Create a backup in Signal Install a custom ROM (Lineage OS in my case). I wiped everything like system, cache, etc, except the internal storage (data) partition. Reinstall Signal Import the backup you've created earlier Actual result: Group chats are imported as separate chats for each person participating in the chat. Expected result: Group chats should be restored the way I backed them up, so all the messages from that group should appear in that group chat. Screenshots Omitted because privacy and I don't have photoshop at hand to do some blurring. Device info Device: Moto X 2014 (victara) xt1092 Android version: 6.0.0 (stock moto) -> 7.1.2 lineage os nightly june 2nd Signal version: 4.6.0 / 4.6.1 Link to debug log Sorry, don't have that.. 👍 2

report.summary: APK hash doesn't match website
report.label: None yet
report.description: I'm attempting to verify the download on your official channel: https://whispersystems.org/android/apk/ The sha256 hash of the downloaded APK doesn't match the fingerprint posted on the website 29:F3:4E:5F:27:F2:11:B4:24:BC:5B:F9:D6:71:62:C0 EA:FB:A2:DA:35:AF:35:C1:64:16:FC:44:62:76:BA:26 The instructions are unclear, does the above hash correspond to a simple hash of the .apk file, or do I need OWS's public key? It's not immediately obvious where to find it. A better setup would be to host an F-Droid repo so you could push prompt, secure updates to your users using an alternative download channel. Thanks :) 👍 2

report.summary: [Feature request/Suggestion] Clear text input function (quick "delete text" button)
report.label: None yet
report.description: Quite often when "sharing" a clipboard (text) with the Signal App I noticed that the text is inappropriate or more simply, I decided not to send this text. I have to mark and delete the text. It would be easier, if the text input has a button(marked with "X" or a delete symbol), so that the text could be quickly deleted by clicking the button or symbol.

report.summary: Disappearing messages still appear on desktop app days later
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When using the desktop app, when a person sends me a message, the chat window jumps to a section of disappearing messages from a week ago. The disappearing timer was set to five minutes. The messages disappeared from my phone correctly, but they are still visible on my computer. The messages have also disappeared on the phone and computer of the account that they were sent to. Steps to reproduce Unfortunately, I have never seen this before, so I am not exactly sure of the steps to reproduce it. Here are the repro steps from my end that made this happen: Send messages from Android (OnePlus 3T phone, Signal v 4.6.1) Messages were received on Android (Google Nexus 5 phone) Use Signal Desktop a week later on a Mac (macOS Sierra 10.12.5, Chrome 58.0.3029.110) Actual result: Messages that were supposed to disappear are still visible Expected result: Secure messages should disappear from all devices Screenshots In the screenshot you can see the text about turning on and off disappearing messages but also the timestamp showing that the messages occurred last Monday: Device info Computer: Device: Macbook Pro, macOS Sierra 10.12.5, Chrome 58.0.3029.110 Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 4.6.1 Link to debug log The desktop app doesn't seem to provide debug logs. I can provide one from my phone, if that will be useful, but the bug doesn't appear on my phone. 👍 1

report.summary: Incorrect "Tap for unsecured fallback" prompt
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Testing current master @ 59d3e66. Got a message from a contact who has new safety numbers. Replying on my phone fails and offers unsecured fallback ("This message will not be encrypted because the recipient is no longer a Signal user"). The input text field still says "Signal message" and the contact still appears in the list of Signal contacts, even after a contact list refresh. Sending messages from Desktop to this contact works fine. Steps to reproduce receive a Signal msg from someone with new safety numbers try to reply -> unsecured fallback refresh contacts, try to reply -> same reply from desktop (works), try to reply from Signal-Android again -> still getting unsecured fallback prompt Device info Device: FP1 Android version: 4.2.2 Signal version: master at 59d3e66 (edit: still happening at 52311eb) Link to debug log I think there's an unrelated crash in this log, I'll probably have to open another issue for that one. https://gist.github.com/anonymous/90fbff8812f10e19f659ad12cf588a3b

report.summary: [Group contacts] When adding new contacts, only a part of the secured signal-enabled contacts is shown and selectable
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Actual result: After having created a new group with three contacts, when adding further new contacts, only a fraction of signal-enabled contacts are shown and selectable Steps to reproduce Provisionally, I stopped and restarted Signal ; and generated new index of contacts (Android Contact app) the bug is still present Expected result: I expected the whole contact list of my Signal contacts. I compared the list (while adding contacts to an existing group) with the list when using to send a Signal message. My observation is: List (when adding contacts to a group): A B ... Z List (when sending to someone) A AnameWithA B BnameWithB ... (more entries) Z (until here, same as above) # (space) +telephonenumber (space) +telephonenumber 1 1and1 A B .. Z The second part appears to be the correct full list of contacts. Bug The selection - when selecting contacts to be added to a group - appears to show only the first part ("A"...."Z") of the list. Screenshots n/a Device info Device: Huawei P8 Lite Android version: 6.0 Signal version: 4.6.1 Link to debug log n/a

report.summary: Legal attribution to Google missing
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When reading the readme I cannot find "Google Play and the Google Play logo are trademarks of Google Inc." which is required when using the badge. https://play.google.com/intl/en_us/badges/ Also please set the height to 80. 👎 1

report.summary: Column 'verified' does not exist
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description A contact of mine unregistered recently. I decided to check and see if Signal would now default to sending that contact SMS. Upon opening the contact's conversation view, the application crashed. While reproducing the issue to produce a log, it seems it has worsened, and now Signal crashes on launch, rendering it completely unusable. I think this is caused by having an existing encrypted conversation with the contact. Looking at the logs, it appears that the identity information is deleted after the user unregisters, but it still tries to access the identity information to decrypt the existing messages. I haven't looked at the relevant code yet, so this is just a guess. Steps to reproduce contact unregisters from Signal go to their conversation view app crashes Actual result: Signal crashes. Expected result: Signal should not crash. Device info Device: Huwai Nexus 6P Android version: 7.1.2 Signal version: latest master Link to debug log I can't open Signal to capture a log without it crashing, but here's a snippet from logcat: https://paste.ee/p/1iAC5

report.summary: Sharing safety numbers before animation finishes shares incorrect numbers
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description If you share your safety number using the share button before the numbers finish animating, the numbers shared are different from their actual value. Steps to reproduce open a conversation tap "view safety number" observe the set of numbers animating tap the share button before the numbers finish animating share to an app freak out because your safety number is different from your contact's Actual result: The numbers shared are the numbers from the instant you tap the share button Expected result: The numbers shared are always the numbers at the end of the animation Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy Grand Prime Android version: 5.1.1 Signal version: 4.7.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/568b5f5e814437da45c8e867f79b953b 👍 2

report.summary: Can't update Signal standalone APK
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates Bug description I don't have Google Play nor google services so I use the standalone Signal apk. Now I can't update the google-free standalone build from https://signal.org/android/apk/ . In the contact list there is a message saying Your version of Signal is outdated Your version of Signal will expire in 4 days Tap to update to the most recent version But when I tap it says: no such app found Prior to that Signal had been self-updating without any problems. 👍 1

report.summary: Verified indicator for groups
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description A verified indicator is displayed in the action bar of groups, whose members are all marked as verified. I don't know whether this is expected behaviour. If the indicator for groups is expected behaviour, its placement will have to be adjusted (IMHO). Steps to reproduce Create group mark all members as verified open group Actual result: Verified indicator is shown on the second line of the action bar. Expected result: Verified indicator is not shown at all (maybe because groups don't have SN?) or the indicator is placed in the same line as the group name. Screenshots Device info Device: Fairphone 2 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 4.7.0 👍 3

report.summary: Marked verified status messages have sent checkmark
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Contact verified status messages have the message sent checkmark displayed in the conversation list. Steps to reproduce mark a contact as verified check conversation list Actual result: Verified message entry has one sent checkmark Expected result: There should be no checkmarks Same for marked as unverified status messages. Device info Signal version: 4.7.0 👍 2

report.summary: Marked as verified status messages should not be shown in groups
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Marking a contact as verified or unverified generates a status message in each conversation the contact is in. But both actions are manually and deliberately carried out by the user, so I think that one status message in the one-to-one conversation is enough. Steps to reproduce choose a contact that is member of several groups mark that contact as verified check the conversation list Actual result: All conversations that the contact is in have a new status message and thus jump to the top of the conversation list, however old the group conversation may have been Expected result: Only show a status message in the one-to-one conversation Maybe it would still be somewhat helpful to generate a status message in a group once all group members have been verified. Device info Signal version: 4.7.0

report.summary: "Safety numbers approval" switch does nothing (and has a confusing description)
report.label: None yet
report.description: As I didn't understand what the "Safety numbers approval" switch really does, and the blog post does not mention it, I tried to look it up in the source code. It seems to me that isSendingIdentityApprovalRequired() is not called anywhere. I guess that the idea is: when the switch is turned on, then approval is always required when sending, without taking into account if the sender had the opportunity to see the safety number change warning. The receiving behavior doesn't change. This is not clear from the interface, a better description of the switch could be something like: "Require approval of safety numbers changes for unverified contacts" Device info Signal version: 4.7.0

report.summary: SMS based safety number verification
report.label: None yet
report.description: So here is the idea: now that we have persistent identity verification, an SMS based safety number verification can be implemented. Of course this is not as good as a face-to-face meeting where the numbers are checked, but the only way to perform a MITM is to control both the Signal server and the mobile carrier, in order to manipulate the SMS message exchange. This is very unlikely (remember that the SSL certificate of the server is pinned). I think that an attack of this kind is less likely than getting the device compromised. In this case encryption is not of any help.

report.summary: Swiping to close Signal from list of running apps closes the list of apps
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description While Signal is running in dark mode, when I use the android menu button to list all running apps, and then swipe the signal app to close it, the menu of all running apps closes (crashes?). report.summary: Automatically check verification status after qrcode scan
report.label: None yet
report.description: Backgrund: PR #6731. This could be automated like this: The QR code contains the safety number and a random password, valid only while the QR code page is open; Device A scans Device B's QR code, checks the number, marks it as "verified" and sends an acknowledgement message to device B, authenticated by the temporary password; If the password matches, device B sets the number as verified too, as the acknowledgement message can only come from a device that physically scanned the QR code. #1016 deserves some love too. Thanks @moxie0 for the great features 4.7.0 brought. Edit: thinking about it, the "temporary password" probably doesn't need to be temporary at all, just random and per-contact. 👍 1

report.summary: Contact "joined" Signal notification can be misleading
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When a person that already is on Signal is added to the phones contacts, the "contact joined Signal" notification is somewhat misleading, whereas "contact is on Signal" is more generally correct. This confusion will occur more often the more people already are on Signal. I also think that "is on Signal" sounds less scary than "joined Signal". Steps to reproduce add a new contact to your phone on the next day, see generated notification: "contact joined Signal" ask your contact about it: tells you he joined Signal months/years ago The wording was changed in 75782af. 👍 2

report.summary: Notify if user does not receive mesage in a certain amount of time
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports When the message is sent, the first tick acknowledges that the message was sent correctly and if there is an error, the notification alerting the user appears after some time. The second tick acknowledges the correct reception of the message and it would be great to have an option to notify the user if message is not received even after some time (a few days for example). It usually indicates dead phone or battery, that the recepient is no longer available on Signal, wrong recepient, or even some exotic bug in the system, etc. Therefore it would be very practical to have a notification popping up alerting the user that message hasn't been received even after some time. I also suggest this time be adjustable and 1 day as the default setting.

report.summary: Feature request: Popup warning messages before unverified communication
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description "In July 2016, the Internet Society published a user study that assessed the ability of Signal users to detect and deter man-in-the-middle attacks. The study concluded that 21 out of 28 participants failed to correctly compare public key fingerprints in order to verify the identity of other Signal users, and that the majority of these users still believed they had succeeded while in reality they failed." - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Signal_(software)#Usability Steps to reproduce Send a message Make or receive a phone call Actual result: No warning messages pop-up Expected result: I expect at least an option to make a warning popups before unverified communication is taking place. Another option is to place a extra icon grouped with the phone/lock icon. Device info Signal version: 4.7.4

report.summary: Unsubscribed users are not removed from groups
report.label: None yet
report.description: Steps to reproduce Have a member of a group unsubscribe from Signal Check how the now unsubscribed number is still part of the group Now the stale number is impossible to remove from the group. Sometimes re-registering is not an option, as access to the number might have been lost. Most of the time the user just doesn't care. Expected result: The unsubscribed user is automatically removed from all the groups. I know the server is not aware of groups, but I think there are still ways to handle this. For example: When sending a message to a group (i.e., to all the group members), if a user is not a Signal user anymore, remove it; Before adding a user to a group because of a message coming from another group member, check if the number is actually a Signal number. Signal version: 4.8.0

report.summary: Signal-Android-x86 (VM): Doesn't work with Lan connection
report.label: None yet
report.description: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports I installed the Signal apk, from the WhisperSystems website (Signal 4.7.4), on Android-X86 in a virtual machine and linked it with the Chromium app, so far so good. Even so the linking process worked pretty fine, it turned out that all the other functionality in Signal-on-Android-x86 isn't working at all (like sending text messages or esp. calling other signal users). That is probably because Android-x86 (in a Virtualbox) uses the LAN interface (NIC) (to connect to the internet) and it seems like the Signal-Android-app expects a WiFi connection instead of a LAN connection. Could you please try to find a solution, so that people could use the Signal-Android-App on Android-x86 to call their contacts (of course a solution for the Signal-Chromium-Desktop-App would be preferable ;) )? Bug description Signal is not able to just use an Android LAN connection for sending/receiving messages or making calls Steps to reproduce Install Signal apk on Android-x86 just with LAN connection Open Siganl app send message/call person Expected result: sending the message Device info Device: innotek GmbH VirtualBox (android_x86) Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: Signal 4.7.4 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/1469b2d016896142d3875f7b8f6b6418

report.summary: isLowMemory should use getLargeMemoryClass, not getMemoryClass
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The current isLowMemory code suboptimally uses getMemoryClass instead of getLargeMemoryClass. Since Signal already sets android:largeHeap, the relevant limit is returned by getLargeMemoryClass, as per the Android documentation. I think this is behind the effect where some devices can easily send higher resolution images over other messaging apps (e.g. Whatsapp) but get a rather low memory class rating in Signal and compress the images too much as a result.

report.summary: Weak APK signing key (RSA1024 / SHA1 Digest)
report.label: None yet
report.description:
I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal APK on website (and likely via Google Play store) is signed with cert that uses a RSA1024 key with SHA1 digest. Unsure if this is actually an issue as it seems likely that you would be aware already but since I couldn't find a prior issue I thought I should raise it. My instinct tells me that changing to a >=2048bit key would break update functionality as the signing certificate digest is pinned in the app. Better safe than sorry to raise this anyway, Livvy Steps to reproduce jarsigner -verify -certs -verbose Signal-website-release-4.8.1.apk Actual result: Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) - Signed by "CN=Whisper Systems, OU=Research and Development, O=Whisper Systems, L=Pittsburgh, ST=PA, C=US" Digest algorithm: SHA1 Signature algorithm: SHA1withRSA, 1024-bit key
jar verified. Expected result: Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) Not necessarily a bug report so not necessarily an "expected" result but in an ideal world: - Signed by "CN=Whisper Systems, OU=Research and Development, O=Whisper Systems, L=Pittsburgh, ST=PA, C=US" Digest algorithm: SHA1 Signature algorithm: SHA256withRSA, 4096-bit key
jar verified. Screenshots Device info Device: N/A Android version: N/A Signal version: 4.8.1 Link to debug log

report.summary: (Possible security issue) Whilst de-registering foreign number in UAE messages, are sent/received
report.label: None yet
report.description: Bug description While registered with Signal on a foreign number, and visiting UAE, Signal does not work so whilst de-registration of foreign number, messages that were not being sent/received are suddenly sent/received in that time window. Is there a possible vulnerability just during that time frame? Steps to reproduce Use a SIM card from a foreign country where Signal is not blocked or censored and register and use it in that country. Go to UAE and use Signal (messages will not be sent) Send a few messages and instantly go to next step Try de-registering (it will give an error of "error connecting to server") Previously sent messages will be delivered whilst the de-registration is happening Messages will not be sent anymore afterwards and de-registration won't happen. Messages sent from outside UAE are also not delivered normally, but are received whilst the UAE user is de-registering. Actual result: So messages are not being sent/received at all.... but then when trying to de-register the messages are sent/received. The main problem here is that during de-registration all messages are sent/received. Expected result: Not sure what I expect, but if Signal is blocked then messages shouldn't go through at all. So maybe it is a security issue, or perhaps there is another way to circumvent censorship? Screenshots Sorry no screenshots as the explanation is self-sufficient (hopefully). Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy S7 Android version: 7.0 Signal version: 4.8.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/b53230b3764cb08ad97ff102088700db

report.summary: Texts not delivered to users who get new phones and don't reinstall Signal
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates Bug description Scenario: Someone is using Signal, then switches to a new phone but doesn’t reinstall/re-set up Signal. Issue: I send them a text message through Signal. The lock symbol appears (so the message is being routed through Signal), the first checkmark (the message was sent) appears, but I never get the second checkmark (the message was delivered). I've run into this issue with at least 3 people in the last week. In addition to the problem itself, it is additionally problematic that there is no notification the message was never delivered. I only discover it when I go to text that person again days, or weeks later - and even then it often takes me a few more instances before I notice what's going on. Steps to reproduce Set up Signal on a phone. Drop phone in toilet. Get a new phone, don't set up Signal. Have someone else send you a text message. Actual result: The recipient does not receive any message. The sender does not receive a notification their message failed to deliver. Expected result: Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) The text message would be routed to the recipient's normal text message app, OR... The sender would be notified the text message could not be delivered. Platform info Operating System: LG G6, Android 7.0. Signal version: 4.9.9

report.summary: Attached image from camera leaves plaintext copy
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When attaching an image directly from the camera, a plaintext copy of the image is saved to the folder /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/org.thoughcrime.securesms/files Steps to reproduce Go into any Signal conversation Leave the message empty Press the blue paperclip button (this does not happen when you press the quick camera button) Press the green "Camera" button Take a picture Press the tick or similar button in the camera app to accept the picture No need to continue editing, captioning or sending the image, the file has already been created and is never removed. Even deleting the draft doesn't delete the file. Actual result: A file with a jpg extension is created in the folder /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/org.thoughcrime.securesms/files - the file name is made of the digits of what appears to be ctime of the time the file was created. The file persists throughout the life of the app and never deleted, even when the image in the conversation is deleted or the entire conversation is deleted. Clearing Signal's storage from the app info applet does delete all files in that folder. Expected result: Ideally, No plaintext image file would be created anywhere within the phone's file system Alternatively, the file will be deleted as soon as practicable after it has been encrypted and stored in Signal's database Device info Device: Tested on OnePlus 2 and Samsung Galaxy S7 Android version: Tested under OxygenOS Stock 3.6.0 for Oneplus 2 and Cyanogen 14.1 NIGHTLY for S7 Signal version: 4.9.9 and, based on the pictures left on my device, multiple previous versions 👍 7

report.summary: Signal messages aren't received by SMS after switching phones but keeping number, and not in installing signal
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Messages sent from signal don't come through to SMS on new phone without signal. The new phone shares the number of an old phone that had signal. My guess is that the number is still registered in the server since signal was never uninstalled from the old phone, so the server tries to route to the app for that number, even though the new phone doesn't have it. Installing signal on the new phone makes new messages come through without trouble. Steps to reproduce buy new phone with new sim card transfer number to new phone don't uninstall signal from old phone don't install signal on new phone Actual result: new phone doesn't get messages sent from signal Expected result: new phone should get messages from signal in default SMS app Device info Device: iPhone 6s (new phone), Galaxy S6 (old phone)

report.summary: Messages w/attachment sent on desktop disappear from mobile
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Issue copied over from Closed Desktop issue 1424 as requested by @scottnonnenberg Bug description Under the following conditions, messages disappear in an untimely fashion from Signal Android: The message is sent from Signal Desktop (Electron); and The message has an attachment or is a voice message; and The message is sent in a conversation that has the "Disappearing Messages" feature turned on Steps to reproduce Have Signal Android and Signal Desktop (Electron) linked Enter a conversation on Signal Desktop Turn on "Disappearing Messages" if not already on (set the time to 1 day) Send a message with an attachment - or - send a voice message Wait for the message to be sent successfully, reach the recipient successfully (two "tick marks") Watch the same conversation on Signal Android Actual result: The messages are synchronised to Signal Android After around 1-2 minutes, the messages with the attachments disappear from Signal Android Unreproducible: Sometimes the message doesn't show up at all on Signal Android. This happened to me yesterday pretty consistently with voice messages but I can't reproduce that today. I suspect that they might show up and disappear too fast for me to see. Today they behave like other messages with attachments. (the messages do not disappear from Signal Desktop nor do they disappear from the recipient's device) Expected result: The messages are synchronised to Signal Android and stay there for the duration specified in the "Disappearing messages" menu The messages disappear simultaneously from both Signal Desktop and Signal Android when the period specified for "Disappearing messages" has elapsed. Screenshots Desktop: Mobile: Platform info Operating System: Ubuntu GNU/Linux 16.04.3 LTS (xaniel) x86_64 Browser: N/A (Electron) Signal version: signal-desktop 1.0.22 amd64 Operating System: Android 7.1.2, LineageOS version 14.1-20170824-NIGHTLY-oneplus2 Device: Oneplus 2 Signal version: Signal 4.9.9 Link to debug log Signal Desktop Signal Android 👍 2

report.summary: "Learn more" web link from "Verify safety number" results in 404 error
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When I click on link "Learn more" in "Verify safety number" I see address whispersystems.org redirects to signal.org and reports 404. It looks like http server redirect for this particular link is not working properly. Steps to reproduce Start Signal. From main Signal window click on pencil button. List of contacts is displayed. Click on one of Signal user. From top-right menu select "Conversation settings". Select "View safety number". At the bottom tab on link "Learn more". Actual result: Now problem appears. In address bar there is https://whispersystems.org/redirect/safety-numbers that redirects to https://signal.org/redirect/safety-numbers but this page displays "404" with text "Something is amiss! You might try browsing for what you wanted." Clicking on link "browsing for what you wanted" displays https://moxie.org web page. Expected result: Instead o 404 actual help should be displayed. My humble suggestion: Quick fix: fix the http server redirect (this will fix help links in currently installed Signal versions) Long term fix: replace all of the whispersystems.org links to signal.org in Signal app (the same in iOS and desktop version) to remove chance of redirect problems.

report.summary: Ability to choose preferred SIM for SMS on a per-contact basis (dual SIM)
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When using a dual SIM Android phone, un-encrypted text messages (SMS) are sent from the primary SIM card even when all received text messages from this contact were received by the secondary SIM. Steps to reproduce SIM1 is the primary SIM with the data connection. SIM2 is the secondary SIM without data connection. In my case, Signal was registered using the number of SIM2. However, sending/receiving encrypted messages via SIM1 only works flawlessly, thanks! open existing conversation of a contact which does not use Signal (yet) this contact does only know my SIM2 number and thus, the whole conversation so far was written to and sent by my SIM2 send an un-encrypted text message without manually switching the send-button to SIM2; SIM1 is always selected and used by default Actual result: the contact gets my message from my SIM1 phone number which she did not recognize my text message gets misinterpreted as spam which results in a failed conversation Expected result: my text message gets sent via SIM2 (as before) and my contact recognizes my number IMHO, this can be accomplished in two ways: Signal asks me once (per un-encrypted conversation) which SIM I want to use for this contact This can be modified in the conversation settings Signal analyses the conversation so far and if (a) every or (b) the most recent ones or (c) the previous message was sent from SIM2, use SIM2 as long as I manually don't switch the SIM for this conversation. I'd go with 2. (c) because it seems to be the most intuitive solution without additional UI elements for switching default SIM in the conversation settings. Device info Device: OnePlus 5 Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 4.9.9

report.summary: Use keyboard incognito mode API
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The new keyboard "incognito" mode API should be used so that keyboards such as Gboard do not collect input data from messages typed in Signal. Steps to reproduce Type a message using Gboard Actual result: Keyboard does not use "incognito" mode Expected result: Keyboard should be loaded with personalization disabled. Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 4.9.9 👍 4
