report.summary: Signal 4.10.11 crashes when opening group on Alien Dalvik
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal crashes with the "Signal" has stopped unexpectedly when opening a group on Jolla/Alien Dalvik. It looks to me that this happend due to a method missing in that implemementation. Configuration.getLayoutDirection() is API level 17 while the actual Aliend Dalvik provides Android 4.1.2 with API level 16. So this is is no bug in Signal but having a workaround would help Jolla users to use vanilla Signal on their device. Steps to reproduce Start signal Open a group Actual result: Signal crashes with the message "Signal" has stopped unexpectedly Expected result: Group should open as they did with Signal 4.9.5 Device info Device: Jolla (alien_jolla_bionic) Android version: 4.1.2 (Alien Dalvik) Signal version: 4.10.11 Debug log Device : unknown Jolla (alien_jolla_bionic) Android : 4.1.2 (eng.erin.20151105.144423, JZO54K) Memory : 26M (20.48% free, 256M max) Memclass: 128 OS Host : erin-ubuntu App : Signal 4.10.11 [nemo@Sailfish ~]$ devel-su journalctl -a -f [...] Sep 24 16:06:16 Sailfish start_alien.sh[1608]: 09-24 16:06:16.094 3812 3812 E dalvikvm: Could not find class 'android.graphics.drawable.RippleDrawable', referenced from method android.support.v7.widget.AppCompatImageHelper.hasOverlappingRendering [...] Sep 24 16:06:16 Sailfish start_alien.sh[1608]: 09-24 16:06:16.597 3812 3841 E dalvikvm: Could not find class 'android.media.AudioAttributes$Builder', referenced from method org.thoughtcrime.securesms.notifications.MessageNotifier.sendInThreadNotification Sep 24 16:06:16 Sailfish start_alien.sh[1608]: 09-24 16:06:16.982 3812 3812 E dalvikvm: Could not find class 'android.graphics.drawable.RippleDrawable', referenced from method org.thoughtcrime.securesms.ConversationListItem.setRippleColor [...] Sep 24 16:06:25 Sailfish start_alien.sh[1608]: 09-24 16:06:25.784 3812 3812 E AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main Sep 24 16:06:25 Sailfish start_alien.sh[1608]: 09-24 16:06:25.784 3812 3812 E AndroidRuntime: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: android.content.res.Configuration.getLayoutDirection Sep 24 16:06:25 Sailfish start_alien.sh[1608]: 09-24 16:06:25.784 3812 3812 E AndroidRuntime: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.util.DynamicLanguage.getLayoutDirection(DynamicLanguage.java:48) Sep 24 16:06:25 Sailfish start_alien.sh[1608]: 09-24 16:06:25.784 3812 3812 E AndroidRuntime: at report.summary: Annoying banner "Make your profile name and photo visible to this group?" will not go away.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I didn't set up a profile, but even if I did, I would want the option not to share my profile with a group. I can't get rid of this banner and it takes up 33% of the available chat window space above my onscreen keyboard. Steps to reproduce Go into a group Refuse to share profile Actual result: Banner won't go away (I didn't try sharing because I don't want to share) Expected result: It should go away and let me talk to my friends in peace. Device info Device: Moto G Play Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 4.10.12 👍 3

report.summary: [Feature Request] Swipe left/right to next media item within conversation
report.label: None yet
report.description: On other messaging apps, the typical behavior within a conversation that includes multiple media files such as images, is to allow swiping left/right to the previous/next one. If multiple images are shared in a conversation, that makes it much easier to go through them all without leaving fullscreen. In Signal if, let's say, 5 images are shared in a row, you need to open them individually, then go back, open the next one and repeat until done.

report.summary: Constant pestering to make your profile name and photo visible to group
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description After the recent update signal asks if I would like to "make my profile name and photo visible to this group" in group chat windows but there is no way to dismiss the message without actually sharing my details. Tapping on the message brings up a prompt with two options: CANCEL MAKE VISIBLE Tapping cancel does not make the prompt at the top of the chat go away and I do not wish to share my details in the chat. Steps to reproduce Update to the latest version of Signal Open group chat, you should see a blue prompt at the top of the chat Tap on the prompt Tap on "CANCEL" Actual result: The popup disappears but leaves the prompt at the top of the screen. Expected result: The prompt should be dismissed after tapping cancel. Device info Device: Nexus 6 Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 4.10.11 👍 4

report.summary: Changes are not saved when editing pictures with the brush tool
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Changes are not saved after editing a picture Steps to reproduce Take a picture or attach an existing picture inside of a conversation but don't send it Tap the edit icon on the preview thumbnail Use the brush tool to draw on the picture, then tap the checkmark at the top left to confirm changes. Do not use any of the other tools The edits will not be present Actual result: The picture is unchanged Expected result: The picture reflects the edits made by the user Device info Device: Google Pixel Android version: 8.0.0 Signal version: 4.10.12 👍 1

report.summary: Show message text at direct reply with privacy option of only showing the name of sender
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I enabled the option "Show name only" in "Notifications". When I receive a message, the text "New message" is shown in my notifications (which is intended), but when I want to reply directly in the notification, it should show the message that I received (but still shows the "New message" text). How can I answer if I don't know what the message was. This worked on my old phone with Android 4.2.2, but does not with my new one with Android 7. Steps to reproduce In options: Notifications > Show > Name only Close Signal Receive new message Try to reply directly from your notifications Actual result: When I use direct reply within the notifications, "New message" is shown Expected result: When I hit direct reply within the notifications, the message text should be shown Screenshots Device info Device: OnePlus 5 Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 4.10.12

Is there an option to just have their names be their first initial and not show them on the message? Could such a thing be added? 👍 2

report.summary: Signal user marked as non-signal user in conversation for 10-15 seconds
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates [ x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Once in awhile, I am in a conversation with a signal user and for about 10-15 seconds, the blue circle with airplane changes to gray and the text changes to "send unsecure sms message". I don't really have particular steps to repro this with, but it seems to happen if I'm chatting with a signal user and during that, another contact I've invited to use signal installs it and messages me. Steps to reproduce see above Actual result: Signal contacts appearing as non-signal contacts sometimes in-conversation with them Expected result: Signal contacts always show as signal contacts in-conversation unless they've uninstalled the app, etc. Screenshots Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy S8 Android version: 7.0 Signal version: 4.10.12 Link to debug log 👍 1

report.summary: Crash when registering on new device and viewing group chats
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Describe here the issue that you are experiencing. My old phone broke, and I got lent one by a friend, Samsung S3 (model GT-I9300), running CyanogenMod (11.0-InstallerXNPQ32P) with android 4.4.4 which is old but they asked me not to reflash it as it had some tools that were hard to set up and worked which they didn't want breaking. The google play framework was out of date, so couldn't install via the play store, instead getting the apk from https://signal.org/android/apk/ and installing it. I have swapped sims from old phone, and started up signal, registered and sent test message to my friend which worked, they could send one back and that worked. Later I asked someone from a group chat I was in to send a message to the group, and it came through, but now everytime I open the app it crashes with the stack trace shown below. I get notifications fine, but whenever I go into the app it crashes. I cleared data and reinstalled the apk and it still does this repeatably. It also has xposed framework on it, but I couldn't see how to disable that so unsure if it is interfering. I'm just wondering whether this would be an issue with: signal old cyanogen old gapps xposed Attached the logs below, let me know if you need more than that. Steps to reproduce Have a group chat on one phone Register a new device running outdated software? Receive a group chat message Actual result: Crash Expected result: Signal works as normal, can view group chat messages, no crash. Device info Device: Samsung S3 (model GT-I9300) Android version: 4.4.4 Signal version: 4.10.12 Link to debug log E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): FATAL EXCEPTION: JobConsumer-0 E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 5212 E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot set request property after connection is made E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): at com.android.okhttp.internal.http.HttpURLConnectionImpl.setRequestProperty(HttpURLConnectionImpl.java:508) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): at com.android.okhttp.internal.http.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.setRequestProperty(HttpsURLConnectionImpl.java:294) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): at org.whispersystems.signalservice.internal.push.PushServiceSocket.downloadAttachment(PushServiceSocket.java:468) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): at org.whispersystems.signalservice.internal.push.PushServiceSocket.retrieveAttachment(PushServiceSocket.java:372) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): at org.whispersystems.signalservice.api.SignalServiceMessageReceiver.retrieveAttachment(SignalServiceMessageReceiver.java:119) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): at org.whispersystems.signalservice.api.SignalServiceMessageReceiver.retrieveAttachment(SignalServiceMessageReceiver.java:88) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.AvatarDownloadJob.onRun(AvatarDownloadJob.java:85) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:76) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46)

report.summary: Huge battery drain when on cellular data and no Google Play services
report.label: None yet
report.description: Bug description On a Google Play Services free phone and on cellular data, Signal contributes to around ~25% of battery usage during the day. This problem doesn't occur on WiFi. Steps to reproduce remove Google Play Services (or don't have them in the first place) turn off Wifi use Signal Actual result: battery usage is huge. Expected result: battery usage should be similar to the case with WiFi Platform info Operating System: Android 7.0 Signal version: 4.10.12 I also use Telegram and Riot regullary and they do not drain as much battery. Is there any info I can provide to help fix this issue? Log Not sure if it will be helpful as it's only a recent one. Log Screenshots: Screenshot 1 Screenshot 1

report.summary: Should not ask to make profile visible to group as long as all members are in contacts
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description In most of the groups all members are in my contacts already (e.g. close friends). I am never asked to make my profile visible to any of those users individually, because they are in my contacts. But now in those groups I am asked to do this explicitly. It would be nice if I would not see this banner as long as there are only contacts in this group. Steps to reproduce someone else creates a group where all members are already in your contacts Actual result: Banner requests to make profile visible. Expected result: I already made my profile visible to all group members individually (e.g. automatically), so the banner should not be there. P.S.: The "contact verified" flag could also be used to decide that a profile should be made visible automatically. Device info Signal version: 4.11.0 👍 3

report.summary: Overall Privacy-Compromise Created by Profile Feature
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Not really sure how to report this. I deem that it belongs here since it is not a support request, and is an issue with Signal. But it it is considerably more general than other bug reports. I have read all of the issue tickets reporting issues with the new profile feature, and all of them identify issues with the way the feature was implemented. None of them speak to the addition of this feature itself as problematic. I use Signal because it is still the project with the most diligent commitment to smartphone messaging privacy. I have until now had high confidence that Signal development decisions would be smart and levelheaded, and would not compromise my privacy. The addition of the profile feature has shaken that confidence. The announcement of the Profile feature in Beta, which I've only now had a chance to read, claims "All of this is possible without sacrificing the privacy and security that you have come to expect from Signal." This is not true. Half of my contacts know me by one name, half by another. It is imperative that there is no crossover between these identities. Furthermore, the gmail account my Android phone is registered under is a third identity. Disclosing that identity to some Signal contacts would represent a catastrophic privacy breach, which could even, hypothetically, endanger my life. Up until now, there has been no cause for concern in using Signal, as enforcing the segregation of these identities has presented no issues. Signal's design decisions have never presented any threat to this segregation, because the presumption has always been in favour of privacy. The "set up your profile" wizard which announced itself after the update prepopulated the name field with the name associated with my Google account. It would have been very easy to have accidentally accepted this as my profile name. As per the Signal blogpost, this name would then have been visible to all contacts saved in my phone. This decision thoughtlessly left me a single mistake away from a catastrophic privacy breach. The "Do It Later" option was minuscule and dangerously close in the UI to the very large "Accept" button. It was initially not visible to me, so it looked as if I was being forced to choose a unitary identity for a Signal instance where I was managing multiple identities. When I did spot it, after a reinstall, several attempts to press it on my large smartphone screen were unsuccessful. It took multiple attempts. Before I discovered the "Do it later" option, my compromise attempt to save an empty profile returned an error message. I also discovered, after temporarily choosing a privacy-preserving pseudonymous profile name (which would nevertheless appear highly incongruous to several of my contacts) that it is not possible to delete an identity once chosen. There is no option to do so, and if you try to save an empty profile it gives you an error. So I had to reinstall the app to delete my profile. And when you do not set up a profile, the app harrasses you with persistent notifications to do so during group conversations, as if the decision not to is assumed to be a temporary one by the Signal devs. There are several bug reports which suggests mitigations for some of these different problems (although not all of them - e.g. I have seen no mention of the prepopulation of the name field as a concern). Fixing each of these problems would indeed have reduced the severity of the threat to privacy represented by the introduction of the feature. (I also imagine there are people who believe that simply adding support for multiple profiles would solve the issue, but in my opinion this would drastically sophisticate the task of managing identities, and result in accidental breaches.) But fixing each of those issues would not address what seems to me the major issue: that this issue was so thoughtlessly introduced at all. Yes, it is clear that - to preserve my privacy - Signal devs decided it would be unwise to just automatically create a profile for me based on the name associated with my Gmail account. Instead I was given a dialogue with the name prepopulated. But this in itself was dangerous, and the fact that I was subjected to even this danger with apparently no consideration of how it could affect people with multiple identities leaves me with little confidence that similar or worse breaches might be thoughtlessly created in the future, in order to introduce some convenience feature which is secondary to the goal of a truly private messaging application. Using Signal is now fraught with inherent risk, and I am no longer confident that Signal devs have my privacy as their priority. For me - a Signal user whose privacy is paramount - this profile feature is not a feature but a bug. The utility added to the app by the profile feature, eliminating unknown phone numbers in group conversations, seems to address an edge case at best. It does not enhance the privacy of the user - its only effect on user privacy is to make privacy compromise more likely. I cannot see how its addition necessitates the attendant complexification of the task of staying private while using the app. And the reasoning behind its introduction, in a dev team with a commitment to privacy, is entirely opaque to me. I submit this issue as a Signal user who values privacy, and who has experienced a privacy scare because of Signal development decisions - something which I am sure should be of concern to a privacy-oriented project. It is considerably longer than a typical bug report, because it speaks to a broader issue. If this issue can be taken on and used to improve matters, that is to the good. If it is simply the case that Signal is reprioritising, or that it does not intend to cater to users like me with harder privacy requirements than the average (but privacy-conscious) user, that is sad to me, but I accept it. But it also suggests to me that it is misleading to call it Signal Private Messenger, and to entice users with more stringent needs into a potentially risky situation. 👍 1 👎 1

Steps to reproduce Download and Setup Cortana on an Android device Setup Cortana on a Windows 10 machine with at least the Creators Update Link your Microsoft Account Use a separate device to send an SMS (not Signal) to the device with Cortana Wait for the message to be received and for Cortana to forward it to your Windows 10 machine Reply to the message through the Windows 10 interface Actual result: The message is sent back through your phone but does not appear in Signal as a sent message. It will appear in the default "Messages" app though. Expected result: Signal should be listening for any SMS to be added to the database that are from the current device. Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy S6 Android version: 7.0 Signal version: 4.11.5 👍 2

report.summary: Feature discussion: Blockchain verified conversations
report.label: None yet
report.description: This discussion really applies to the entire Signal stack, but it had to put someplace. Also, I'm not entirely sure signal doesn't already have something like this. Signal does a great job at client e2e encryption. People mostly seem excited about it's ability to prevent people from listening in on conversations. Aside from encryption GPG also gives us verification that the message originated from a specific individual. I'm curious, what is that verification was taken one step further? What if a blockchain (of sorts) was kept for each conversation? This way, we enforce the order in which messages were sent and most importantly that message b came directly after message a. Deletion or insertion of messages after the fact would not be possible. Such an implementation would ensure a conversation remains the same between all parties involved and that no individual could inject or remove parts of conversations without the other parties involved noticing. An example of something like this is how git handles commits. Each commit contains a hash of the current commit (and diff) and the hash of the previous commit. A simple program can then run against the commits to verify the repo is in good order. In Signal's case, a central authority would be necessary. So the hash chain would probably need to exist on the server. The clients can sync against the hash chain and verify their local conversations match the server's. Thoughts?

report.summary: Update to/ Installation of newest version breaks system
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I updated some apps from the Play Store yesterday, shortly after the Signal update started, the Cyanogenmod boot animation was displayed (notification bar and on-screen buttons on top, but unresponsive). I waited a few minutes until I hard rebooted the phone. After booting, the regular "Enter PIN" screen + background was displayed shortly, then again the background changed to the boot animation and the device became unresponsive to touchscreen input. A few seconds later the background changed to black. I rebooted several times, wiped cache and Dalvik cache from CWM, but to no avail. I finally did a factory reset, after which the phone worked normally again. Assuming the issue wasn't due to this specific update, I later reinstalled Signal from the Play Store, which resulted in a broken system all over again. Steps to reproduce Update or install current Signal version (on CM11) Actual result: Boot animation is displayed and system becomes unresponsive Expected result: Signal is updated/installed Device info Device: Sony Xperia Z1 Compact Android version: 4.4.4 (CM 11-20141112-SNAPSHOT-M12-amami) Signal version: 4.11.5 Link to debug log NA

report.summary: Friend doesn't receive messages after deleting Signal
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: [ X ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates [ X ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When a friend who has Signal uninstalls the app, but does not delete their account, and I continue to send them messages through Signal, they will not receive the messages. But it causes great confusion and it is particularly challenging for people who aren't tech-savvy. It seems there should be a way for Signal to send to a user's default messaging app in the case that they don't have Signal installed on their phone.

report.summary: Messages send after a received SMS should not default to Signal message replies
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When Signal is used as an SMS client, it is frustrating for the user and the recipient of messages in which the recipient has Signal installed but is still using SMS. Many of my contacts have signal installed but still use SMS separately, or use iPhones where they cannot use signal for SMS. When a Signal contact sends me an SMS message, the Signal default is to respond via a Signal message, which is confusing for the other party and inconvenient for the user, who has to remember to change the mode to SMS. This discourages users from using Signal as their SMS client. Steps to reproduce Receive an SMS from a phone number registered with Signal. Actual result: The user responds with a Signal message, which may appear differently on the recipient's device and cause confusion. Expected result: The Signal app should either match the sender's mode of communication (perhaps with a warning about encryption) OR remember the user's preference for that contact across restarts of the app. Screenshots Friend sends an SMS. I reply in Signal without realizing, then re-reply via SMS. Friend sends an SMS. I remember to change the send-mode to SMS, but after an app restart the app is back to the default of sending Signal messages. Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge Android version: 7.0 Signal version: 4.12.3 Link to debug log

report.summary: Can't send messages to people who stopped using Signal
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Attempting to send a message to someone who deleted the app causes the message to never get received. Signal seems to be trying to send the message to the other Signal app, which has been deleted, so they never get it. The app should have an option to switch to SMS/MMS, or should send it as SMS/MMS if the user has been offline for a long period of time, or if the message was not received after a long period of time Steps to reproduce Download Signal on two phones Begin an encrypted messaging session, and send some messages Delete the app on one phone Attempt to send a message using the Signal app to that phone Actual result: The message is never received, and there is no option to switch to SMS/MMS Expected result: There should be an option to switch to SMS/MMS, or it should resend as SMS/MMS if the user was offline for a long period of time, or if messages aren't received for a long period of time. Device info Device: Xiaomi Mi A1 Android version: Nougat Signal version: Unknown (not near my phone right now)

report.summary: Registration per Websocket works, but is not propagated to other users
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When register a new account per websocket, the registration works and I can send push messages to other contacts, but my account is not propagated to other users. This seems to be a problem with version 4.13. I have tried with 4.12 and everything works. I've also tried on two phones with two different numbers (same phone model, OS and apk) with the same results. Existing accounts with websocket connection work with 4.13, too. Steps to reproduce compile Signal 4.13.6 install on a phone without GCM register an account Actual result: Registration works. I can send push messages to other contacts. But other contacts don't see my account and have only the abbility to send SMS. I also tried to link a Signal Desktop installation. The QR-code scan works, but Signal Desktop freezes with "Generating keys" and the phone account is disconnected. A message like this is shown on the phone: Your account seems to be connected on another device. Please register again. Expected result: Other contacts see my account. Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy SII Android version: 7.1.2 Signal version: 4.13.6 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/f8fe91f1bc40e59312833c0ca291d533

report.summary: Can't share from another app to group chat if not one of the 5 most recent conversations
report.label: None yet
report.description: Pretty sure this is a dupe but I'm too tired to share and to annoyed that it's now difficult to share to my Bitmoji only group chat. With a recent update (4.13.6), there's now a new list of conversations that shows up when you're sharing content from another app. With the old behavior you got a list of conversations in order of last received/sent. In the new version you first get your to five last received/sent conversations, then a list of all your contacts. If you would like to share this content with a group that isn't in your top 5, it will now show up in that following contacts list. You'll have to go and send a message to the group separately so that it then shows up in that list. Again I'm half asleep and slightly intoxicated. My apologies if this is a duplicate.

report.summary: [4.14.1] Signal crashes when trying to send sms without sms permissions.
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When I try to send an sms with the sms permissions disabled, Signal crashes. I'm not having sms enabled in Signal however by long pressing the paperclip icon in a conversation I can send an sms. Since 4.14 would support permissions I thought, let's disable the sms permissions for Signal and send an sms by long pressing the paperclip. As a result I got the message "Signal stopped" and it cannot be started again. I first had to enable the sms permissions before I was able to start Signal again. Steps to reproduce Disable sms permissions for Signal In a conversation long press the paperclip so you can send an unsecured sms Send unsecured sms message Actual result: Signal crashes Expected result: After selecting unsecured sms in a conversation I would expect Signal to request the sms permission and after excepting it I would be able to send an sms or if I denied it sms would not be possible. report.summary: Android app no longer able to send, link devices, or even deregister; only receives messages after reboot
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Android app is unable to send messages, open the "link devices" option in settings, or even deregister. Messages are received upon a reboot. Chrome app on desktop continues to work fine. Steps I took Earlier today, everything was fine, and I was chatting away happily via my Android device. I then chatted a bit via the app on my desktop. Walked away from my computer and opened up the Android app again and tried to send a message, but it failed. Attempted to retry, and it failed again. Went back to my computer, and sent a message via the desktop. It was received fine. Got a reply as well. Everything seemed fine from the desktop perspective, but none of the messages were received on my phone. Attempted to open the "linked devices" list and I get a "Network connection failed" error dialog. Attempted to deregister the device, as per https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/216948747-What-do-I-do-if-I-see-Network-connection-failed-, and I get "Error connecting to server!" popping up in the middle-bottom of the screen briefly. Rebooted phone, opened Signal, and the intervening messages all were delivered. Repeated above steps and no messages arrived on my phone and none could be sent. Actual result: The Android app only receives messages after a reboot, and cannot send messages, manage linked devices, or deregister. Expected result: The Android app should be able to send and receive messages normally, open and manage the list of linked devices, and deregister if desired. Note: I'm "still" using the Chrome app on this desktop, having never migrated because the standalone app's GTK usage doesn't play well with my KDE theme or DPI settings. I do have the standalone app installed on another desktop PC (which is how I became aware of the GTK-related problems), and the Chrome app configured on a ChromeOS laptop (which obviously couldn't run the standalone app even if I wanted to there), but I haven't had a chance yet to see if they are also still working. Device info Device: Google Pixel XL (marlin) Android version: 8.0.0 Signal version: 4.13.6 (from Play Store) Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/fc26f282c52288f71392732eb86410f4

report.summary: Pictures sent from Nokia 5 get heavily scaled down (13MP -> 3MP)
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates (searched for "compression", "regression", "nokia 5" and "resolution") read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I have 2 contacts using a Nokia 5 by HMD Global. When they send me full resolution (13 MP) pictures made with their smartphones, I receive scaled down pictures (approximately 3 MP). Other contacts (using iPhones with 12MP-Cameras) can send pictures that I receive just as they were shot in terms of resolution. All pictures were sent via data (not MMS). Let me know if there's additional information that I forgot to include. Thanks! Steps to reproduce find contacts using a Nokia 5 Make them send you a 13MP-picture made with their smartphone (i.e. their camera app) Make them capture and send the debug log receive picture and save to device check the details of the received picture. Actual result: The received picture has a resolution of approximately 3 MP Expected result: The received picture shouldn't have been scaled down that much. Ideally, it would have the same resolution as it was shot. Screenshots Sender's side: Receiver's side: Device info Sending Device: Device: HMD Global TA-1053 (TA-1053_00WW) Android version: 7.1.2 (00WW_3_72A, 00WW_3_72A) Signal version: 4.13.6 Receiving Device: Device: motorola MotoE2 (4G-LTE) (surnia_retde) Android version: 6.0 (3, MPI24.65-39-4) Signal version: 4.13.6 It appears that the issue is still present on Signal 4.14.4. I'm willing to provide more recent debug logs if necessary. Link to debug log Contact 1: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/11a015c6447ad754149f2b1609a6a6f4 Contact 2: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/67939cb7e210fcfee7843d609b242368

report.summary: Crash after accepting permissions for the first time during an incoming call
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Microphone and video permissions are disabled. Signal crashes after going through the permissions prompts that appear on an incoming call. Steps to reproduce Alice disables permissions on Android Bob calls Alice (12:41 PT) Bob sees dialing, then ringing. Alice sees the call on her lock screen and swipes up to answer. Alice sees a Microphone prompt (image 1). Alice taps continue and the prompt is backgrounded and not dismissed. Alice sees the record audio permission prompt (image 2) Alice taps Allow Alice sees the record video permission prompt (image 3) Alice taps Allow Bob sees the call as connected. Bob can not hear Alice. Alice can hear Bob. Alice sees the microphone prompt on the screen as it was originally backgrounded (image 1) Alice taps Continue on the microphone prompt (image 1). Actual result: Signal crashes (image 4) Although crashed, live call icon is still displayed. Audio still transmits from CALLER (BOB). Bob still can not hear Alice. Alice taps the call icon and sees the same crash screen (image 4) Alice hits back and sees the call is fully disconnected. Bob sees call ended after about 5 seconds after the previous step. Expected result: Alice can not hear Bob until all prompts are done. Bob's microphone works after all the prompts are done. And no crash. Screenshots Don’t rely on timestamps from the screenshots. image 1: image 2: image 3: image 4: Device info Device: Google Pixel 2 Android version: 8.1.0 Signal version: 4.14.6 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/e54125a959a46f833130aba70292e447

report.summary: FR: Integrated keyboard input (Google Keyboard spying?)
report.label: None yet
report.description: This may sound (and even be) overly paranoid, but the most advanced encryption in the world is meaningless if using an input method like Google Keyboard, with system-wide microphone access and other permissions. Tonight I had Signal open while watching a discussion on vegetarianism and magically I had a msg populated with "I would die I was sick of being hungry I was sick of beans and rice". I DID NOT write this, or ever discuss this topic with the contact. Perhaps it's just a random coincidence, but it sounds quite a bit like the endless reports alleging Facebook listening in and serving ads based on ambient audio. Regardless if it's a real security concern, it could be a potential one,. A few ideas: Have the option for Signal to use it's own built in keyboard, similar to those meant to circumvent keyloggers. There are apps like Microphone Block and Camera Block for Android which disable the microphone and camera on a system wide basis. Replicating this functionality in Signal for a "Get Smart: Super Paranoia Cone of Silence Mode" would be a great addition for those that trust Signal/OWS, but maybe not Google Keyboard/Android. This still obviously isn't a 100% guarantee, but could help shift the balance from ubiquitous surveillance to highly targeted surveillance (where it should be, and all we can realistically hope for)...

Steps to reproduce Make sure some conversations and groups exist Select a message and try to forward it to a group. Actual result: Groups only appear in the following lists under "recent conversations". This means, if the group does has no recent messages, it cannot be selected here. Alternatively, an extra category "groups" could be introduced alongside "recent conversations" and "contacts". 👍 2

report.summary: After update Signal does not display contacts names
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description After updating from Signal 4.11.5 to 4.14.10, when opened, Signal did not displayed contact names in the messages view(nor in single message view). Instead it displays numbers and all in gray. Signal groups(and colors set in Signal) are kept with name. Steps to reproduce Update Signal Open Signal Wait for DB to be updated Even after reboot or app restart messages are displayed with number instead of name Actual result: Numbers are displayed instead of names Expected result: Names as in contact list shall be visible. Workaround After clicking "new message"(round blue icon with pen) and waiting few minutes(it seems way too long for loading ~100 contacts), the contacts list gets populated(the view seems to get updated only when scrolling). I might have also "pulled down" the list, which seems to refresh it from contacts. Going back to messages view shows contacts properly. Device info Android version: 5.1.1 Signal version: 14.4.10

Assuming you don't know if your recipient is using Signal(why should one even care) it adds unnecessary overhead for searching. When using Signal as default SMS app, this results in clunky UX. Steps to reproduce press round blue icon with pen contacts are sorted by those using Signal and those not using it Actual result: Contacts are separated into Signal and non-Signal. Expected result: Contacts are sorted alphabetically only(or there is an option to enable this). Device info Android version: 5.1.1 Signal version: 14.4.10

report.summary: Domain Fronting for Iran
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description There are a couple of other issues (#6468, #5992 and WhisperSystems/Signal-iOS#2903) about this problem. One of them has been closed and the other two could've been filed in a more structured way so I'm opening this one hoping we can move this conversation forward in a constructive way. The problem is that Google App Engine blocks connection from Iran and this renders the anti censorship feature of signal useless for Iranian people. This is important now as the authorities are trying to shut down all the secure messaging platforms following the uprising and economical protests. Additionally, Telegram, -the main social media and messaging app for Iranian people-, has been blocked recently and this gives us a golden chance to help people adopt Signal. All it takes is to make sure all the Iranian numbers are being routed through a meek server that is not Google. We at Tor, have tested both Azure and Amazon and they work perfectly fine. I assume this is gonna be the same with other major CDNs as well. Steps to reproduce Try to connect to Signal servers from an Iranian IP address Actual result: Connection fails due to censorship. Expected result: OWS needs to either switch to, or add new meek servers on a platform that isn't Google App Engine and Signal should automatically enable censorship circumvention feature for Iranian phone numbers (+98). Device info Device: Any device Android version: Any device both Anodrid and iOS Here are some additional info for the curious mind: https://twitter.com/CDA/status/947556800328433664 and https://twitter.com/mrphs/status/947601608061353984 Please help us to enable and empower millions of vulnerable people to communicate securely with making this change. 👍 34 ❤️ 2

report.summary: Media preview: swipe gesture detection should behave more liberally
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When holding the phone in one hand you will most often end up using that hand's thumb to swipe left and right. Naturally, this results in a gesture slightly diagonal (e.g. from bottom left to top right and vice versa for the right hand) rather than exactly horizontal. The gesture detection fails in this case, since it seems to expect a nearly horizontal move, which is nearly impossible to accomplish in one-hand-usage. Hence, the gesture detection should be more "liberal", if the move direction isn't absolutely accurate. Besides of that, a full screen mode (that can be toggled) would fit in fairly nice. Steps to reproduce open media preview gallery hold phone in one hand and try to use that hand's thumb to swipe left/right Actual result: Gesture detection most often fails to recognize, user gets frustrated Expected result: Gesture detection succeeds to recognize and shows previous/next media Device info Device: Lenovo Moto G 4 Plus (other devices as well) Android version: 7.0 (Android 4.4 as well) Signal version: 4.15.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/4ad7a55db59d9c7c09d8d93b7287e481
